subject: why fake urgency is ethical
body:
I have a much needed haircut in 20 minutes so I have to type fast. 

 Which is a perfect segue for today's lesson: 

 Urgency. 

 If you want people to buy your stuff, you need to provide a reason why now is the right time.
You see marketing ploys that do this regularly. 

 Discounts, bonuses, limited time offers, scarcity, and when all else fails… 

 Tell your audience that the opportunity is fleeting and if they hesitate they’ll be a matrix slave forever. 

 The truth is, most urgency is a facade. 

 A copywriter came up with an angle and made it sound good. 

 If it’s effective, it gets the people who were on the fence to take action. 

 Now I’m not saying that all angles or tactics are lies. 

 But rather, in reality, there is no reason to do anything urgently. 

 You could wait till tomorrow, three weeks from now, 6 months from now, or even 10 years. 

 There is always a reason why now is not the right time. 

 And that’s why urgency in marketing is important. 

 You’re fighting the imaginary demons in your audience's head. 

 Let’s say you want to change your life and start a business. 

 You go back and forth between business models. 

 You convince yourself you need to learn more and you hesitate to take any action. 

 You tell yourself that once XYZ happens, you’ll be in a better position to attack it with full force. 

 I’ve been there. 

 When I was in college, I got a tattoo on my left forearm that says “if not now, when?” 

 Because I understood that nothing happens until I make it happen and the perfect opportunity I was waiting for doesn’t exist. 

 It will never exist. 

 And until you beat this into your head, you will wait. 

 You will find a new reason why you can’t do what you want, live how you want, and be who you want. 

 Now will never be the “right” time, but it will always be the only time. 

 Sure new opportunities may be around forever. 

 The ‘limited spots’ angle might be a gimmick. 

 The discount will probably reactivate in a month or two. 

 And the special bonuses might be something everyone gets anyway. 

 But you and I both know there’s no perfect time to start anything. 

 In fact, most of the decisions I’ve made that resulted in the most growth were completely impulsive and somewhat manic. 

 I got tired of waiting and followed an inkling in my gut. 

 ​ Maybe it’s time for you to do the same. ​ 

 Boom. 

 That’s how urgency is created. 

 Love you, 

 Ben 

 ​
​

subject: How to close $10k/month clients
body:
I just sat in front of the camera for 30 minutes trying to make a
Youtube video.

Typically once I get the camera out and start talking, coherent
sentences start to come out.

But today, that didn’t happen.

I stumbled over my words.

I’d start talking for a minute and then lose my train of thought.

And eventually I was ready to throw my camera off the balcony.

So, I quit.

subject: How to close $10k/month clients
body:
I just sat in front of the camera for 30 minutes trying to make a Youtube video. 

 Typically once I get the camera out and start talking, coherent sentences start to come out. 

 But today, that didn’t happen. 

 I stumbled over my words. 

 I’d start talking for a minute and then lose my train of thought. 

 And eventually I was ready to throw my camera off the balcony. 

 So, I quit. 

 Very inspirational, I know. 

 Instead, I’ll write to you about what I was attempting to say in the video. 

 Let’s talk about how to get good clients that will pay you lots of money on rev shares. 

 This is a code that once you crack, getting past $50k or even $100k per month becomes easy. 

 But before you get to this stage, you have to go through the trenches. 

 At first, you’re limited to the bottom of the barrel. 

 Those clients who want to negotiate on price or refuse to pay any money up front. 

 I had my fair share of these, but I made the most of them. 

 I still went above and beyond, using it as an opportunity to sharpen my skills and build case studies. 

 That was crucial. 

 It put me in a position where I had some results to show for, which gave me leverage to get rev shares. 

 The first lucrative deal I got was with a client who I had on a $3k retainer just for email. 

 I proposed a webinar funnel to him and asked for 10% of the rev we generate from that funnel. 

 He agreed. 

 The next month he paid me $10k and my biggest month with him was $18k. 

 That was a lightbulb moment. 

 I figured if I could do that, I could get even bigger and better clients on rev shares. 

 I did, and now I’ve been paid up to $50k in a month from single clients. 

 If you want to scale an info-product agency, this is how it’s done. 

 Grind outreach until you get some shitty clients. 

 Do everything in your power to get results for them (even if you’re underpaid). 

 Use that as leverage to get rev share deals with good clients. 

 Next thing you know, you’ll make an average annual salary from one client. 

 Boom. 

 ​ Go here if you want me to show you exactly how it’s done. ​ 

 Talk tomorrow, 

 Ben 

 ​

subject: Stop trying to get rev shares
body:
bo, let’s talk business.

I have a secret to tell you.

It’s a secret that may alter your current view of the
info-product space.

And it especially applies to you if you’re trying to get clients.

Here it is:

It is extremely unlikely that you close a good client on a rev
share.

This notion that the best way to work with creators is to get
them on a 30-50% rev share and run their entire backend is a
pipedream.

Almost no good potential client would agree to that.

Plus most of the good ones are already working with someone like
me, Pierre, Bo, one of my students, or they have an in-house
team.

But that doesn’t mean you’re cooked.

It means you have to work your way up to rev shares.

The way to do this is to find small gaps in info-product
businesses instead of going for the whole pie.

Think of yourself as a marketer, not a growth operator.

Your goal is to solve one problem, earn trust, and then solve
other problems.

That’s how you eventually end up on a rev share where you can
make $10k+ from a single client.

But that doesn’t happen overnight, it happens when you “earn your
stripes.”

If I started all over, there are three services I’d mainly be
pitching right now:

1. Email copywriting

2. VSL scripting and funnel build

3. Short form scripts

Those are all easy to learn and they get your foot in the door.

You can get an upfront fee or a retainer to start.

Once that goes well, you then start to offer other services and
take over more elements to your clients business.

Two years ago, I hit my first $25k month doing exactly this.

I didn’t have any big “whale" clients.

It consisted of a few email retainers, and I closed a couple
clients that needed new VSL funnels.

I went above and beyond for my clients, and that’s how I
eventually got rev shares.

The point I’m trying to make here is this:

Do not put yourself in a box.

Pitch email retainers, VSLs, scripts, funnels, etc.

Once you get some experience, you'll have more leverage.

That's when you can get rev shares.

By then you'll have results to show for, and actually become a
skilled marketer.

Skills last forever, “business models” do not.

​Join me over here if you’re ready to build your Info-product
agency. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/75u8gdmwq5s8hkx0g70szhw6mv966tn/m2h7h5h8ppo95rsm/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​
​

subject: you asked, i answered
body:
I did a Q&A yesterday on new business Instagram (follow here). (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/38umv9xlk7ukhok4qqvhrh4nzx2nns7/08hwh9hd535pvmul/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuaW5zdGFncmFtLmNvbS9iZW5vbmJ1c2luZXNzLw==
)

There were too many questions to get through all of them on IG,
so I’ll be answering more here.

Let’s get it:

What’s something about you that hasn’t changed after being
financially free?

Nothing.

Money doesn’t change you, it serves as a tool that allows you to
be more of who you already were.

I’ve become more comfortable expressing my true self as I’ve had
financial success.

It was always there, I just didn’t have the confidence to show it
until I proved to myself that I could design my life however I
wanted.

Did your college friends get what you were doing at the time you
dropped out?

Sort of.

They didn’t know all the details, but they knew I was running
some form of marketing business.

Not to throw shade at all, but I was actually surprised how few
of them were curious enough to ask.

Once they graduated and started normal jobs, more have reached
out asking for info.

Do you do low and high ticket offers with your clients that make
over $100k/month?

Almost all high ticket offers.

In 95% of cases, having a low ticket offer is quite dumb.

Only caveats are when its purpose is to liquidate ad spend, the
personal brand has a huge audience, or the offer doesn’t have a
direct ROI (teaching a hobby).

How do you lock in and work when you don’t feel like it?

I’ve always been horrible at doing things I don’t want to do.

But my biggest leaps in business have been made when I can get
over that initial resistance.

Starting anything from scratch is difficult.

That’s natural. If you expect it to be easy, you’ll quit.

But on the other side of resistance, you start moving with the
tide.

The work starts to feel like peace and you develop this love for
progress.

It’s one of the most beautiful emotional states that you can
access in life.

But you have to earn it by getting over that resistance in the
beginning.

So either do the work, or be a pussy forever lol.

Ok last one - there were a bunch of questions about doing
outreach.

And this is the problem.

You’re looking for an “outreach system.”

This is why every pitch I see absolutely sucks.

You’re trying to rush the process as if you’re attempting to get
a girl to go home with you 3 minutes into a date.

It’s creepy and you didn’t demonstrate any value or status.

Why would someone trust you?

The only outreach tip you’ll ever need is to use your brain.

If you’re competent, you’ll figure out a way to get in touch with
people.

If you’re not, well someones gotta flip the burgers.

I know that’s a bit harsh but it’s the truth.

Thanks again for all the questions, sorry if I didn’t get to
yours.

​Anyway, check out this new interview I did with Sean, one of my
mastermind members. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/38umv9xlk7ukhok4qqvhrh4nzx2nns7/8ghqhohlvmv7zlik/aHR0cHM6Ly95b3V0dS5iZS85dVlpZjBleWlMdz9zaT1oNEFrU2d3dlE3VTJfODNm
)​

He’s making $30k/mo working with some big names like Charlie
Morgan and Joel Kaplan.

See you over there,

Ben

​
​

) | Update your profile (

subject: How to live by your own rules
body:
I turned 24 yesterday and now people are calling me “Unc.”

Please stop.

Unc status doesn’t happen until 27 at the earliest.

Thank you to everyone who wished me a happy birthday.

However, I do have a problem with some of you.

You know how you’ll have a cousin or old friend that you only
text on birthdays?

The text chain will be like:

“Happy birthday bo!”

“Thank you!”

*year passes*

“HBD! Hope you’re doing well!”

“You too, bo!”

Yeah, that shit needs to stop.

If you go two years where your texts with someone only consist of
birthday wishes, lets just all agree to end it there.

Ok?

Good.

This sounds like a Seinfeld bit.

Anyway, I’ve now written 120 words without saying anything of
value.

The biggest lesson I internalized in my 23rd year of life is that
there is no rulebook.

You can truly live however you want.

Which is freeing, yet terrifying.

I don’t think most people want to accept that truth.

Because then, you become the author.

You have to take everything into your own hands, and make your
own rules.

It’s easier to follow the standard of those around you.

I ‘side quested’ a lot over the past 12 months.

I started hobbies and pursuits that didn’t impact the number in
my bank account, but felt right.

In these quests, I learned a lot about myself and became more
comfortable showing who I am.

Although this didn’t push me ahead in this imaginary game we’re
all playing, it made me feel like I’m winning.

It’s my own game, with my own rules and scoreboard.

I learned that I could decide what I wanted and go get it.

There’ve been challenges, twists, turns, and everything in
between.

It’s been a fun year, but not an easy one – although it may look
that way on social media.

But maybe that’s the goal?

Life will always come with roadblocks and hurdles, but as long as
they are conducive to a mission that is your own, that’s okay.

You don’t want to lose yourself fighting someone else’s battle.

As Dostoevsky said, “Your worst sin is that you have destroyed
and betrayed yourself for nothing.”

You have to continuously and intentionally grab life by the
balls.

Design the reality you want.

And the hardships that come with it are building you into the
character who is capable of accepting it.

​Just keep moving, (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hpd5w80f8h82ekw22bl/25h2hoh2zxv7vdh3/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​
​

Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hpd5w80f8h82ekw22bl
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hpd5w80f8h82ekw22bl
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hpd5w80f8h82ekw22bl/qvh8h7hr53787qhl/aHR0cHM6Ly9jb252ZXJ0a2l0LmNvbS9mZWF0dXJlcy9lbWFpbC1tYXJrZXRpbmc_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPXBvd2VyZWRieSZ1dG1fY29udGVudD1lbWFpbCZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPXJlZmVycmFsJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9ZHluYW1pYw==
)

 You have to continuously and intentionally grab life by the balls. 

 Design the reality you want. 

 And the hardships that come with it are building you into the character who is capable of accepting it. 

 ​ Just keep moving, ​ 

 Ben 

 ​

subject: The 2 elements of success
body:
Good morning, bo.

You know, success is really simple.

There are only two things you actually need.

Everything else is just noise.

The first thing is you have to be smart… enough.

Being smart enough doesn’t mean you’re wicked smart.

It means you can walk and talk at the same time.

It means you can figure out how to use Google when you don’t have
an answer.

It means you can consume simple information and understand it.

90% of people I meet are smart enough.

The problem is most people doubt themselves.

They feel unprepared to start.

They over contemplate every potential action.

They think success is supposed to be difficult, so they avoid
taking the obvious actions that will push them towards their
goals.

So sure, you have to be smart enough – but you also have to be
dumb enough to trust yourself.

The second element of success is this:

You have to consistently work.

Notice how I didn’t say work hard.

But literally just work consistently.

Genuinely, making your first $10k online isn’t difficult.

Even making $100k in a month isn’t difficult once you’re in the
right position.

It’s just a battle of distractions.

Can you consistently take one or two actions daily over an
extended period of time?

Or will you get distracted, discouraged, or lose ‘motivation’ and
tell yourself you need to find something you’re more passionate
about?

If you can resist the latter, eventually you win.

And this doesn’t mean you’re going “balls the wall” working 16
hour days.

But rather that you’ve identified your highest ROI tasks and
committed to them.

For example, say you want to build an info-product agency.

Once you learn enough about copywriting and marketing (which can
take a week or two), there’s one main thing you should do every
day…

Outreach.

That’s it.

If you send pitches daily and make a concerted effort to improve
your pitches, you will get a client.

You don’t know when, but it will happen.

You just have to work consistently.

And if you’re smart enough to understand this email, you’re good.

Now, you just have to be dumb enough to get out of your own way
when you want to perfect every little detail instead of taking
action.

​You ready to get rich now? (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh07wrk7fkhk9q4599c3/x0hph6hw6gq8moc5/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Godspeed,

Ben

P.S. If you’re a complete newbie to online business, I have
something exciting coming for you.

If you hit ‘reply’ and say the word “info” there’s a good chance
I’ll tell you about it tomorrow.

Hint – Pierre Khoury and I have been working on… a powerpoint
presentation ;)

​
​

subject: heyyyyy
body:
Ben here,

Congrats bo, you just made a great decision.

You’re all signed up for my free class with Pierre on Thursday at
7pm EST.

And yes, it’ll actually be live.

Before the class, there are some things I want to share with you,
so stick with me for a sec, okay?

First things first, this information has the potential to change
your life.

We’re gonna be sharing the full blueprint on how we’ve built
info-product agencies that have given us our dream lives.

Real quick, if you’re newer here, this is how our businesses
work:

* We find influencers who are selling online courses and
coaching.
* We identify where there are gaps in their business and solve
them.
* They pay us a monthly retainer and/or rev share because we’re
directly helping them make more money.

Make sense?

Good.

Both Pierre and I work with a handful of clients at a time.

I’ve made over $100k/month doing this and Pierre over $50k/month.

The reason it works is because it’s NOT a business model.

It’s a skill set.

With this skill set, you become a versatile asset to any
business.

This not only only allows you to charge thousands of dollars per
month, but it also makes you recession-proof.

And on the free class we’re gonna be showing you the exact steps
you need to take to put yourself in this position.

This can turn you into a money printer.

I promise.

Not long ago, I was a lost frat bro with no direction in life.

I figured the successful people online were either scammers or
they were smarter than me.

But I started taking action, I built my skill set, and now I’m
here.

subject: Success is an accident
body:
“Your success is largely dependent on your ability to shut out
the voice that tries to talk you out of action. There will always
be reasons to go back to the drawing board. But it’s impossible
to intellectualize your way to a goal. Sometimes you just have to
jump.” - Ben Bader

Yes, I just quoted myself.

Because there’s one thing I want to drill into your head on this
beautiful Friday:

YOU WILL NEVER BE READY.

You’ll never be ready to start a business.

You’ll never be ready to take up a new hobby.

You’ll never be ready to get into a relationship.

Please discard the idea that one day all of the stars will align
and you’ll end up with the perfect opportunity to start something
new.

Progress doesn’t work like that.

Almost all of my best opportunities have felt like accidents.

When I first started making some money, I was doing freelance
videography.

That led me into the agency world.

I then started a lead gen agency for basketball trainers.

That led me into the info-product space.

By then, I’d started posting on Twitter and built connections.

Those connections ended up getting me clients.

I didn’t plan any of this. It’d be impossible to do so.

But throughout that time, I accumulated assets.

I became a skilled marketer.

My network grew.

My personal brand became more prevalent.

Action created the perfect storm.

I didn’t wait for it.

But before that, I wasted so much time trying to plan the perfect
route.

It’s a fool's game.

If you resonate with what I’m saying and you find yourself
looking for the perfect business model or waiting for some
magical moment to start, I empathize with you.

I wanted to know exactly how it’d all work out before I started.

I’d sit at my desk mapping out the exact steps I’d take to hit
$10k months.

I’d bounce from one project to the next telling myself that I
just needed the right vehicle.

But eventually I realized that intellectualization is NOT a
substitute for action.

It’s a way to make yourself feel productive without being
productive.

And it won’t get you any closer to where you want to be.

Just jump and trust that you’ll grow your wings on the way down.

Are we clear?

I hope so.

​If you want to take that first step towards action, this can
help you. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h3p60gxbqhp382733hr/3ohphkh75o5rdzbr/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuaW5mb3Byb2R1Y3RhZ2VuY3kuY28vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
)​

Have a good weekend,

Ben

​
​

​

subject: The best “business model” doesn’t exist
body:
When you’re a beginner, you typically think you need to find the
right business model.

In reality, it’s not the label that’s important.

Whether you’re a copywriter, IPGA, IPO, growth operator, growth
partner, etc.

All of these terms are different ways to say the same thing.

You offer ‘done for you’ services to online businesses.

This is important to understand because a business model doesn’t
make you money, your skill set does.

People like me and Pierre, have found success because we can
offer a multitude of services and truly increase revenue.

It’s definitely NOT because of a fancy label we placed on our
services.

This brings me to my second point, which is that the market
decides your niche.

In my business, our biggest wins have come through webinars.

It’s the main reason I’ve gotten to 6 figure months.

But that happened by accident.

We tested a webinar for a client and it worked.

We figured we’d try it out for other clients and it kept working.

That doesn’t mean that your business has to work the same way as
mine.

Your big wins could come through VSLs.

Or you could figure out that you’re really good at scripting YT
videos or short form content.

Or maybe you end up specializing in email automations.

My point here is that we’ll teach you how to be a marketer, not a
robot.

If you label yourself as a ‘growth operator’ and you’ll only work
with creators who have an audience but don’t have an offer yet,
your TAM (total addressable market) is limited.

But if you drop the label and think of yourself as a marketer,
you can fit into different roles.

That’s how you get your foot in the door with a client (solve one
niche problem they’re facing) and then you start to take over
other pieces of their business.

Get one big win, and you have a solidified offer.

This doesn’t happen overnight, but it’s the best way to do it if
you wanna work with coaches and course creators.

Learn some skills, pitch a bunch of stuff, see what works, double
down.

This is exactly what you’ll learn on Thursdays free class.

Instead of giving you a fish, (business model) we’ll teach you
how to fish (a skill set).

Hope you’re ready :)

Ben

P.S. If you haven't already, save this link to join the live
class: https://event.webinarjam.com/go/live/2/mzl1rtzi8srsg (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/n4u0kgn5wzhqu4zk4vc6h6g0e5ggul/x0hph6hwvpn8zqb5/aHR0cHM6Ly9ldmVudC53ZWJpbmFyamFtLmNvbS9nby9saXZlLzIvbXpsMXJ0emk4c3JzZw==
)​

​

subject: How to avoid a miserable life
body:
It’s Monday.

Because of this, I feel an added pressure to be productive.

But before I start rambling, I need something from you.

If you’re not signed up for my free class this Thursday, you
either don’t like money or your thumbs don’t work properly.

​Use your thumb to click this and go save your spot now. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/n4u0kgn5wzhvh8lp6mdc6h6g0e5ggul/6qheh8h786vep6ho/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuaW5mb3Byb2R1Y3RhZ2VuY3kuY28vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
)​

It’ll be a full masterclass on copywriting, launching offers,
getting clients, etc.

Be there, or be poor.

Anyway, let's talk about “the flinch.”

This is something you need to avoid at all costs.

It will keep you on the sidelines forever.

Your exuberant spirit will be suppressed and depleted.

And no matter what you do, you’ll always have this lingering
anxiety in the back of your head.

It’ll take you out of the present moment and taint everything you
experience.

Unless…

You get over it.

Here’s how:

When you start something new or make a big change, you’ll reach a
point where you want to hit the brakes.

This is where your mind starts to reason with you.

You’ll begin talking yourself out of taking action and use
“intuition” as the scapegoat.

“Hey I know I said I was gonna commit to this new endeavor but
now that we’re here, it doesn’t feel right.”

Bullshit.

That’s not your intuition telling you there's a better route for
you.

It’s your ego trying to protect itself.

Change is scary and there’s a part of you that will do everything
in its power to resist change.

This is where most people flinch.

They go back to the drawing board.

They look for a different solution.

They blame their lack of progress on external factors.

But what happens if you get over the flinch?

You stand there calmly, as the pocket collapses around you,
resisting the urge to cower.

You see a receiver downfield and let go of the ball.

For the first time in your life, you let it fly.

Maybe it gets caught for a touchdown.

Or maybe it gets intercepted.

But guess what?

You’ve now accessed one of the most beautiful games life has to
offer…

You got off the sidelines and you’re in the arena.

And you’re finally taking shots that can lead you to success.

Now as long as you stay there, one of them will eventually hit.

Your receiver will catch the ball and you’ll hit you’ll dance
together in the endzone.

It’ll happen eventually, IF you start firing.

​It all starts by getting over the flinch. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/n4u0kgn5wzhvh8lp6mdc6h6g0e5ggul/6qheh8h786vep6ho/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuaW5mb3Byb2R1Y3RhZ2VuY3kuY28vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
)​

Ben

​
​

​

subject: 3 ways to be a better communicator
body:
If there’s one skill that leads to success in nearly domain, it’s
this:

The ability to communicate.

It impacts your dating life, friendships, content, sales, and
just about any other human interaction you have.

Over the past two years, I’ve become a much more effective
communicator.

I used to be timid.

You could hear a lack of confidence in my voice.

I’d overthink nearly every word that came out of my mouth in an
attempt to present myself as someone I wasn’t.

This is how most people end up living their entire lives.

It’s rare to meet someone who is articulate and thoughtful.

Like anything, you won’t get better at communicating with others
unless you get a lot of reps.

And that doesn’t include the pre-programmed responses that are
embedded into your head when people ask about your day.

In my experience, there are three ways to improve your
communication skills.

1. Writing

2. Making video content

3. “High pressure” interactions like a sales call or date

Take a second and ask yourself when was the last time you did any
of the three things above.

And if it was recent, are you getting reps daily?

If not, that needs to change.

Consider that last interaction you had with someone who you’d
deem a good communicator.

How was their energy?

Did they seem content in the life they’re living?

Did you feel good around them?

Odds are, that conversation was a breath of fresh air.

And this is the reason I’m telling you all of this.

To get anything you want in life, you need to demonstrate your
value.

If you can’t do that, it doesn't matter how smart or kind you
are.

It’s like being a basketball player who’s incredibly skilled but
doesn’t perform well in real games.

All of the work is eradicated by the fact that it isn’t presented
when it matters.

Don’t let that be you…

​He who communicates most effectively, wins. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hd04m0mcrh89q2e99cm/e0hph7h03nn9woa8/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuaW5mb3Byb2R1Y3RhZ2VuY3kuY28vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
)​

Ben

​
​

​

subject: Re: your first step
body:
Yo yo, 

 Today’s the day. 

 This is your last chance to guarantee you get a spot on my free live class at 7pm EST. 

 ​ Go here to RSVP now. ​

 Candidly, I’ve had a lot of fun preparing tonight’s training for you. 

 It’s forced me to dissect every element of my business and break it down to the fundamentals. 

 To be completely honest, getting to where I am with this agency takes a while. 

 It’s not for beginners. 

 And after making around 100k per month for over a year now it’s been a difficult journey. 

 But on this class, my goal isn’t to teach you how to get to where I’m at. 

 My goal is to show you how you can use the same skill set to get your first client and scale to $5-10k per month. 

 This is something anyone can do in the next 90 days. 

 You don’t have to be an expert or build a personal brand like me. 

 You just have to learn the right skill set and you can start landing clients tomorrow. 

 ​ This will be your first step. ​

 See you at 7pm EST. 

 Don’t be late :) 

 Ben 

 ​
​ 

 ​

subject: How to justify your spending problem
body:
Hey,

This is my first email since last Thursday's free class.

If you were there, I hope you enjoyed it and learned a lot.

If you weren’t, sorry for your loss.

Before I get into todays email, quick heads up:

The price of Artisan Lab is increasing in a few days.

We’ve got some absolute studs in there who are crushing.

Kidous closed a $6k retainer plus 10% rev share.

​
Otavio hit his first $50k month.

​
Dean closed his first info-product client less than 48 hours
after joining.

​
​Check out more wins and apply before the price increase by going
here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/zluew470l3hnh4mgqdlhphw09qg00c6/58hvh7hmd7weg8s6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Moving on…

There’s a hurricane coming.

It’ll likely miss Miami, but the weather will consist of gray
skies and clouds all week.

So yesterday, I decided to flee.

I texted my friend Mason and asked if he wanted to join me.

And then opened my phone and started looking at flights to LA.

But as we looked, we ran into a problem.

There weren’t any nonstop first class flights until Wednesday.

We hopped on a facetime call and the conversation went as
follows:

Me: “This is fucked.”

Mason: “Well, we do have alternative options…”

Me: “How much would a jet be to LA?”

Mason: “Let me text my guy right now.”

Jet’s now booked and we’re flying out at 5pm.

I’m mostly telling you this to flex, but also to show you how
cool it is to increase the amount of money that feels expendable
to you.

I’ve spent a lot of money over the last year.

I’ve wasted a lot of money on dumb shit.

But this has shown me how replaceable it can be.

It isn’t a scarce resource that I need to cling onto.

When I spend freely, it comes back to me.

Now, I’m not encouraging you to spend more than you have.

However, if you occasionally splurge on experiences it can help
you conceptualize larger amounts of money, thus helping you make
more.

Or maybe I’m writing all of this to justify my spending problem.

Who knows, I gotta pack for LA.

​Go here to check out Artisan Lab before the price raises. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/zluew470l3hnh4mgqdlhphw09qg00c6/58hvh7hmd7weg8s6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Talk soon,

Ben

​
​

​

subject: The rational man takes "risks"
body:
Hello from a coffee shop in LA.

I’m sitting outside with a large iced vanilla latte that has a
bit too much milk in it.

Let’s talk about risk.

Recently, one of my newest students in Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hd27599brh89q2e99cm/x0hph6hwvkdlk0s5/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) got a client within 48 hours of joining.

He closed someone on a VSL script and funnel.

As of right now, he has no idea how to do this.

But he figured he’d close the deal anyway and use the resources
inside my mastermind to learn what he needs on the fly.

How irresponsible and misleading, right?

Let’s weigh the potential outcomes here:

Best case scenario, he builds a solid VSL funnel (which should be
easy because he has me as a resource) and the client is happy.

They continue working together and it makes him 5-6 figures over
the next year.

Worst case scenario, he builds the worst funnel in the world, the
client hates it and fires him.

And then…

He goes back to the way his life was before.

Now with a rep under his belt, knowing what he needs to improve.

That's it.

Meaning the worst case scenario is still a win.

This is how most “risks” actually work.

They’re win-win situations, and the only way you lose is by not
taking them.

When you think critically about it, this is the rational way to
operate.

A few years ago when I dropped out of college, here’s how I saw
it:

I could stay in school, get my degree and hope I find a job that
makes me over $40k per year when I graduate.

I’d be absolutely miserable but at least no one would look at me
like I was crazy.

That would be the “safe” route.

Or I could drop out of college and take the “risky” route.

I’d try to make this online business thing work and if it does,
my life would be changed forever.

Over the next few years I’d end up making multi-7 figures, move
to Miami with my best friends, inspire thousands of people
online, buy a porsche 911 turbo, and book a private jet across
the country because it was raining.

Obviously that’s how it ended up ;)

But even when I looked at the potential downside, it’s not bad.

Let’s say I didn’t get online business to work.

I accept the fact that I have the IQ of an ape and go move back
in with my parents.

Maybe I’d use the skills I learned while trying to start a
business to get a decent job.

Maybe I’d do doordash and spend my free time in the sun.

Maybe I’d go back to school and get my degree.

And now, at least I can close my eyes at night knowing I wasn’t
supposed to build a business because I actually tried and it
didn’t work out.

Getting that clarity is a win.

When you break it down like this, NOTHING is risky.

It’s all an illusion!

They don’t want you to be rich, famous and handsome.

But you’re here and you’re still reading this.

​And that means you’re meant for more. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hd27599brh89q2e99cm/x0hph6hwvkdlk0s5/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Love you,

Ben

​
​

) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hd27599brh89q2e99cm

subject: how to enjoy life even though there's work to do
body:
“It was the best of times. If only someone had told me.” - Hank
Moody in Californication

What makes you happy?

Well, let me rephrase that:

If you were watching the sunset on the beach with your best
friends, what would you need to have completed to fully enjoy
that moment?

Let’s break this down.

Would you be thinking about the work you haven’t finished,
answered emails, or the thing you told yourself you’d do but
haven’t gotten around to?

Would you let that thought take you out of the present moment and
cloud what could’ve been a beautiful, unique experience?

This is a position I often find myself in.

My life is the exact way I formerly dreamt of.

The freedom, relationships, lifestyle, and impact are the things
I wanted years ago.

Yet I still find myself ‘missing it’ sometimes.

And by that, I mean not appreciating the good times because I’m
in my head contemplating a decision or feeling guilty because I
didn’t accomplish a task.

It’s a cloud that can feel everpresent.

But when I think about this, the solution is quite simple:

Do the things that make me feel productive and fulfill my
creative desire.

That’s it.

If I do those things, I can enjoy my life.

If I don’t, I can’t.

It doesn't matter where I am, who I’m with, or what I’m doing.

My unfinished business will sit in the back of my mind like a
parasite.

I could be across the table from the most beautiful girl I’ve
ever seen while she yaps about her hair, makeup, or whatever
women talk about.

Instead of listening, I’d be thinking about the text I got three
weeks ago that I didn’t reply to.

Or the fact that I didn’t write an email that day.

Or the random side quest that I promised myself I would start and
haven’t.

This sound familiar?

It’s impossible to be happy if you fail to do the things that
make you feel accomplished.

Many of which may have nothing to do with financial gain.

But that desire sits in your soul for a reason.

It’s a thirst you must quench to be able to live freely.

The alternative is a life where you’ve entrapped yourself in your
own mind.

You’re on the sidelines, watching yourself pretend to be happy.

But if you can just identify the few things you need to do to
turn each day into a ‘win,’ that cloud will go away.

You won’t let unfinished business ruin your peace…

​And you’ll fully experience the fruits of your labor. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqhken0e2bvhqr65wrrto/wnh2hghw2p8dp3b7/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Let’s have a good week,

Ben

​
​

) | Update your profile (

subject: How to make progress as fast as possible
body:
Hey bo,

I’m sitting on my balcony writing to you on a beautiful day here
in Miami.

There’s a common dilemma that everyone faces when trying to build
a business.

It’s the thing that drastically slows down or halts progress
entirely.

And it’s this idea that business has to be complicated.

We often look for complex solutions to simple problems in order
to avoid action.

Odds are, you know what step you need to take right now.

If you’re trying to get clients in the info-product space, it’s
pretty simple:

1. Learn about copywriting and marketing

2. Start doing as much quality outreach as possible

3. Close a client, get good results and repeat

But maybe you’re telling yourself you’re not ready.

You need to learn more or find some outreach system that you’re
currently unaware of.

That’s your mind playing tricks on you.

In reality, you’re scared to start because you don’t know what
you don’t know.

And committing to this process will require you to step into a
new version of yourself.

It’s the version of you who doesn’t hesitate and knows you can
figure things out on the fly.

With this, comes additional pressure.

“What if I get a client and run into a problem?”

“What if my outreach is horrible?”

It’s easier to stay where you are (and who you are) now while
fooling yourself into thinking that you’re not ready.

There’s a harsh truth of the universe that you need to
understand:

You will never be entirely prepared for anything.

The stars will never align perfectly until you take the imperfect
action.

You can wait forever.

And you’ll sit there, watching others who are no different from
you get the results that you could’ve gotten, if you had the
balls to start.

This is something I’ve learned while coaching the members inside
of Artisan Lab. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/68u8vxpw9qs8hk46m3xhohpk8g0kkh9/e0hph7h0336knlc8/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

The biggest value I’m able to provide people with is conviction.

Because they’ve paid me for coaching, they value the messenger
more than the message.

Meaning if I just confirm to someone that the logical action is
right (even if they already knew that) my conviction and
assurance is enough to get them to actually do it.

The secret is understanding that there is no secret, and you’re
as prepared now as you’ll ever need to be.

It’s a cliche, but an accurate one.

Progress is simple.

Just actually do the thing that you know you need to do.

Anyway, I dropped this video yesterday that people seem to really
enjoy. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/68u8vxpw9qs8hk46m3xhohpk8g0kkh9/7qh7h8ho22q048sz/aHR0cHM6Ly95b3V0dS5iZS9sVk5XRk50YzZ2NA==
)​

See you over there,

Ben

P.S. Here’s your last chance to get into Artisan Lab before the
price goes up (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/68u8vxpw9qs8hk46m3xhohpk8g0kkh9/e0hph7h0336knlc8/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

 But maybe you’re telling yourself you’re not ready. 

 You need to learn more or find some outreach system that you’re currently unaware of. 

 That’s your mind playing tricks on you. 

 In reality, you’re scared to start because you don’t know what you don’t know. 

 And committing to this process will require you to step into a new version of yourself. 

 It’s the version of you who doesn’t hesitate and knows you can figure things out on the fly. 

 With this, comes additional pressure. 

 “What if I get a client and run into a problem?” 

 “What if my outreach is horrible?” 

 It’s easier to stay where you are (and who you are) now while fooling yourself into thinking that you’re not ready. 

 There’s a harsh truth of the universe that you need to understand: 

 You will never be entirely prepared for anything. 

 The stars will never align perfectly until you take the imperfect action. 

 You can wait forever. 

 And you’ll sit there, watching others who are no different from you get the results that you could’ve gotten, if you had the balls to start. 

 This is something I’ve learned while coaching the members inside of Artisan Lab. ​ 

 The biggest value I’m able to provide people with is conviction. 

 Because they’ve paid me for coaching, they value the messenger more than the message. 

 Meaning if I just confirm to someone that the logical action is right (even if they already knew that) my conviction and assurance is enough to get them to actually do it. 

 The secret is understanding that there is no secret, and you’re as prepared now as you’ll ever need to be. 

 It’s a cliche, but an accurate one. 

 Progress is simple. 

 Just actually do the thing that you know you need to do. 

 Anyway, I dropped this video yesterday that people seem to really enjoy. ​ 

 See you over there, 

 Ben 

 P.S. Here’s your last chance to get into Artisan Lab before the price goes up ​ 

 ​
​

someone to buy coaching.

In this email, I’ll reveal them while simultaneously utilizing
them to sell you.

Should be fun, let’s dive in:

1. The mechanism sale

This is where you sell someone on the vehicle.

The goal is to show them why your method to get the desired
outcome is effective.

Example – you want to make money online.

There are countless business models you could choose from.

All of them can work, but that doesn’t mean they’re all created
equally.

Many require capital, years of experience, or rely on finding
gimmicks or hacks in the market and don’t teach you valuable
skills.

That’s why the Info-Product Agency is a solid option.

valuable asset to any business.

audience doesn’t

3. The personal sale

At the end of the day, people's biggest hesitations come from

them hope.

Just two months after joining, Kabrin hit $20k/month after

Aaaand that concludes micro-sale #3.

See how this works now?

subject: DCA - bo
body:
The answer only becomes clear once a decision has been made.

You can float in the abyss forever.

You can contemplate, analyze, and hypothesize.

You can tell yourself you need a sign.

You need a jolt.

You need the grim reaper to come remind you that the clock is
ticking.

But you don’t know, until you go.

This is the common dilemma of the critical thinker.

It’s a blessing and a curse.

It’ll help you see through the whole 9-5 rat race trap.

It’ll lead you to many answers you have about the world and
yourself.

But as you know very well, it comes with downsides.

It’ll lead you to continue ruminating even after you’ve come to a
reasonable conclusion.

It’ll convince you that you’re not ready – and you’ll never be
ready.

It’ll fool you into thinking that thought alone creates progress
when in reality, it’s the very thing holding you back.

You’re the voice of reason and your biggest enemy all in one.

Will you learn when to shut out that voice who avoids change?

Will you let internal conviction take control and start before
you’re ready?

Will you understand that nothing changes until something changes,
which is impossible without…

A decision.

Left or right.

Shoot or pass.

Hit the gap or slam on the breaks.

If you keep floating in no man’s land, you’re gonna get hurt.

​Decide, commit, act. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu8dq3lkes7hvw934ob6h94dwl44sn/owhkhqhrmqpg9etv/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​
​

subject: Lifestyle curation
body:
“The only real test of intelligence is if you get what you want
out of life.” - Naval

bo, sorry I ghosted you for a week – I’m back.

Let’s talk about living life by design.

Everyone wants to create their dream lifestyle.

It’s what initially attracts many of us to entrepreneurship.

You begin to imagine a future version of you with more freedom
and confidence.

You think about how incredible your life will be once you just
crack the money code.

But even when you make the money you want, that doesn’t mean the
rest of your life will improve.

Sure, money solves money problems, which is great.

It gives you more freedom and the pursuit of it can create
internal fulfillment.

But if you really want to enjoy your life, there’s one main thing
most people fail to do:

You must consciously and continually consider if the life you are
creating aligns with what you actually want.

It’s simple, but easy to overlook.

Just because you have financial access to your dream lifestyle,
that doesn’t mean it’ll happen by default.

I first internalized this around a year and half ago.

Although I was making more money than I ever had, my lifestyle
hadn’t changed.

It felt like it was time for an upgrade.

I made a conscious decision to start doing things that I wasn’t
doing.

I went out of my way to meet more people, both in person and
through social media.

One thing led to the next, each connection opened another door,
and my life started improving.

It was magic.

A decision was made, actions were taken, and the goal was
accomplished.

Fast forward to now and I really don’t know if it’d be possible
to drastically improve my lifestyle.

I have everything I want.

From my friend group, to the access I have in Miami, and the
clout from social media (which can be vapid, but it’s cool).

I’ve proven to myself that I can create what I want from scratch.

And that’s the biggest benefit of all.

Every endeavor forces you to become a completely new version of
yourself.

This doesn’t always come with immediate financial gain but it’ll
help you live a much fuller life.

Progress is not black and white.

Money is just a tool that allows you to curate your life – don’t
forget to do so. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0h4x8xvghmhz4xe244al/58hvh7hmrvepgoh6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Good to be back,

Ben

​
​

Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0h4x8xvghmhz4xe244al
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0h4x8xvghmhz4xe244al
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

(

subject: Everyone will love you if...
body:
It’s a 78 degree, sunny morning in Miami.

I’m sitting on a park bench, looking at an advertisement for
Jimmy Butlers netflix show go by on the water.

Imagine a billboard placed on top of a 20ish foot boat.

On my way here, I held the door for a lady with a stroller.

She was further than the typical distance that I’d hold a door
for someone, but because her hands were full, I waited.

After patting myself on the back, I realized this is the perfect
topic for today’s email:

Awareness.

Those who win, are typically the most aware.

They know not to stand in the middle of crowded hallway.

They know how to make their date feel comfortable.

They know how to make the shy person feel included in the
conversation.

They know how to adjust their pitch to their prospect on a sales
call.

They know to hit the breaks when a driver looks like they’re
gonna pull out in front of them without looking.

All of these seemingly minuscule examples indicate a level of
consciousness that’s higher than the average person.

Socially this means you’re calculated, but not too calculated.

You’re considerate of those around but you don’t entirely discard
your own beliefs and standards to fit in.

You can walk into a party, make connections and leave others
feeling energized.

In a business setting, you’re able to see opportunities for what
they are.

Because you’re aware, other people like you. They want to connect
with you. They want to help you.

Nearly every business is built off of relationships.

And awareness is the foundation of the way you interact with the
world.

Without it, you’ll struggle.

Nearly anyone I’ve ever cut out of my life it’s been because of
this reason.

There’s just something that they’re missing from a social
calibration standpoint.

I don’t trust people like that, and neither does anyone else.

If you’re still here reading this and you’re thinking “how do I
become more aware?” That's up to you.

There’s no tutorial here —

But if you’re a conscious observer of your inner dialogue, you
pay attention to the micro-expressions of others, and you have
the confidence to act accordingly without exchanging your
authenticity…

​You’ll be further ahead than most. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0h4x5lz3cmhz4xe244al/x0hph6hw5p4owpb5/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Bye,

Ben

​
​

https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0h4x5lz3cmhz4xe244al
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0h4x5lz3cmhz4xe244al
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

(

subject: Trust me bro
body:
It’s another sunny day.

I’m starting this from a park bench as a pale shirtless man walks
past me pushing a stroller.

As I sit here pondering what to write about, I keep returning to
one idea:

Trust.

Your ability to trust yourself is the ultimate test.

Pursue anything and there’s a million problems that you don’t
know how to solve.

You can let that stop you.

Or you can trust that even the things you can’t control will work
out the way they’re supposed to.

Because you’re you.

And YOU will keep moving forward and figure it out.

When you do this, you open the door to endless possibilities you
didn’t have previously.

Every endeavor I've started or change I’ve made in recent memory
has worked out positively.

From moving to Miami before I felt entirely ready.

To posting on Youtube and building Artisan Lab. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hd2xr9girh89q2e99cm/p8heh9hzndwxlkfq/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

To starting my comedy/skit arc on Tik Tok and Instagram…

Even though these aren’t huge changes that immediately impact my
direction in life, there’s a level of micro-anxiety when starting
anything new.

subject: Trust me bro
body:
It’s another sunny day. 

 I’m starting this from a park bench as a pale shirtless man walks past me pushing a stroller. 

 As I sit here pondering what to write about, I keep returning to one idea: 

 Trust. 

 Your ability to trust yourself is the ultimate test. 

 Pursue anything and there’s a million problems that you don’t know how to solve. 

 You can let that stop you. 

 Or you can trust that even the things you can’t control will work out the way they’re supposed to. 

 Because you’re you. 

 And YOU will keep moving forward and figure it out. 

 When you do this, you open the door to endless possibilities you didn’t have previously. 

 Every endeavor I've started or change I’ve made in recent memory has worked out positively. 

 From moving to Miami before I felt entirely ready. 

 To posting on Youtube and building Artisan Lab. ​

 To starting my comedy/skit arc on Tik Tok and Instagram… 

 Even though these aren’t huge changes that immediately impact my direction in life, there’s a level of micro-anxiety when starting anything new. 

 You don’t know what you don’t know, and that’s nerve-wrecking. 

 In my case, I’d proven to myself that I can thrive when I take on new challenges. 

 This has allowed me to get over that resistance. 

 And even now, I don’t know how everything’s gonna work out. 

 I don’t have a 1, 5, or 10 year plan. 

 But what I do know is that Im planting seeds that will continue to sprout. 

 From my comedy side quests, to business content, to my info-agency… 

 As long as I just keep moving forward, I have enough trust in myself that I will get everything I want. 

 That’s how it’s worked for me so far. 

 So {{ subscriber.first_name }}, I encourage you to approach life through this the same lens. 

 You are a perpetual problem solver. 

 You can adapt to varying circumstances and environments. 

 The right opportunities will find you as long as you start progressing. 

 You have everything you need 

 You are everything you need. 

 And any time you’re stressed and feel the walls caving in… 

 That's just another opportunity to show yourself that you can climb out of any deficit. 

 ​ Trust yourself. ​

 Ben 

 ​
​

subject: Instant transformation is the only way to change
body:
Transformations are a result of micro-adjustments.

Change is perceived as difficult because we get caught up in old
habits, routines, and thoughts.

But taking the action to enable change is rarely difficult.

Right now in this instant, you can start a full life
transformation.

If you want money, it can be as simple as picking up the phone
and pitching someone.

If you want a better social life, you can start a conversation in
line at the coffee shop.

You can send a DM on Instagram or make a 30 second video that
leads to a friendship, customer, or client.

You can decide to stop asking other people for advice and follow
your own instincts.

Over time, that single decision will equip you with the internal
conviction necessary to take on more personal responsibility.

And with that, you’ll finally be in the drivers seat of your own
life.

Micro-adjustments, macro-results.

You’re just a series of small changes away.

You know this, but you overcomplicate it.

These small changes feel like you’re carrying a whale on your
shoulders while walking up a downward moving escalator.

And this is because you’re comfortable with your current struggle
and level of responsibility.

You don’t actually want to solve your problem because it’ll force
you to evolve.

Your current conflict will be replaced with a new one. And this
conflict, you’re not accustomed to.

If you solve your money problem, you have to figure out what you
want to do with your life.

It’s temporarily easier to just keep grappling with the same
issues.

And that’s why the micro-adjustments you know you need to make in
order to change are stopping you.

You’re letting small roadblocks turn into sinkholes.

But if you just start with one small decision. And one small
action, you’ll realize it’s not that scary.

Along the way, you’ll be equipped with everything you need to
handle a new level of responsibility.

The upgraded, confident version of you is not that far away.

He (or she) just started right now.

​And 6 months later, you’re unrecognizable. (

)​

Get moving,

Ben

​

subject: You are meant to build
body:
Your energy alone will take you to where you’re supposed to be.

This isn’t some mystical spiritual concept, but rather an
observation I’ve made throughout my journey.

I’ve always felt like I was special.

Perhaps it’s a feeling everyone has, but most suppress.

People tell you that everyone is equal.

They tell you that your ego is a bad thing.

And that your selfish inclination to believe that you’re ordained
for greatness is narcissistic.

Perhaps they’re right.

Is this belief likely based on delusion and ego?

Yes.

But will it serve you in ways that I don’t have enough time to
articulate on this page?

Also yes.

You are who you believe you are.

If you walk through life with an exuberant confidence in your
eye, others will perceive you as someone who’s got it figured
out.

If you believe you are that guy and that you weren’t meant to be
another dull, lifeless NPC going through the motions in someone
else’s movie, that energy will carry you.

I’m not telling you to be an asshole and entirely lose sight of
reality.

Yes, you have to put in work.

You have to prove your competence.

And you have to earn the respect of others.

But that’ll be impossible to do without a level of internal
conviction that most would deem delusional.

That feeling in your gut is there for a reason.

It’s a version of you that’s possible to attain.

And it’s up to you to bring it to reality.

Most won’t.

But they aren’t reading this email.

​So take this as your head start. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqhked8w6tvhqr65wrrto/m2h7h5h8d8q0l8cm/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​
​

subject: How to make $100k/month
body:
Hello and happy Monday.

One of my students inside Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmun5487w2hmh0p8do6u6h8lwm000bg/08hwh9hd3q73w7ul/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) hit his first $100k month in October.

Here’s proof real quick:

​
As much as I’d love to take credit for his success, I can’t.

He’s gotten to where he is because he hasn’t needed hand holding
or babysitting.

The guy just implements what he's told —and that’s the secret.

About 4 months ago, he was at $25k per month.

We hopped on a 1-1 call, he explained his situation to me and I
really didn’t have much advice for him.

I told him to keep doing as much outreach as possible and I gave
him confirmation he was in the right path.

He doubled down on what was working for him.

Next thing you know, he’s at $100k per month.

He rarely asked questions after that initial call, which leads me
to the lesson here:

Don’t keep looking for an answer you already have.

Once you get clarity on the direction you’re going in, put your
head down and foot on the gas.

Any time you hear that voice in the back of your head say “I
don’t think we’re ready” or “what if we try this instead!”

Tell it to shut up.

You know what to do, you just have to execute.

And just like that, you’ll be my next best case study inside of

Have a great week,

Ben

subject: Momentum > Discipline
body:
Trump winning the election has me thinking about how I need a
second term with you.

Copy that line and send it to your ex.

You’re welcome.

Anyway, I’m sitting out on my balcony on a cloudy day here in
Miami.

I’ve been in a bit of a rut.

As you may have noticed, I haven’t been very consistent with
these emails recently.

Every time I think about writing, it’s like my brain shuts off.

Typically I can come up with an idea, open my laptop and 20
minutes later I’ll have a legible email.

But as of late, that’s been a struggle.

The advice I’d give to someone in my position when you just can’t
get yourself to do something that you know you need to do is
simple:

Make it easy.

If something feels like a herculean task, you won’t do it.

But what if you take the pressure off?

Instead of trying to write the perfect email, make the best
content, or craft an amazing outreach message, you just do what
you can.

It might not be your best work ever, but it builds momentum.

When you’re in a rut, that’s what you need.

And the next time you sit down to complete whatever task you’re
avoiding, it gets a bit easier.

So that’s what this email is about.

I have a friend who recently started making content on Tik Tok.

He’s only made a few videos and keeps asking me for critiques.

I told him to stop asking for help until he posts consistently
for a month.

Because right now, the quality doesn’t matter.

He needs reps and data, and over time he’ll naturally work out
the kinks.

So bo, for any new habit you’re trying to build, I’ll offer you
the same advice.

Start small, enjoy the process, and don’t chase perfection.

If you show up for yourself consistently, it will work out.

The tasks that once felt difficult will get easier.

You’ll get into a rhythm and start swimming with the tide.

​Just start building. (

)​

Ben

subject: The money game is too easy
body:
Sometimes I feel like it’s all been too easy. 

 I reminisce on the times where I was hopeful and naive. 

 There was a spark in my eye that was ignited by blind ambition. 

 The process of making money and building the life I now have felt like a mythical endeavor. 

 Everything was so new and I was exuberant to be in the arena, playing the game. 

 I was a typical college dropout with big dreams and little idea how I’d pull it off. 

 Every time I moved a step closer to my goals, it was electric. 

 With each new client I signed, it meant I was that much further away from ever having to work a 9-5. 

 My first full year in business I made around $80k. 

 “Holy shit! That’s way more than I would’ve made in my first year out of college,” I thought to myself. 

 That feeling of hopefulness remained as a buzz in the back of my mind for a while. 

 It’s like I was the chubby, socially off kid on the basketball team who finally gets to play during senior night. 

 I was just happy to be here. 

 But at some point, that wore off. 

 Unfortunately, it all worked and I got most of the things I wanted… Maybe a little too easily. 

 Perhaps my vision for what I’d want after accomplishing my current status didn’t evolve fast enough. 

 I guess that’s an easy thing to overlook when you begin to embark on any journey – What do I do if it works? 

 In the past, my goals would naturally evolve. 

 There was a point where I just wanted to make $5k per month. 

 Once I got there, I wanted $10k per month and so on, all the way up to six figures a month. 

 It was easy to keep going. That was until money stopped impacting my lifestyle. 

 I already don’t have to think about expenses, I go on trips when I want, and I have my dream car. 

 I could triple my income and it would have a minimal impact on my day to day life. 

 But that’s where the goals have to evolve. 

 More money now means more security. 

 It means I can invest more and set up my future self and my perfect 10 wife, so we can have beautiful babies that go to the league. 

 It means I can take care of and employ more people. 

 That was never in the vision. 

 I just wanted the flashy shit and fun lifestyle. 

 But that part was surprisingly easy. 

 This might read like I’m spoiled and ungrateful, but I’m sharing this because you will likely reach a point in your journey where you complete your vision. 

 You’ll get everything that you believed was possible for you and find yourself in a position where life feels a bit dull, even though it might look exciting externally. 

 That’s when you have to move the goal post back again. 

 Find a new north star and begin working towards it. 

 See you at the top, 

 Ben 

 PS - Go here to get 1 on 1 help from me and scale your info-product agency ​ 

 PPS - Lmk if you made it all the way down here and liked this one :)
​ 

 ​ 

 ​

subject: How to befriend millionaires
body:
{{ subscriber.first_name }}, 

 You may have heard the following cliche: 

 "You are the sum of the 5 people you spend the most time around." 

 When it comes to financial success, this typically holds true. 

 My immediate circle consists of millionaires and multi-millionaires. 

 Everyone I'm around is crushing it. 

 This has helped me make more money because it's forced me to raise my own standards. 

 I don't want to be the brokie in the friend group that can't hold their own weight. 

 Plus it's a constant reminder of what I am capable of. 

 My friends are dope, but they're no smarter than me. 

 And I know if they can do it, so can I. 

 This is one of the hidden benefits of joining online communities. 

 Inside my Mastermind, Artisan Lab we have a bunch of killers who all have one common mission: 

 Getting rich. 

 Nick is out here closing $11k deals: 

 ​ Jack used the outreach method I showed him to close a client in just 2 weeks:

 Heik closed a $2k plus 10% rev share deal:

 Aaron closed a $6k retainer plus rev share:

 ​ And Gauresh just closed his 3rd client in the past 2 weeks:

 ​ When you constantly see people who are just like you getting the results above, it's impossible to not get inspired. 

 The FOMO that comes with knowing you're leaving money on the table forces you to take massive action. 

 And when that happens, you make money. 

 They're no different from you, aside from the fact that they have one special advantage: 

 They're in a community of winners. ​

subject: Stop thinking, you idiot
body:
I woke up on the 28th floor of a hotel in Soho.

I threw on some sweats and a hoodie, and now I’m sitting at a red
metal table in a crowded coffee shop.

The woman(?) who took my order was wearing a covid mask and
there’s a girl behind me with a slight lisp talking loudly on the
phone about her problems at work.

I’m contemplating throwing my sugary iced latte at her.

You now have a clear picture of my exact situation as I sit here
typing to you on my phone.

Now onto the more important stuff:

Think less.

When you’re making a business decision.

When you’re sending a text.

When you’re talking to the perfect model 10.

When you’re deciding between rigatoni or penne.

Just please stop thinking so much.

Your initial instinctive response is the best one 99 times out of
100.

And you’re fucking up the natural, authentic flow of life by
hyper-analyzing every aspect of it.

YOU DON’T GET ANY EXTRA POINTS FOR CONSTANT CONTEMPLATION.

All you’re doing is stressing yourself out and diminishing that
natural carefree spirit in your soul.

“What should I say to pretty gorl to get her to like me??? Oh no,
should I send this emoji or is that too aggressive? I shouldn’t
have put that period at the end of my sentence, now I sound too
serious.”

YOU’RE COOKED.

Seriously, this is ruining your life.

The intention is pure but it has an inverse effect.

You have instincts for a reason. STOP DOUBTING THEM.

But I get it — This habit of analysis is a double edged sword.

Being someone who is aware and thinks critically can help you.

Without this, you’ll just blindly follow other people.

But you have to toe the line between overthinking and ignorance.

Too much thought makes you a spiritually cucked pussy.

Too little thought makes you a sheep who stands in the middle of
crowded doorways.

Don’t be either.

Learn when to shut off that part of your brain who revises every
decision before you make it.

And learn when to question whether or not a belief or operating
system aligns with what you want.

But when in doubt — stop thinking and let it fly. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/4zupx8r403seh5oqgwgixh629r777t5/reh8hoh0g8vwvnf2/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

That’s life in the flow state.

Ben

​
​

subject: Life is fair
body:
Happy Monday bo,

The other day I wrote a tweet I want to expand on.

I said:

“Life is actually incredibly fair. You get what you truly believe
you are capable of receiving. But you can’t deceive the universe
the way you can your own mind. There is no hiding or contorting
the truth. If you don’t get what you want, you’re not unlucky,
you’re undeserving.”

Any time I’ve found myself disappointed in an outcome, it’s
because I failed to remember the truth above.

There’s been periods in business where I felt like I deserved
more than what I received.

That could go on for a while until eventually I’d make some sort
of adjustment and my income would grow exponentially.

Only after that could I see the picture clearly.

Beforehand, I wasn’t ready.

There was a skill gap, mental hurdle, or some other form of
maturing I needed.

The delay was a result of that fact and it was equipping me with
whatever I was missing.

When I was disappointed, it was a result of not seeing reality
clearly.

This is what I learned:

If you think you deserve a different outcome than you received,
it’s because you’re fooling yourself or being impatient.

There’s an inkling in your gut that knows exactly that.

If you’re too closely attached to your income, your bank account
won’t grow.

If you’re heavily reliant on validation from others, you’ll feel
empty even when you get it.

If you refuse to make the necessary adjustment to reach a goal,
and you fool yourself into thinking that you can get around it…

The universe will remind you that you cannot outsmart it.

You reap what you sow and there is no cheating.

You know what you truly deserve and you know if there are things
you’ve been running from.

Continue to run, continue to lie to yourself, continue to be
disappointed.

Or accept that you will not get what you want out of life until
you slay the necessary dragons.

And remember…

​You can’t outperform your own self-image. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/0vukr0nl6oh9ho87dn9clhv67r555sn/dpheh0h0pom793bm/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​
​

https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/0vukr0nl6oh9ho87dn9clhv67r555sn
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/0vukr0nl6oh9ho87dn9clhv67r555sn
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

subject: You're thinking too much
body:
Most of your problems are not real.

They're illusions you've created in your own head as a result of
habitual over-thinking.

Stop contemplating, you're making it worse.

The issue can be solved in an instant.

Make the decision. It's not daunting as you've made it out to be
in your mind.

Stop dwelling.

Nobody remembers the "embarrassing" thing you said.

Stop fixating.

Your date doesn't notice that your shirt isn't perfectly ironed.

Stop analyzing.

The perfect route to financial success doesn't exist, start now.

You can override your conscious mind through action.

Post the content you want to post.

Carry yourself with confidence.

Act as the person you want to become.

You will become that person.

The voice that tells you to flinch loses it's power as you
separate from it.

It does not dictate your actions, you do. Only in the present
moment.

And that's all you'll ever have.

Stop creating an internal hell because your external world is
void of real problems.

​You're thinking too much. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/68u8vxpw9qs8hkqpx7xbohp34qkkkh9/vqh3hrhpw4933qhg/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dD0xNzBzJnY9U2h5OUlrakRUUm8=

I have a secret to share with you today.

It’s a law of success that once you understand, you can’t go
back.

Making money becomes easy.

You no longer lack clarity or feel like you don’t know where to
start.

And all of the bullshit roadblocks and hurdles you previously
dealt with start to vanish.

This secret is simple…

Making money is easy when you actually do the work.

Mind-blowing, right?

We tend to have this habit of overcomplicating simple tasks
instead of taking the obvious action.

If you want to get clients for your agency, do outreach (duh).

Don’t listen to that voice in your head that’s telling you that
you don’t know how to find clients or what to say in your
outreach messages.

That’s your ego, fooling you into a state of inaction.

You’re scared to take on the additional responsibility that comes
with success.

Everyone has that.

But those who build a successful business learn to stop listening
to it.

They act, despite the fact that it’s uncomfortable.

subject: This is a necessary evil
body:
I’m back.

It’s a frigid morning here in Miami.

I got a hot vanilla latte today because of this.

The weather app says it’s 61 degrees out but I swear it feels
like it’s in the 20’s.

Anyway, I have to apologize to the nerds today.

You know the guys you see on Instagram who constantly talk about
the importance of routine?

They’re the steak, eggs, standing desk, blue light blocker, and
supplement stack types.

For some reason they post 178 Instagram stories per day, showing
you the same thing…

Every. Fucking. Day.

Wake up 5am, meditate to David Goggins poster, kettlebell
workout, sales call, rant about positivity, involuntarily
celibate disguised as ‘no fap.’

(Sorry that last one was mean)

It’s corny as fuck.

But it works.

And recently, I forgot that.

The most productive era’s of my life have typically come when my
habits are in check.

I’m getting up early, taking walks, journaling, writing emails,
making content…

Everything is consistent.

And this consistency builds momentum.

Getting work done feels easier. Each day is a productive step in
the right direction.

The chatter in my mind begins to quiet.

And once again, I’m able to find that intuitive feeling in my gut
that just knows the way.

Even though I don’t know exactly where I’m going.

When I’m moving, things unfold in my favor.

Movement is the solution -- And it’s easily created through these
corny ass habits that won’t directly make you rich.

Obviously – Sitting in the sauna isn’t gonna put millions in your
bank account.

5 minutes in the cold plunge won’t put a Patek on your wrist.

Meditating won’t buy you a Porsche 911 Turbo.

But if you don’t take the time to be with yourself and prove to
your little monkey brain that you can exercise discipline…

Then how do you expect to scale and maintain a business?

Sure you don’t always have to be “locked in” but if you neglect
things for too long, they die.

If you don’t workout, your muscles begin to atrophy.

And that goes for every “muscle” including discipline, mental
aptitude, creativity, etc.

Use it or lose it.

Habits are a cheat code to continual growth. Just don’t be weird
about it and start posting your whole day on Instagram.

No one really cares. I promise.

But thank you, Nerds for the reminder.

Feels great to be back :)

Ben

PS Hope you had a great Thanksgiving and Black Friday. Mine was
good but the turkey was kinda dry.

Although I didn’t run a BF sale, I added a special bonus inside
of Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhx59er8sghvnp6mllh9/z2hghnh3lxvn65tp/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) and have made it nearly impossible to fail.

My members are getting rich. I’ve got 21 year old kids making
$100k+ per month.

Others are closing famous people as clients.

And others got their first two (PAYING) clients in their first
week.

​Join me here now and you will get richer, happier, and better
looking. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhx59er8sghvnp6mllh9/z2hghnh3lxvn65tp/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Legally I can’t guarantee that, but illegally, I pinky promise.

​

​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhx59er8sghvnp6mllh9
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhx59er8sghvnp6mllh9
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

subject: 10 principles that helped me scale to $100k/mo
body:
Here are 10 things you need to understand if you want to build a successful info-product agency.

 Whether you're just starting out, or you already have some clients, these lessons will help you scale rapidly.

 Let's go:

 The singular “best” outreach system doesn’t exist. Anything can work, if you take the time to be creative and stand out in your pitches. Take initiative in solving issues that are in the best interest of the business, even if you are not directly responsible for them. Think for yourself before asking questions. In most cases the answer is obvious and you just need to take the obvious action. Your conscious brain is typically not your friend. When you find yourself thinking that you need more information before you can act, you are fooling yourself. If you don’t feel like you’re in over your head, you’re not saying “yes” enough. The best way to learn is on the fly. Do not obsess over systems and processes. Make money first, worry about efficiency later. Non-scalable actions differentiate you from your “competition.” Everyone can send dozens of mediocre pitches daily. Not everyone will take the time to correctly assess a situation and personalize a pitch to solve a specific problem. Not every client is going to be a homerun. There are two sides to the equation and if your client isn’t holding up their end of the bargain, there’s only so much you can do. Find a way to get your foot in the door. It can make sense to offer one service, perform well, and take over other parts of their business once you earn their trust and have a better understanding of the gaps in their business. The best opportunities are found when a client is making good money, despite the fact that their systems are being overlooked. Fixing those problems is like pouring gas on the flame. There we have it.

 Remember these 10 things and you'll be driving an SVJ in no time.

 ​ And if you want my personal help in growing your info-product agency or coaching business, click here. ​

 See you at the top,

 Ben

 ​
