subject: Opportunity is here. Don't miss it
body:
Do you remember where you were when you realized COVID was gonna
be a big deal?

I was nearing the end of my freshman year of college.

The rumblings about the virus were becoming more prevalent.

Still, I didn’t think much of it.

Then it all started to happen…

I remember checking my phone and seeing that the NBA postponed
the games that night.

Not long after, I got an email from my school saying that we’d
have to evacuate.

“Uh oh… this is starting to feel real,” I thought.

Next thing you know, the whole world is on pause and everyones
wearing diapers on their faces to avoid the equivalent of a
common cold.

Last night, I got a similar feeling when I opened Tik Tok.

“Holy shit… it’s actually banned.”

It seems likely that it’ll be back in the coming days or weeks
once Trumps in office and everything will return to normal.

But you can’t ignore the fact that this is a big deal.

In 2023 alone, Tik Tok contributed $24.2 BILLION to the U.S. GDP.

And obviously that number has grown since then.

When an event of this magnitude occurs, opportunity arises.

The money doesn’t vanish, it gets redirected.

Other platforms would benefit from an influx of users.

Instagram reels, Youtube shorts, maybe Snapchat or a completely
different app.

The first adopters would be heavily rewarded.

Again, it seems like this will get resolved sooner than later.

But the point about opportunity remains.

Whatever happens in the next couple weeks, you can use this as an
excuse to get moving.

When the COVID lockdowns happened, all my friends and I took
advantage of it.

We laid the foundation that allowed us to make more money than we
ever thought possible and completely change our lives over the
next couple years.

Could we have done this without the impact of the pandemic?

Yes.

But did it help spur us into action and get rich while everyone
else was pouting?

Also yes.

You don’t want to look back on these crazy times and feel like
you watched from the sidelines.

Crypto’s pumping.

The creator economy (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/wvunperxzdhghk5vegqs7hn34kzxxc8/owhkhqhrexpz8rbv/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) is booming.

AI is evolving.

Trumps getting inaugurated.

Money is everywhere.

Pick a lane and move as fast as you fucking can.

Because you don’t know when this run will end.

But if you follow the money, build your skillset, and adapt to
the shifts in the market…

Nothing can phase you.

Not a ban. Not a fake virus. Not a robot with 1,000x your mental
capacity.

​Become undeniable. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/wvunperxzdhghk5vegqs7hn34kzxxc8/owhkhqhrexpz8rbv/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​
​

subject: Opportunity is here. Don't miss it
body:
Do you remember where you were when you realized COVID was gonna be a big deal?

 I was nearing the end of my freshman year of college.

 The rumblings about the virus were becoming more prevalent.

 Still, I didn’t think much of it.

 Then it all started to happen…

 I remember checking my phone and seeing that the NBA postponed the games that night.

 Not long after, I got an email from my school saying that we’d have to evacuate.

 “Uh oh… this is starting to feel real,” I thought.

 Next thing you know, the whole world is on pause and everyones wearing diapers on their faces to avoid the equivalent of a common cold.

 Last night, I got a similar feeling when I opened Tik Tok.

 “Holy shit… it’s actually banned.”

 It seems likely that it’ll be back in the coming days or weeks once Trumps in office and everything will return to normal.

 But you can’t ignore the fact that this is a big deal.

 In 2023 alone, Tik Tok contributed $24.2 BILLION to the U.S. GDP.

 And obviously that number has grown since then.

 When an event of this magnitude occurs, opportunity arises.

 The money doesn’t vanish, it gets redirected.

 Other platforms would benefit from an influx of users.

 Instagram reels, Youtube shorts, maybe Snapchat or a completely different app.

 The first adopters would be heavily rewarded.

 Again, it seems like this will get resolved sooner than later.

 But the point about opportunity remains.

 Whatever happens in the next couple weeks, you can use this as an excuse to get moving.

 When the COVID lockdowns happened, all my friends and I took advantage of it.

 We laid the foundation that allowed us to make more money than we ever thought possible and completely change our lives over the next couple years.

 Could we have done this without the impact of the pandemic?

 Yes.

 But did it help spur us into action and get rich while everyone else was pouting?

 Also yes.

 You don’t want to look back on these crazy times and feel like you watched from the sidelines.

 Crypto’s pumping.

 The creator economy is booming.

 AI is evolving.

 Trumps getting inaugurated.

 Money is everywhere. 

 Pick a lane and move as fast as you fucking can.

 Because you don’t know when this run will end.

 But if you follow the money, build your skillset, and adapt to the shifts in the market…

 Nothing can phase you.

 Not a ban. Not a fake virus. Not a robot with 1,000x your mental capacity.

 ​ Become undeniable. ​

 Ben

subject: I need some advice...
body:
I’m advising you to stop taking advice.

 Ironic, but important.

 Everyone has their own biased beliefs, ideas, and perceptions.

 And they’re not necessarily wrong.

 But if you’re not careful, you’ll listen too much.

 The habit of asking others for their thoughts will consume your own thoughts.

 Any time you reach a crossroad, obstacle, or internal conflict, you'll feel helpless.

 Consider what this signals to your subconscious…

 {{ subscriber.first_name }} isn't self-reliant.

 {{ subscriber.first_name }} doesn’t trust himself (or herself).

 {{ subscriber.first_name }} can’t speak with conviction because their beliefs come from others.

 You’re an infant. Basically asking for permission to think.

 You’ll be the person who asks Google-able questions.

 And worst of all, the excess of opinions will stun you.

 Different potential solutions to problems get jumbled around in your head.

 Any of which could work.

 But because you haven’t built up internal conviction by making your own decisions, you can’t decide and commit. ​

 And even the smallest amount of resistance can pull you back to inaction.

 So how do you fix this?

 How do you start trusting yourself and feeling like you're in the driver’s seat of your life?

 How do you begin to rely on your inner voice?

 Here’s the solution…

 Stop waiting for me (or anyone else) to give you an answer that you already have.

 Ask yourself “How do I start building internal conviction?”

 Ponder that question and come up with some simple ideas…

 It can be minor changes to your habits.

 Starting a hobby you’ve been putting off.

 Pursuing a new opportunity in your business.

 Whatever it is, it doesn't have to be anything wild or crazy.

 But you need to show yourself that you can take actions simply because you want to.

 You don’t need permission.

 You don’t need advice.

 You need you.

 And luckily, you’re all you’ll ever have. ​

 Conviction is the great equalizer. You can’t win without it, you can’t lose with it.

 The only way to build it is by listening to yourself.

 Start today, right now. Don’t go looking for answers that you already have.

 Talk tomorrow,

 Ben

subject: I need some advice...
body:
I’m advising you to stop taking advice.

Ironic, but important.

Everyone has their own biased beliefs, ideas, and perceptions.

And they’re not necessarily wrong.

But if you’re not careful, you’ll listen too much.

The habit of asking others for their thoughts will consume your
own thoughts.

Any time you reach a crossroad, obstacle, or internal conflict,
you'll feel helpless.

Consider what this signals to your subconscious…

bo isn't self-reliant.

bo doesn’t trust himself (or herself).

bo can’t speak with conviction because their beliefs come from
others.

You’re an infant. Basically asking for permission to think.

You’ll be the person who asks Google-able questions.

And worst of all, the excess of opinions will stun you.

Different potential solutions to problems get jumbled around in
your head.

Any of which could work.

But because you haven’t built up internal conviction by making
your own decisions, you can’t decide and commit. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh20x959tkhkw73g99u3/z2hghnh3zne2w5ap/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

And even the smallest amount of resistance can pull you back to
inaction.

So how do you fix this?

How do you start trusting yourself and feeling like you're in the
driver’s seat of your life?

How do you begin to rely on your inner voice?

Here’s the solution…

Stop waiting for me (or anyone else) to give you an answer that
you already have.

Ask yourself “How do I start building internal conviction?”

Ponder that question and come up with some simple ideas…

It can be minor changes to your habits.

Starting a hobby you’ve been putting off.

Pursuing a new opportunity in your business.

Whatever it is, it doesn't have to be anything wild or crazy.

But you need to show yourself that you can take actions simply
because you want to.

You don’t need permission.

You don’t need advice.

You need you.

And luckily, you’re all you’ll ever have. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh20x959tkhkw73g99u3/z2hghnh3zne2w5ap/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Conviction is the great equalizer. You can’t win without it, you
can’t lose with it.

The only way to build it is by listening to yourself.

Start today, right now. Don’t go looking for answers that you
already have.

Talk tomorrow,

Ben

P.S. Obviously there is nuance to this and there are times where
guidance from people you trust is 100% helpful. Just don’t make
it a habit to ask others before you ask yourself.

​
​

subject: You're overcomplicating this
body:
A little over a year ago, a friend of mine started building his
first software company.

It’s now worth multiple 7 figures, soon to be 8.

Software is a difficult space to get into.

It’s especially harder than building an agency or coaching
business.

In watching him get this off the ground, I learned a valuable
lesson that can be applied to any endeavor…

Do not over complicate the uncomplicated.

There will always be a variety of things you don’t know.

You’ll likely have a tendency to want to feel ready, but it’s
impossible to solve tomorrow's problems, today.

If you feel like you’re in over your head, you’re doing something
right.

Nearly every successful business owner follows a similar path:

1. They learn the basics.

2. They dive in well before they feel ready.

3. They solve problems on the fly.

4. They adapt, carve their lane, and find success.

There is no way around this.

Most people get caught up in step 1 and 2 because they start
overcomplicating it.

Let’s say you’re building an info-product agency.

You need to do two things…

Learn the fundamentals of copywriting for coaching businesses.

Do outreach.

Everything else is a waste of time.

You can spend weeks or months contemplating a niche, offer, what
to say in your outreach, etc.

All you’re doing is avoiding action.

When you get a client, you’ll then have a better vantage point to
understand what bottlenecks need to be solved.

You just can’t let the unknown stop you from putting one foot in
front of the other.

Steve Jobs didn’t know how he’d build Apple.

Zuckerberg didn't have Facebook mapped out.

They just started and figured it out along the way.

The same applies to you.

You don't need to know how you'll get to $100k months.

You just need to know your next step.

For you, that's probably sending your first outreach message.

Or jumping on your first sales call.

Or closing your first client.

Everything after that?

You'll figure it out when you get there.

​Ready to take your first step? Let me show you exactly where to
start. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlpn7wns8h8940o22bl/owhkhqhre9gx50fv/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

To keeping it simple,

Ben

​
​
​

https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlpn7wns8h8940o22bl
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlpn7wns8h8940o22bl
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

subject: Shortcuts DO exist...
body:
When I first got into online business, all I wanted was fast
success.

I was one of the idiots in the comment sections saying…

“How long will it take to get a client?”

“How long will it take to get to $10k/month?”

“How long will it take to buy my dream car?”

My perception of time was skewed.

Even hearing that it could take 6 months of hard work before I
make financial progress sounded like eternity.

I wanted money and I wanted it now!

Because of my flawed mindset, it ended up taking longer.

I hopped from one business model to the next.

I’d look for someone to give me a defined, step-by-step roadmap
with a timeline.

Obviously that didn’t exist.

After spending nearly a year flirting with the idea of success
and making half-hearted attempts at a few businesses, I finally
accepted it…

This shit is gonna be hard.

It’s gonna take time.

I’m gonna have to learn A LOT.

And even with all my hard work, nothing is guaranteed.

As grim as that may sound, accepting this made it a hell of a lot
easier.

Instead of looking for shortcuts I started planting seeds.

My inner dialogue shifted from, “how can I make money this
month?” to “how can I set up a solid foundation over the next 3
months?” (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hldez36urh8nq6e99bm/48hvhehr38gz4wux/aHR0cHM6Ly95b3V0dS5iZS9GSjlaVldObWJoSQ==
)​

And when I finally did that, guess what?

I found the fast success I was looking for.

Ironic, huh?

The shortcut is understanding that there is no shortcut.

When you stop searching for it, you start focusing on what’s
important.

And when you focus on what’s important, you make progress.

(Relatively) Fast.

“The day you plant the seed is not the day you eat the fruit.”

Build skills.

Commit to continuous learning.

Make connections.

Improve your habits.

Fortify your mind.

And accept that anything fast, doesn’t last.

​You’ll be in your dream car in no time. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hldez36urh8nq6e99bm/wnh2hghwd6g9enh7/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Godspeed,

Ben

​
​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hldez36urh8nq6e99bm
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hldez36urh8nq6e99bm
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

subject: What makes a good copywriter?
body:
I’m writing to you from the clouds.

Let me show you:

​
A parakeet just landed on my balcony.

He said “Ben, what makes a good copywriter?”

Here’s my answer…

A good copywriter accurately articulates a prospect's current
situation in detail.

He makes a logical argument overcoming all objections that would
prevent them from purchasing the product.

That’s about it.

I’ll show you in action.

My goal is to get you to book a call and join Artisan Lab. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/4zupx8r403sehp5rq9quxh620lm77i5/e0hph7h0zg5kloa8/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Right now, there’s a variety of factors that could be stopping
you:

1. You think you can learn everything for free on Youtube

2. You don’t fully understand the info-product agency model

3. You’re worried you won’t be able to get clients

4. You’re unclear on what you’d do for clients and how you’d
pitch them

5. You think it sounds too complex to start right now

There are more potential objections, but those are the 5 most
prevalent I hear.

I’ll show you how I’d overcome a couple of them…

Objection 1:

The truth is, you can learn most of what you'd need to know on
Youtube.

But it’ll slow you down immensely.

Instead of having a step-by-step roadmap showing you what to do
every day for the next 90 days…

You’ll have to spend hours digging through mud to find gems on
social media.

And even then, how will you know what information to trust?

It’s a gamble.

If you have time to waste, by all means figure it out on your
own.

But if you want a sure thing?

Coaching is the way to go.

Objection 2:

So you’ve heard people talk about building an info-product agency
but you’re unsure where to start.

Let me break it down for you:

Your job is to partner with a content creator who posts
educational content.

They focus on getting more attention, you focus on selling their
coaching program.

To do this, you’ll start by learning the foundational skill of
copywriting.

Next you’ll get up to speed on the info-product space – I’ll
teach you about offers, funnels, VSLs, webinars, etc.

After 2-4 weeks of active studying and practice reps, you’ll be
ready to start outreach.

Boom.

See what I’m doing here?

If I were writing a VSL or sales page I’d simply continue to
address objections 3-5.

Prospects would feel understood and trust me to lead them to the
solution.

So there’s your answer Mr. Parakeet.

Want to see me overcome the rest of your objections?

​Go here now and you’ll see a clear example of everything I just
told you about. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/4zupx8r403sehp5rq9quxh620lm77i5/e0hph7h0zg5kloa8/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

To better copy,

Ben

​
​
​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/4zupx8r403sehp5rq9quxh620lm77i5
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/4zupx8r403sehp5rq9quxh620lm77i5
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

subject: Why AI *won't* take your job
body:
Two days President Trump announced the formation of Stargate.

A few of the largest tech firms came together and will be
investing $500 BILLION into AI infrastructure over the next four
years.

Big news.

So what does this mean for you?

Will AI replace you and you’ll resort to mopping the floors at
your local high school?

Quite the opposite, actually.

Trump says this project will create around 100,000 jobs.

It’s impossible to predict what will be built over the coming
years.

But in the short term, here’s my recommendation for you…

Do not neglect the utilization of AI in your business.

It’s a tool that can make you wildly more efficient, improve your
copy, and expand your service delivery.

A marketer who uses AI effectively will outperform one who
doesn’t.

Simple as that.

Now this brings me to the question…

“If AI can do most of the legwork, why would online coaches still
hire copywriters?”

There are two main arguments here:

1. Laziness/unawareness

ChatGPT and Claude have been around for a while now.

Most info-product sellers already know this.

But still, they haven’t taken the time to use them effectively on
their own.

They prefer bringing someone on to do the work for them rather
than diving into the AI world themselves.

2. A vast skill set makes you irreplaceable

An email copywriter who writes a few half decent emails a week is
expendable.

You could be replaced with AI or by any of the other horny
copywriters in your clients DMs.

But if you’re offering a multitude of services – funnels, VSLs,
offer creation, sales management, automations, etc…

You’re invaluable.

AI can’t do all of that on its own (although it can help you do
it more effectively).

We’re entering a golden era. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/k0udqe8rwzs6h5dn52qblhom45r77b8/m2h7h5h8x6x692im/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

There’s a lot of money to be made over the next 4 years.

And it’d be a shame if you don’t capitalize on it.

​Go here and I’ll show you how you can use AI to your advantage.
(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/k0udqe8rwzs6h5dn52qblhom45r77b8/m2h7h5h8x6x692im/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Have a good weekend,

Ben

​
​

) | Update your profile (

subject: The fast lane to millions
body:
Good morning.

I’m on my balcony squinting at my computer screen.

If you’re somewhere cold and gloomy right now, I feel bad for
you.

It’s 73 and sunny here.

I’m shirtless with a zyn in my upper lip, looking down at the
water.

Serenity.

Alright, let’s cut the chit chat.

You want to get rich fast?

Easy.

1. Set an objective

2. Identify potential solutions

3. Implement immediately

4. Get data

5. Make necessary adjustments

The faster you do this, the faster you find success.

I have very few closely held beliefs but this is one I’m sure of.

Have an idea?

Act on it.

The voice telling you that you don’t know where to start is
natural.

It’s impossible to know because you don’t have the necessary
data.

The only way to get data is through trial and error.

And when you make action your default state, you get data a hell
of a lot quicker.

Here’s an example:

Ellis joined Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0ho48x4pimhzwxq244tl/25h2hoh2xq6d32u3/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) 7 days ago.

Yesterday, he got a new client.

​
Are there some potential obstacles that he might not know how to
solve right now?

Yes.

But he’ll find the solution once he acquires more data.

Same with Phillip, who just signed a client on a 20% rev share.

​
Winners win because they take action quicker than losers.

They learn on the fly and adapt as they go.

​You can join the winning team and get access to the same system
they’re using to close deals by going here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0ho48x4pimhzwxq244tl/25h2hoh2xq6d32u3/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Or you can remain on the sidelines and keep making excuses.

It’s all up to you, my friend.

Ben

 Easy.

 1. Set an objective

 2. Identify potential solutions

 3. Implement immediately

 4. Get data

 The faster you do this, the faster you find success.

 I have very few closely held beliefs but this is one I’m sure of.

 Have an idea?

 Act on it.

 The voice telling you that you don’t know where to start is natural.

 It’s impossible to know because you don’t have the necessary data.

 The only way to get data is through trial and error.

 And when you make action your default state, you get data a hell of a lot quicker.

 Here’s an example:

 Ellis joined Artisan Lab 7 days ago.

 Yesterday, he got a new client.

 ​ Are there some potential obstacles that he might not know how to solve right now?

 Yes.

 But he’ll find the solution once he acquires more data.

 Same with Phillip, who just signed a client on a 20% rev share.

 ​ Winners win because they take action quicker than losers.

 They learn on the fly and adapt as they go.

 ​ You can join the winning team and get access to the same system they’re using to close deals by going here. ​

 Or you can remain on the sidelines and keep making excuses.

 It’s all up to you, my friend.

 Ben

subject: Organic vs paid traffic for info-products
body:
Last night, I was hanging out with my rich uncle, Rob
(@robthebank).

We mostly chatted about content and selling info.

Most coaching businesses seem to have a relatively short life
span.

A personal brand gets hot, capitalizes on (or creates) a trend,
and makes a bag.

All they have to do is make organic content.

Their systems typically aren’t great and their product might not
be the best…

But they’re swimming with the tide – right place, right time,
right offer.

They print with ease.

This can last for as short as a few months and probably as long
as a handful of years.

But eventually, the tide shifts…

Views decline.

Reputations get tainted.

The market gets flooded with competition.

The offer isn’t as hot as it used to be.

Any of the above can occur and when this happens, the once simple
and easy cash flow business starts to get complex.

Used to 80% margins with organic traffic?

Hope you’re ready for that to decline when you have to pay for
every eyeball.

And if you have subpar systems, aren’t tracking your metrics, and
your attention to detail isn’t rock solid…

You’re in for a rude awakening.

This is how info-businesses end up collapsing quickly.

Their organic traffic dies down and they don’t build the
infrastructure to be successful selling to cold traffic.

Scaling through paid ads is a completely different game.

First, your margins will likely get cut down to around 50% or
less as you scale.

A friend of mine made $2m in a month last year, almost all
through paid.

He kept around $600k.

Sure it’s great money, but it’s 10x the work and the stress of
organic traffic.

And there’s (almost always) no real enterprise value.

The goal is cash flow.

If you have to spend $1m/mo, build a huge team, constantly test
new offers, and sell your heart out to keep a couple hundred
grand?

It definitely gets draining.

The game is to stay relevant organically (which is hard to do for
more than a few years)...

While also building the infrastructure that can work on cold
traffic.

If you rely solely on one or the other, you’re running a risky
business.

Just my 2 cents,

Ben

P.S. If you want to learn how to build an info-product agency the
right way – with systems that work for both organic and paid
traffic – I can show you here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh20989dskhkw73g99u3/p8heh9hzeewle5fq/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

You’ll learn how I’ve scaled offers all the way up to
$700k/month, how I get the best clients in the business, and how
you can do the same.

​Go here to apply for a strategy call. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh20989dskhkw73g99u3/p8heh9hzeewle5fq/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

​

subject: How to make hard tasks feel easy
body:
One day life will be all peace and joy.

You’ll spend your time only doing things you love.

All of your problems will vanish.

And you’ll never have to do things you don’t want to do.

At least, that’s what I used to think…

But this, my friend, is what we call a delusion.

There will always be things in business (and in life) that feel
like a chore.

Sorry to burst your bubble.

Now, this doesn’t have to be a bad thing.

All it takes is a simple reframe…

Think of a task that you typically dread doing.

Maybe it’s outreach, building systems, calls, etc.

Instead of looking at it like this daunting activity that you
want to avoid at all costs…

Simply accept that it will suck.

You won’t enjoy the time that it takes to complete said task.

But once you get through it, you’ll feel good.

You’ll move the needle forward and that’s all that matters.

When you do this, the daunting tasks begin to lose their power.

Instead of fighting two battles – one against your mind and one
against the thing you’re dreading…

You’re only fighting one.

Just embrace that it won’t be fun.

And get it done.

Eventually that resistance will feel like curling 5lb dumbbells.

It gets easier.

You just have to overcome the voice in your head that’s telling
you to run from the pain.

Soon you’ll be enjoying the fruits of your labor.

​If you want me to guide you through the trenches, join me here.
(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/wvunperxzdhghk5827gu7hn34kzxxc8/n2hohvh34d9dlef6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Talk tomorrow,

Ben

​
​

subject: Why people aren't buying from you
body:
I've worked with 46 total clients in the past 2.5 years.

All of which sell info.

I've sold low ticket communities, mid ticket, and high ticket
offers.

I helped a client make $600k in a week through a webinar funnel.

I've scaled dozens of offers past $100k/mo and a handful past
$500k/mo.

But my success has little to do with my copywriting ability...

I've been successful because I know who I'm talking to.

And after working with all these clients, I've discovered
something crucial:

Most marketers are trying to convince the wrong person to buy the
wrong thing.

​In this video, (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/27ukzem834hoh8vlzmku3hg0o7344hg/3ohphkh7w6ko7ltr/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vYkp4blR0
) I break down exactly how to avoid this mistake.

You'll learn:

◦ The 3 psychological triggers that make people buy

◦ How to identify what your market REALLY wants (not what they
say they want)

◦ The exact questions to ask to uncover true objections

This is the most important piece of marketing... If you get this
wrong, your offers simply won't convert.

But if you get it right?

Writing copy becomes easy.

Selling becomes effortless.

And scaling is just a matter of adding more fuel to the fire.

​This video is basically a degree in marketing psychology. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/27ukzem834hoh8vlzmku3hg0o7344hg/3ohphkh7w6ko7ltr/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vYkp4blR0
)​

And I've never shared this framework publicly before.

See you over there,

Ben

subject: The WORST business to start in 2025
body:
I have an urgent warning for you, bo.

This will potentially save you years of your life and thousands
of dollars…

Yesterday, someone commented on a video of mine where I broke
down my top 3 businesses in 2025.

They said, “Daytrading?” confused as to why that’s not on the
list.

Here’s a PSA:

YOU ARE RETARDED IF YOU THINK YOU’LL GET RICH TRADING.

I know incredibly intelligent people who’ve lost a lot of money
trading.

It’s quite literally the worst possible hustle you could start as
a beginner.

Over 90% of traders lose money.

Nearly every “successful trader” you see online did not get rich
from it.

They got rich selling info on it.

Of the few profitable traders I know, it took them YEARS to ever
make a dollar.

And I’m not telling you this to sell you my coaching.

I could care less which business model you choose, just don’t let
it be trading.

You’d have a better chance trying Dropshipping, Amazon FBA, even
OF (lol).

Please stay away – for your own sake.

All this being said, it’s great business to sell info on.

Everyone was fooled into thinking the stock market is a gateway
to financial freedom.

Because of this, the gurus that sell courses on trading print
money.

Kabrin, a member inside of Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/75u8gdmwq5s8h6kq5ombzhw3kor66sn/08hwh9hd8op5ddul/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) just closed a trader for $7k and a 15% rev share.

​
Instead of gambling his money away trying to beat the market,
he’s building a real, predictable business.

Even the $7k setup fee he got is more money than most traders
will ever make.

As a wise man once said “when everyone is digging for gold, sell
shovels.”

So, my question for you is:

Would you rather be the idiot losing money trying to beat a game
that has a 90%+ failure rate?

Or would you rather build real, tangible skills that ensure you

subject: Diversifying your income is for the poors
body:
“The average millionaire has 7 different income streams.”

Shut up.

This is some shit your broke uncle puts on his Instagram story
with a 💯 emoji.

Fuck off Uncle Tony, you work at Dennys.

Do not let poverty advice like this fool you…

I spent the majority of 2024 haphazardly chasing random projects.

I’d consider scaling my agency, launching a new offer, coaching,
crypto, etc.

After considering each thing for a week or two, I’d move on to
the next shiny solution.

This was quite idiotic and it halted my progress.

Because I was always half in, half out, I never put enough
attention or time into any one thing.

Now, I’m the opposite.

I have one objective every day:

Create content that makes more people know, like and trust me.

My main focus is solidified.

And after being on both sides, I can tell you with full
certainty, it’s much better this way.

When I was unfocused, there were days where I’d wake up and not
know what to do.

Although there was plenty of work to be done, I couldn’t pick one
thing.

It’s impossible to make progress this way.

But when you have one main objective, you wake up every day
knowing the levers you need to pull.

It feels amazing because you have clarity.

This allows you to perform effectively without constantly
pondering if you’re doing the right thing.

And if you’re stressed right now, it’s likely because you’re not
giving yourself that clarity.

You’re listening to Uncle Tony and Instagram theme pages.

To be entirely clear, this doesn’t mean you can never have
multiple businesses.

As you progress as an entrepreneur, opportunities fall into your
lap.

Oftentimes, those opportunities can complement one another.

But when you try to start too many new things at once without
having concrete objectives, you’re just distracting yourself.

Instead, focus on one main thing at a time.

Build it to a point where it doesn’t require your full attention.

And then think about other ways to grow.

Don’t get fooled into thinking you need 7 unprofitable
businesses.

You don’t get an award for opening up an LLC.

Money won’t magically start falling into your lap.

​Start with one cash flowing business and put your sole focus
into it. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqh6kdp0pbvhqlemrrrso/owhkhqhrzl2gzduv/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

You'll grow much faster.

Talk tomorrow,

Ben

​
​

​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqh6kdp0pbvhqlemrrrso
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqh6kdp0pbvhqlemrrrso
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

subject: How to be comfortably irresponsible with money
body:
I hit a new high score today.

$8.51.

Eight dollars and fifty one cents on an iced latte. Before tip.

To be fair, I added vanilla.

And yes, the vanilla does in fact cure cancer.

Pretty cool, right?

This got me thinking…

If you were to spend $8.51 on coffee every day, that’s $3,106.15
over the course of a year.

Meaning if you make $60k per year, you’re blowing over 5% of your
income on coffee.

“WeLl aCtuAlLy, YoU cOulD JuSt MaKe iT aT hoMe.”

Stop.

Here’s how to make enough money to enjoy your morning stroll in
the Miami sun and happily buy whatever coffee you want:

First things first, this will likely take two years.

Hey now, don’t leave just yet.

I know that sounds like a while but stick with me here…

Two years isn’t that long!

Okay, we just lost everyone else reading this so it’s just you me
now, bo.

Here are three steps to escape the cubicle…

Step 1. Learn copywriting

I’m not saying this to sell you, I’m saying this because it’s the
most versatile skill you can learn.

You can pitch local businesses, eCom brands, agencies, or
coaching businesses.

To reach escape velocity, you only need $5-10k/month.

That’s like two or three clients on retainer. Or one solid client
on a rev share (tutorial). (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hld5rv3brh8gom999tm/z2hghnh3gdk780sp/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vQXNHeUx6
)​

If you’re starting from zero, pitch anyone and everyone.

Take $500 retainers.

Do free work for a testimonial.

Work with your Grandma’s friend's niece who owns a wildly
unprofitable bakery (even though she sells $8 coffee).

You just need experience and money.

Do this for six months and you’ll be in a decent spot.

Let’s say you’re making around $5-7k per month…

Step 2. Move somewhere cheap

Get your passport, buddy. I hope you like latinas.

Head over to Tulum, Mexico or somewhere similar.

Bonus points if you make sure you’re not gonna get captured by a
local gang.

Now it’s time to lock in.

You’ll save most of your money and spend the time you’re not
working on a beach.

Stay here until you start making software engineer money.

For me this phase was four months.

By the end, I was making around $15k per month and had nearly
$100k in savings.

Step 3. Bienvenidos a Miami

subject: How to be comfortably irresponsible with money
body:
I hit a new high score today.

 $8.51.

 Eight dollars and fifty one cents on an iced latte. Before tip.

 To be fair, I added vanilla.

 And yes, the vanilla does in fact cure cancer.

 Pretty cool, right?

 This got me thinking…

 If you were to spend $8.51 on coffee every day, that’s $3,106.15 over the course of a year.

 Meaning if you make $60k per year, you’re blowing over 5% of your income on coffee.

 “WeLl aCtuAlLy, YoU cOulD JuSt MaKe iT aT hoMe.”

 Stop.

 Here’s how to make enough money to enjoy your morning stroll in the Miami sun and happily buy whatever coffee you want:

 First things first, this will likely take two years.

 Hey now, don’t leave just yet.

 I know that sounds like a while but stick with me here…

 Two years isn’t that long!

 Okay, we just lost everyone else reading this so it’s just you me now, {{ subscriber.first_name }}.

 Here are three steps to escape the cubicle…

 Step 1. Learn copywriting 

 I’m not saying this to sell you, I’m saying this because it’s the most versatile skill you can learn.

 You can pitch local businesses, eCom brands, agencies, or coaching businesses.

 To reach escape velocity, you only need $5-10k/month.

 That’s like two or three clients on retainer. Or one solid client on a rev share (tutorial). ​

 If you’re starting from zero, pitch anyone and everyone.

 Take $500 retainers.

 Do free work for a testimonial.

 Work with your Grandma’s friend's niece who owns a wildly unprofitable bakery (even though she sells $8 coffee).

 You just need experience and money.

 Do this for six months and you’ll be in a decent spot.

 Let’s say you’re making around $5-7k per month…

 Step 2. Move somewhere cheap 

 Get your passport, buddy. I hope you like latinas.

 Head over to Tulum, Mexico or somewhere similar.

 Bonus points if you make sure you’re not gonna get captured by a local gang.

 Now it’s time to lock in.

 You’ll save most of your money and spend the time you’re not working on a beach.

 Stay here until you start making software engineer money. 

 For me this phase was four months.

 By the end, I was making around $15k per month and had nearly $100k in savings.

 Step 3. Bienvenidos a Miami 

 Time to up the stakes.

 You’ve proven to yourself that you can consistently make money on your own.

 It doesn’t appear the business will randomly collapse any time soon. And if it does you’ve got some cash in the bank.

 Open up your wallet and find a spot in a bigger city.

 You’ll likely spend more on rent than you were spending total the previous few months.

 That’s okay, you need pressure.

 Between the pressure, your now year of experience in the game, and the connections you’ll make in your new city…

 It’s inevitable you’ll get to $30k, $50k, and eventually $100k/month plus.

 And maybe I’ll run into you in line to get a cancer-curing latte :)

 If you made it down here and you’re ready to do this…

 ​ Here’s a good place to start. ​

 Ben

 ​
​

subject: You're afraid of success and you know it
body:
Success comes with downsides…

More pressure.

Increased responsibility.

Higher standards.

Added expectations.

And greater consequences.

Sure, these are better problems to have.

But problems are problems, nonetheless.

There’ve been times in my life where I’ve sabotaged my own growth
in order to avoid these downsides.

It was almost subconscious.

I didn’t want the pressure of dealing with more clients, so I’d
“forget” to follow up with a lead.

Or I’d disqualify someone that I could’ve pitched and closed.

And as my brand has grown on social media, I’ve become more
particular with what I share.

A louder microphone means more attention.

More attention means greater consequences – for better or worse.

You can only grow as big as you allow yourself to be.

Yes, there are future repercussions that come with success.

But you want to know the key to getting over your fear?

Accept your unpreparedness.

You probably aren’t equipped to handle an abundance of
responsibility, attention, or expectations.

If tomorrow, you were given one million followers on social
media, a $500k/mo business, dozens of clients and a big team…

You’d probably crumble.

You’d be too nervous to post any content and continue growing
your brand.

Your clients and team members would leave because you don’t know
how to lead.

And the business would go to shit…

But that’s exactly why the journey exists.

It’s there to mold you into the person capable of receiving
success.

Go through challenges and tribulations. You’ll be forced to grow.

The more you overcome, the more prepared you become.

By the time you reach the top of the mountain, you’ll have won so
many battles that you’re bulletproof.

The “downsides” you were once afraid of no longer hold any power
over you.

Congrats, bo.

You’ve stopped running from the pressure.

Soon enough it’ll feel weightless,

Ben.

P.S. I’m taking on up to 20 new members inside of Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlp354dh8h8r5g222tl/7qh7h8hog0p5r3sz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) this month.

If you want to build and scale an agency/copywriting business
working with online coaches, I can help you.

This is best for existing copywriters, closers, agency owners,
and content creators.

If you’re a complete beginner, you’ll only be let in if you prove
that you’re competent and committed.

​Go here and apply now for small group and 1-1 coaching. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlp354dh8h8r5g222tl/7qh7h8hog0p5r3sz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

subject: Your $25,325 payout is on the way...
body:
The other day I got a $25,325 wire.

​
It’s one of a few 5 figure payments I’ll get from various clients
this month.

Just three years ago, I was struggling to land $1k retainers.

I was gonna make this email a step by step outline on how to land
whale clients…

​But I already did that here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hld4gk0frh8gom999tm/p8heh9hzvzg398sq/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vQXNHeUx6
)​

I’d rather tell you about the mindset shift you must go through
to get paid this much.

It’s a 25x increase from what I used to charge, but that doesn’t
mean I’m 25x more skilled.

I’d argue that I’m only 2-3x better than I was then.

There are two main difference makers here:

Key difference #1 – The ability to identify opportunity vehicles.

Not all clients are created equally.

Not all markets are created equally.

Not all business models are created equally.

A personal brand with thousands of followers in a specific niche
will make more money than a local basketball trainer.

That one's obvious but there’s a plethora of other factors that
factor into what makes a good client.

After doing this for a few years I’ve gotten better at
identifying them (I’ll show you how here). (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hld4gk0frh8gom999tm/6qheh8h7q7nkpzuo/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Key difference #2 – Who I believe I am.

I’m incredibly confident in my ability to scale businesses.

When I take someone on as a client, I am doing them a favor.

It is the best possible investment they can make.

Because we’re the best at what we do, that comes with a higher
price.

This is the frame you need to take to be successful.

Even before it’s true.

You can be confident in your willingness to figure out problems
on the fly.

And you can be confident in your work ethic.

With that, you’ll create data (making clients a bunch of money)
that solidifies your beliefs.

And next thing you know, you’ll have a client portfolio like the
one I have on here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hld4gk0frh8gom999tm/6qheh8h7q7nkpzuo/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

See you at the top,

Ben

​

​

subject: The antidote to shiny object syndrome
body:
The grass is greener where you water it.

I’ve been in the online business world for about four years now.

Every project I’ve worked on follows a similar timeline:

I start something new – it’s exciting and I’m eager to get the
ball moving.

Soon after, the initial excitement wears off.

The work starts to feel less like play and more like work.

But the momentum I’ve built up carries me and I keep progressing.

This is typically where exponential growth occurs.

It feels new enough to keep me engaged and I’ve accepted the
reality that it requires intentionality and focus.

Eventually the novelty completely fades.

I start dreading many of the tasks that used to feel easy.

I’m now solely relying on willpower, my enjoyment of the process
is gone.

This period continues until one of two things occur…

I find a way to spice things up and the potential for growth
reignites my spark.

Or I become completely uninterested with the project at hand and
pivot to something fresh.

This is a natural progression I see amongst nearly all of my
friends.

It’s not a bad thing, if you’re aware of it.

But if you’re unaware, you can convince yourself that the
business “doesn't feel right” it’s time to shift.

You’ll find a shinier objective and pursue it until the luster
inevitably wears off.

Again, you’ll search for something new and the cycle repeats.

This won’t lead to any meaningful progress.

On the contrary, you can accept that eventually the work will
become dull.

That doesn’t mean you’re going in the wrong direction.

It means you have to keep “watering the grass” even though it’s
redundant.

Excitement can only take you so far.

If you’re too reliant on it, your eyes will constantly wander.

But if you stay engaged, keep moving, and accept that the
excitement will come and go…

​That’s where the grass is greenest. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhvxqm7nighv4kelllf9/25h2hoh25d7k50u3/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Talk tomorrow,

Ben

​
​

​

https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhvxqm7nighv4kelllf9

subject: The antidote to shiny object syndrome
body:
The grass is greener where you water it.

 I’ve been in the online business world for about four years now.

 Every project I’ve worked on follows a similar timeline:

 I start something new – it’s exciting and I’m eager to get the ball moving.

 Soon after, the initial excitement wears off. 

 The work starts to feel less like play and more like work.

 But the momentum I’ve built up carries me and I keep progressing.

 This is typically where exponential growth occurs.

 It feels new enough to keep me engaged and I’ve accepted the reality that it requires intentionality and focus.

 Eventually the novelty completely fades.

 I start dreading many of the tasks that used to feel easy.

 I’m now solely relying on willpower, my enjoyment of the process is gone.

 This period continues until one of two things occur…

 I find a way to spice things up and the potential for growth reignites my spark.

 Or I become completely uninterested with the project at hand and pivot to something fresh.

 This is a natural progression I see amongst nearly all of my friends.

 It’s not a bad thing, if you’re aware of it.

 But if you’re unaware, you can convince yourself that the business “doesn't feel right” it’s time to shift.

 You’ll find a shinier objective and pursue it until the luster inevitably wears off.

 Again, you’ll search for something new and the cycle repeats.

 This won’t lead to any meaningful progress.

 On the contrary, you can accept that eventually the work will become dull.

 That doesn’t mean you’re going in the wrong direction.

 It means you have to keep “watering the grass” even though it’s redundant.

 Excitement can only take you so far.

 If you’re too reliant on it, your eyes will constantly wander.

 But if you stay engaged, keep moving, and accept that the excitement will come and go…

 ​ That’s where the grass is greenest. ​

 Talk tomorrow,

 Ben

 ​

subject: Stop concealing your desires
body:
I began writing to this list in 2021.

There were a little under 200 subscribers, all of which I’d
gotten through Twitter.

I started it solely for fun.

Since then, it’s grown by the tens of thousands and I’ve made
multiple six figures from it.

I get around 50% open rates.

Countless people have come up to me in real life telling me they
love my emails.

In fact, a few months ago I ran into a kind Australian guy who
was reading an email of mine as I walked into a coffee shop in
Brickell.

That was cool.

Of everything I’ve built online, this list is something I’m most
proud of.

I’m not telling you all of this to brag…

My approach here has never been very calculated.

I write these because I enjoy it.

Sure it’s made me money now, but I’d sent hundreds of emails
before ever pitching anything.

And I think that’s what makes it special.

Even if you’re not interested in anything I sell, you know that
when you open an email of mine you’ll get value from it.

Instead of viewing each email as a mini sales pitch, I write
about what I find interesting.

​My coaching (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh208lozhkhkdo8999s3/g3hnh5h3vxe405br/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) is here if you want it but I’m not shoving it down your throat.

This leads me to my main point:

You are rewarded most when your intentions are pure and honest.

In any interaction – business, dating, or socially…

You can feel it when someone wants something from you.

Every word out of their mouth is an attempt to get you to give
them what they want.

When they try to conceal that objective, you lose trust in them.

Now I’m not telling you that you can’t sell others on you.

But rather be open about the desired exchange in value.

If you’re trying to close a prospect, you need to show them why
they should buy from you.

Give them advice.

Tell them what they could do, even if they don’t work with you.

Prove that you are competent and you know what you’re talking
about.

The law of reciprocity is real.

As corny as it sounds, the more you give, the more you get.

Remain transparent with your motive behind giving.

And you will be rewarded with the things you want.

If you liked this one and want to work with me more closely, you
can do so here :) (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh208lozhkhkdo8999s3/g3hnh5h3vxe405br/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Happy Monday,

Ben

​

​

) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh208lozhkhkdo8999s3
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

subject: The AI prompt that cut my workload in half
body:
The setup is often more difficult to overcome than the
implementation.

It’s hard to get in the car and drive to the gym.

It’s easy to workout once you’re there.

Similarly, when I write these emails, the idea is half the
battle.

I’ll take a walk, stare at a blinking cursor, or scroll through
social media…

Dozens of potential topics come to mind, most of which I discard.

But finally, an idea that seems worthy of an email will emerge.

After that, the assembly of the words you’re reading now is the
easy part.

All I need is a rough idea.

Then I start typing, my brain starts cooking, and 20 minutes
later we’ve completed the task.

50% of my energy is spent on ideation, the other 50% on
implementation.

Here’s how AI can cut this time in half:

To be clear – it could write the entire email for me, but I like
writing these.

Instead, I’ll have it source an idea.

First I’ll upload a handful of my previous emails and/or Youtube
videos into Claude.

Next, I’ll prompt it with something like:

“Based on my previous content, give me five potential topics I
could write an email on in the future that align with my brand.”

Obviously I can get more specific here as well if I want to.

If I like the five ideas it gives me, I’ll ask it to generate
another 20.

And just like that, I have a month's worth of email topics ready
to go.

If you have a copywriting client or your own list, I encourage
you to try this out.

It’s a step you can take to start using AI that will make you
wildly more efficient.

Stop being afraid of AI.

It’s here to help you (at least for now).

It won’t replace you, but someone using it will.

​Be the hunter, not the hunted. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlpxngnh8h8r5g222tl/l2hehmh3gqrkl0u6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​
​

​

subject: The AI prompt that cut my workload in half
body:
The setup is often more difficult to overcome than the implementation.

 It’s hard to get in the car and drive to the gym.

 It’s easy to workout once you’re there.

 Similarly, when I write these emails, the idea is half the battle.

 I’ll take a walk, stare at a blinking cursor, or scroll through social media…

 Dozens of potential topics come to mind, most of which I discard.

 But finally, an idea that seems worthy of an email will emerge.

 After that, the assembly of the words you’re reading now is the easy part.

 All I need is a rough idea.

 Then I start typing, my brain starts cooking, and 20 minutes later we’ve completed the task.

 50% of my energy is spent on ideation, the other 50% on implementation.

 Here’s how AI can cut this time in half:

 To be clear – it could write the entire email for me, but I like writing these.

 Instead, I’ll have it source an idea.

 First I’ll upload a handful of my previous emails and/or Youtube videos into Claude.

 Next, I’ll prompt it with something like:

 “Based on my previous content, give me five potential topics I could write an email on in the future that align with my brand.”

 Obviously I can get more specific here as well if I want to.

 If I like the five ideas it gives me, I’ll ask it to generate another 20.

 And just like that, I have a month's worth of email topics ready to go.

 If you have a copywriting client or your own list, I encourage you to try this out.

 It’s a step you can take to start using AI that will make you wildly more efficient.

 Stop being afraid of AI.

 It’s here to help you (at least for now).

 It won’t replace you, but someone using it will.

 ​ Be the hunter, not the hunted. ​

 Ben

 ​
​

 ​

subject: You're being tricked
body:
You’re under attack.

Every day, hundreds of destructive thoughts enter your mind.

They’re deceptive and deceitful.

Their goal?

Keep you where you are and who you are.

They’ll try to convince you you’re underprepared or going in the
wrong direction.

“bo, you’re not ready to start yet… but maybe if you watch 12
more Hormozi videos you will be!”

Or “bo, this business model is too difficult, you should rent a
Corvette C8 (the lambo’s too expensive) and sell dropshipping
courses instead.

Sound familiar?

Your success is dependent on your ability to resist these tricks.

This magical utopia you envision where you love every second of
the journey doesn’t exist.

At least not on this spiritual plane.

There is no way to get around the fact that at times, work will
feel like work.

You’ll often feel underprepared.

Temptations of alternative routes will always be there.

These thoughts are natural.

But you must remember you live in reality – where nothing is ever
as good or as bad as it looks in your head.

Change is difficult.

Growth brings higher expectations.

And work gets redundant.

A sexier business model or new Youtube video are not the way
around this.

That’s your ego luring you into a trap.

Resist, my friend.

You know what needs to be done.

You don’t need more advice.

You don’t need a better vehicle.

Hit the gas and throw your rearview mirror out the window.

Ben

P.S. If you’re a copywriter, closer, or agency owner who wants to
be able to charge clients 5 figures a month, check out Artisan

subject: The strategy behind 6 figure launches
body:
In the past few years I’ve launched countless new offers for my
clients.

A few flopped.

A handful did okay.

And almost a dozen made six figures in the first 30 days.

In terms of percentages, we’re talking Barry Bonds PED era
numbers.

Our best was a $600k week.

Our worst was a single $997 sale.

But it's safe to say we’ve had a lot more winners than losers.

Here’s how to successfully crush a new info-product launch:

Phase 1: The offer

Half the battle is identifying what the audience wants.

That’ll be contingent on the type of content the client makes and
their field of expertise.

If they’ve attracted a mass market B2C audience, perhaps a
mid-ticket offer ($500-$2,000) will work better.

If it’s a more mature audience and the bulk of the value is in
access to the client, high ticket is the way to go.

99 times out of 100, avoid low ticket like the plague.

Our success has come through selling mid ticket via sales pages
and webinars, or high ticket through a VSL call funnel.

As a general rule of thumb, either price it at $3k+ and sell over
the phone.

Or price it between $500 to $2k and sell through a sales
page/webinar.

Phase 2: Pre-launch

Once you’ve decided on your offer and price point, now it’s time
to build hype.

Roughly two weeks before launch, make an announcement on all
channels.

Email, Instagram stories, existing communities, etc.

Your goal is to get people excited.

Identify the problem the audience is facing.

Use these channels to exacerbate their pain and explain how you
have a solution coming soon.

You can also build up a waitlist or start getting people to sign
up for a webinar.

As the launch approaches, increase the frequency of reminders.

Phase 3: Launch

Offer goes live.

Announce it on all channels.

Hammer the scarcity and urgency – why should they buy now?

The first batch can get special bonuses and/or discounted
pricing.

Set a date or (real) limit on how many people get access.

You’ll typically have a spike in sales immediately, it’ll sustain
for a few days, and then it’s time to remind them what they’ll
miss out on if they don’t get in now.

This should create an additional spike towards the end of the
launch.

Once all spots are filled, or the window is over, don’t go back
on your word.

Just like that, you’ve successfully made a doctor's annual salary
in a week or two.

And you didn’t even have to cheat your way through medical
school.

Congrats,

Ben

P.S. I share full breakdowns of this kind of stuff inside Artisan
Lab. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/r8u0o3z624hoh3322l5s2hdr0l666f7/48hvhehroll6zgix/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

If you want to see this entire process in depth, including:

- How to craft a winning offer that the audience will actually
want

- Selecting the perfect price point for the offer

- The exact emails/ strategies I’ve used to build hype

- How to write a launch VSL

- The full webinar template we’ve used to make six figures in a
single day

And much more…

​Go here to apply for coaching and steal everything I’ve learned
in the past couple of years. (

)​

​

subject: Why Growth Operating never truly worked
body:
Remember the whole “Growth Operating” (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/mvu840onxvs5hqqqk37bmhr8x6qqqh3/n2hohvh3d0q88nt6/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vV0RIcmph
) trend about a year ago?

It appears to be dead.

Brady and Eddie (the guys who popularized the model) are friends
of mine.

They actually paid me for a few consulting calls right before
Eddie’s brand started to blow up.

In no way am I intending to throw shade at them, but rather
objectively breakdown why the offer fell apart.

The traffic was great.

Eddie’s awesome on camera.

Brady’s a wizard on the backend.

And the online education industry is growing, so teaching people
how to capitalize on it makes sense.

The problem?

Positioning.

From the outside looking in, this appears to be the core problem.

The business model was drastically oversimplified.

It was marketed to beginners, with little focus on skill
acquisition and service delivery (at least front facing).

When you have a bunch of little idiots running around in a
community thinking it’ll be easy to make money online, that
creates some problems.

It’s not that what they taught was wrong, but the way they
positioned it was.

They clearly had many successful students.

But when you scale as high and as fast as they did, the majority
of your students will be complete beginners.

Most beginners fail.

The ones who succeed take longer to do so.

Couple this with the fact that it seemed like there was a new hit
piece going out on Eddie every day…

And the negative word of mouth associated with the term “Growth
Operating” spreads.

Next thing you know, the decline is steep and fast.

This is why I’ll never tell you that building an Info-Product
Agency is easy.

You’ll have to learn a lot.

It might take a while to get a really solid client.

If you’re not resilient, you’ll quit before you succeed.

But if you commit to the process?

A single client can change your life.

And soon enough, you can be one of the successful case studies we
have here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/mvu840onxvs5hqqqk37bmhr8x6qqqh3/48hvhehro8l55rcx/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

P.S. I just made a video going more in depth on everything I
talked about here.

​Come check it out. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/mvu840onxvs5hqqqk37bmhr8x6qqqh3/n2hohvh3d0q88nt6/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vV0RIcmph
)​

​

​

https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/mvu840onxvs5hqqqk37bmhr8x6qqqh3

subject: The gap gets wider
body:
“A good marketer can fully articulate why two opposing arguments
can both be true.” - Ben Bader

I’ve talked a lot about the benefits of AI.

It’s helped me become more efficient.

It’s given me content ideas.

And it’s helping the members inside Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h22dqp2sqhpnq5333hr/m2h7h5h8rdq83kim/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) get clients.

Although we’re just scratching the surface of potential use
cases, it’s already been an incredibly powerful tool.

But as stated in my quote above, I'd be a bad marketer if I
didn’t tell you about the downside of AI.

So without further ado, here’s how artificial intelligence could
ruin your life:

AI won’t save you, it’ll dig your grave for you.

Someone smart once said, “winners win and losers lose.”

In this case, AI won’t turn you from a loser to a winner.

It’ll make you a bigger loser.

If you get fooled into thinking you don’t have to work on your
craft because a robot will do your entire job for you, you'll
wind up replacing yourself.

Natural human creativity will be removed from the equation and
your quality of work will decline and become bland.

As implementation becomes easy, the one with the best idea wins.

This is especially true in the copywriting world.

If you think like everyone else, you’ll write like everyone else.

You won’t understand the difference between a good idea and a bad
idea.

You’ll sound like a robot.

And eventually, your over-reliance on AI will make you obsolete.

Congrats, you played yourself.

Now, if you use AI the right way…

As a tool to turbocharge your own ability, not as a replacement.

And you keep innovating, testing, and improving your craft.

You’ll be lightyears ahead of everyone else.

The gap gets wider.

Winners win, and losers lose.

If you want to avoid being on the losing team, don’t listen to
anyone who says AI can do your entire job for you (nothing is as
easy as it sounds).

And if you want to be on the winning team?

​Join me here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h22dqp2sqhpnq5333hr/m2h7h5h8rdq83kim/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​

​

 You’ll sound like a robot.

 And eventually, your over-reliance on AI will make you obsolete.

 Congrats, you played yourself.

 Now, if you use AI the right way…

 As a tool to turbocharge your own ability, not as a replacement.

 And you keep innovating, testing, and improving your craft.

 You’ll be lightyears ahead of everyone else.

 The gap gets wider.

 Winners win, and losers lose.

 If you want to avoid being on the losing team, don’t listen to anyone who says AI can do your entire job for you (nothing is as easy as it sounds).

subject: Why some are allergic to success
body:
I figured it out…

There’s a way to guarantee failure.

If you follow this foolproof failure formula, you’ll become
helpless and bitter.

And no matter what happens, it’ll never be your fault.

Last night, I was scrolling through Twitter before bed.

I saw a post that gave me nightmares.

It beautifully encapsulated the mindset required to lose.

A grown man said publicly… to thousands of people on the
internet… the following…

“I fucked up.

Burned through $18K in 5 months. Got about $20K left.

I should’ve gone to Asia instead of Canada.

If you’re living on savings, DO NOT move to the West. The same
money would’ve taken me 10x further.

Made no money while I’ve been here. Just watching my bank balance
shrink.

My X account is dead because I barely tweet. Years of growth,
gone.

Meanwhile, some people are making millions per month by selling
some stupid course on how to get rich.

I hate how unfair life can be.”

As I began reading the tweet I figured he’d turn it around at
some point.

You know like, hook you with a sob story and then tell you how he
persevered.

But there is no perseverance in sight.

Just pity and blame.

Normally I’m empathetic but this guy lost me when he started
hating on course gurus and said how life is unfair.

You can argue with reality, or you can learn the rules and win
the game.

Whatever you do, don’t start feeling sorry for yourself.

Don’t blame your inadequacies on external factors.

Don’t harbor resentment for those who find success.

And perhaps most importantly, don’t quit before it’s even close
to over.

That guy said he had $20k left and based on his spending that’s
another 6 months of expenses.

Even if he blew through that, there’s always another option.

You are as resilient as you allow yourself to be.

Nothing worth having comes easy.

You’ll be tested and tricked. But if you make it through, the
other side is beautiful.

And you’ll know that you earned it.

You only lose when you throw in the towel.

Don’t go crying to strangers on the internet,

Ben

P.S. While that guy wastes his last $20k feeling sorry for
himself, my students are building 6 and 7 figure agencies. Join
them here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h225nwgiqhpnq5333hr/l2hehmh3gxzqx5f6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

​
​

​

https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h225nwgiqhpnq5333hr
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h225nwgiqhpnq5333hr

 Made no money while I’ve been here. Just watching my bank balance shrink. 

 My X account is dead because I barely tweet. Years of growth, gone. 

 Meanwhile, some people are making millions per month by selling some stupid course on how to get rich. 

 I hate how unfair life can be.” 

 As I began reading the tweet I figured he’d turn it around at some point.

 You know like, hook you with a sob story and then tell you how he persevered.

 But there is no perseverance in sight.

 Just pity and blame.

 Normally I’m empathetic but this guy lost me when he started hating on course gurus and said how life is unfair.

 You can argue with reality, or you can learn the rules and win the game.

 Whatever you do, don’t start feeling sorry for yourself.

 Don’t blame your inadequacies on external factors.

 Don’t harbor resentment for those who find success.

 And perhaps most importantly, don’t quit before it’s even close to over.

 That guy said he had $20k left and based on his spending that’s another 6 months of expenses.

 Even if he blew through that, there’s always another option.

 You are as resilient as you allow yourself to be.

 Nothing worth having comes easy. 

 You’ll be tested and tricked. But if you make it through, the other side is beautiful.

 And you’ll know that you earned it.

 You only lose when you throw in the towel.

 Don’t go crying to strangers on the internet,

 Ben

 P.S. While that guy wastes his last $20k feeling sorry for himself, my students are building 6 and 7 figure agencies. Join them here. ​

 ​
​

 ​

subject: Most course sellers are lying about this
body:
“If what they taught actually worked, they wouldn’t be selling a
course on it.”

This is a common argument you’ve probably heard against course
sellers.

It’s a valid concern and true in some cases.

Many reach an iota of success from their business and immediately
start selling info on it.

That annoys the hell out of me.

A singular $10k month does not make you an expert.

Personally, I made over $100k/mo with my agency before I ever
sold coaching.

Here’s a literal screenshot from my bank statement in September
2023 for proof:

​
That being said, different business models scale to varying
levels.

For example most closers cap out around $20-30k/mo.

Let's say a closer reaches that number for a while.

After a year or two in sales, they begin selling info on it and
get to $100k/mo as a coach.

I see no problem with it as long as they’re not claiming you can
make 6 figures monthly from sales.

It’s a good beginner business model to make your first
$10-30k/mo.

But it’s quite the anomaly to scale past that.

This is the case for many of the other popular business models as
well.

However, the Info-Product Agency (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu8dq3lkes7hnn5q9nb6h95x8444an/7qh7h8hogg9xp8hz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) is different.

Even if you’re just starting out, a few retainers and/or rev
shares can get you past $10k/month.

Once you do that, you’ll be much more skilled.

And then you can start getting bigger clients and higher rev
shares.

That can take you to $50k or even $100k/month like it did for me.

I made over $2m in about two years from my agency.

I got a high rise in Miami from my agency money.

I bought my dream car from my agency money.

Most people who sell coaching can’t say that the business they
teach made them rich.

They made good money from it, but great money from info.

I’m doing both.

So my question for you is this…

Would you rather pick a business model that inevitably caps out
at a relatively low income threshold?

Or would you rather pick a model that can scale to 7 figures
annually?

(Which is not easy whatsoever but it is possible, as I am living
proof).

That’s a choice you’ll have to make.

But if you wanna learn from someone who got rich by doing, not
teaching…

​Go here now and get access to my blueprint. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu8dq3lkes7hnn5q9nb6h95x8444an/7qh7h8hogg9xp8hz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

To ethical info,

Ben

​

subject: I accidentally replaced myself
body:
Each morning as I open a blank Google doc to write to you, I
consider using AI.

It could write the whole thing for me.

I’d skim the copy, making sure it didn’t say anything super
cringey.

And after a few edits, we’d be done.

You’d probably never know it’s robot Ben and not real Ben.

It’s tempting, but I’ll never do it.

Or maybe I’m doing it right now and tricking you?

Either way, here’s what I would do if I were a lazy piece of shit
who didn’t want to write these emails manually:

Step 1. Open a new project in Claude.

I’d upload my last 25+ emails as PDFs.

Then prompt Claude to build a full breakdown of my style and
tone.

Perhaps I’d have it create a list of frequent topics I write
about as well.

This would likely be the most time consuming part, but once it’s
done, we’re smooth sailing.

Step 2. Transcribe my Youtube videos

Let’s say I make a Youtube video about why eating seed oils gives
you superpowers.

I could take that transcript and upload it to Claude.

Then I’d say, “Hey Mr. Claude. Please write a complete email to
my list in my tone and style using a topic from the seed oil
superpower video. P.S. You look really handsome today.”

My glorious robot would then give me a complete email.

And after a few tweaks, you’d be sitting here reading it with no
idea it’s AI copy.

The only downside here is transcribing the videos could take a
bit.

I share a way where you can drastically speed up that process
here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hll7kzgi8h8r5g222tl/l2hehmhl54vkodh6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Step 3. Get creative

Once I have this AI version of me (which I could actually make
even better by fine tuning it, but that’s a bit harder), the
sky’s the limit.

I could give it an idea and analogy to use and have it spit out
an email.

I could tell it to reference a book I’m reading or use a lesson
from a certain movie.

I could have it write a complete email based on one of my Tweets.

As long as I’m creative with my prompts, the emails would never
get redundant or feel like AI.

Now I enjoy writing these so I’ll never do that.

But if I wanted to, I could.

Which is pretty cool.

However I must add a big caveat here:

If you’re not already a decent copywriter, this won’t work for
you.

I’ve written hundreds of emails. I easily come up with creative
analogies and metaphors.

The process is second nature at this point.

Because of these reasons, AI can be useful.

But without them, it’s like giving nuclear launch codes to a
squirrel on meth.

No bueno.

Still typing my own damn emails,

Ben

P.S. There’s a way to make the process I outlined here take
minutes instead of hours. I’ve built a system that cuts the time
down by 80%. Soon I’ll be able to share it publicly, but for now
you can get exclusive access by going here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hll7kzgi8h8r5g222tl/l2hehmhl54vkodh6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

​
​

​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hll7kzgi8h8r5g222tl
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hll7kzgi8h8r5g222tl
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205

subject: Value is overrated
body:
I really could care less about you today.

No offense.

I’m not gonna pretend to give you value here.

It’s a rather low status action.

“I need to give my audience VALUE, so they will like me and buy
from me.”

Grow up.

I’d rather you buy from me because I made you laugh.

Anyway, I’m getting a haircut in two hours.

I considered canceling because my barber is being a dick.

I texted to confirm.

He liked the message.

No “awesome, see you then!” or even a simple “bet, locked you
in.”

Just a thumbs up 👍🏼.

That’s a man who really doesn’t care about giving value.

But I won’t leave him -- finding a solid barber who speaks
English in Miami is like finding a virgin in a brothel.

Impossible.

The thing about “value” is it’s finite.

Every creator eventually runs out of new things to say.

Once they’ve said it all, they just repeat themselves -- like
actors reciting lines they know will resonate.

People feel indebted to them, so they keep buying their stuff.

But let's be real – people don't stay subscribed to my emails
because I'm constantly dropping value bombs.

They stay because they like how I communicate.

Because I'm not afraid to say what everyone else is thinking.

Because sometimes, reading an honest email is more refreshing
than another "7 tips to crush your goals" bullshit.

So apologies, I gave you zero value today.

But if we’re being honest, you don’t need more value.

Do outreach. Make content. Get clients or customers.

Stop looking for value bombs.

​Start doing the actual work. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh22q595bkhkdo8999s3/vqh3hrho23k2dwcg/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

You're welcome.

Thumbs up only,

Ben

​
​

​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh22q595bkhkdo8999s3
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue9mz0kxhoh22q595bkhkdo8999s3
) | 113 Cherry St #92768, Seattle, WA 98104-2205
