subject: Play fast, but not in a hurry
body:
Money flows to those who deserve it.

If you’re not making as much as you want, it’s NOT because you’re
missing a strategy.

A better business model isn’t the solution.

A new outreach script won’t save you.

And whatever excuse you’re coming up with is pure cope.

I shouldn’t be telling you this.

Instead I should tell you that if you’re not making the money you
want, it’s not your fault…

You just need a better system.

You’ve been lied to by the gurus, school system, society, blah
blah blah.

To be fair – maybe 10% of the people reading this are actually in
a bad vehicle and need to switch.

But for the other 90%, I’ll hold your hand when I say this…

You. Are. The. Problem.

I’m sorry to burst your bubble, but the reason your life sucks is
not because of the people who run Hollywood.

It’s because you have a skill deficiency.

No replies to outreach? Skill issue.

No views on your content? Skill issue.

Women run away from you? Skill issue.

I know I’m being harsh here and I empathize with you if you’re in
the trenches right now.

But when you take full ownership and fix your skill gap…

You’ll notice something strange start to happen – because skill
isn’t the only variable.

There’s an invisible element that amplifies or blocks your
results.

It’s your energy and your intention.

People can just feel it.

Let’s use outreach as an example.

I’ve seen people come into Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhvn3memighvqxpmllf9hkmlpo/l2hehmhlz7qq4zb6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) and get clients in their first week.

Others seem to struggle for months.

The interesting part is they’re using the same outreach
strategies.

Why does Person A send 10 outbound messages and get 3 clients
when Person B sends 30 and gets 0 replies?

Intention.

People can tell whether you’re moving from confidence or
desperation.

When you’re desperate, they can smell it through the screen.

You try to rush the process…

You get angry when people don’t reply.

You get bitter when you see others win.

I had a basketball coach who’d always say “play fast, but not in
a hurry.”

When you hurry, you get sloppy.

You forget about the details.

You try to run too fast and trip over your feet.

Business is no different.

Desperation makes the Universe say… “nah, you’re not ready yet.”

Move with speed. But don’t rush.

Your time is coming, you just have to stop scaring the money
Gods.

If you're ready, I can help you here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhvn3memighvqxpmllf9hkmlpo/l2hehmhlz7qq4zb6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​
​
​

​

​

) | 2125 Biscayne Blvd, Ste 204, Miami, FL 33137

Ben here,

Congrats b, you just made a great decision.

You're all signed up for my AI Operating masterclass on July 23rd
at 7pm EST.

And yes, it'll actually be live (not pretend live lol).

Before the class, there are some things I want to share with you,
so stick with me for a sec, okay?

First things first, this information has the potential to change
your life.

We're gonna be sharing the full blueprint on how AI Operating has
given me and my students our dream lives.

Real quick, if you're newer here, this is how AI Operating works:

We find successful personal brands who are selling online courses
and coaching.

We identify where there are gaps in their business and solve them
using AI.

They pay us a monthly revenue share (20%+) because we're directly
helping them make more money while doing 90% less work.

Make sense? Good.

I've made over $2.5M doing this, and my students are crushing it
too.

Jace made $204k in one month from ONE client.

Danny went from $5k/month with a bunch of agency clients to
$150k/month with one AI Operating partnership.

The reason it works is because it's NOT just a business model.
It's a skill set that makes you irreplaceable.

With this skill set, you become the most valuable person in any
personal brand's business.

This not only allows you to charge revenue shares that pay you
like a business partner, but it also makes you recession-proof.

And on the free class I'm gonna show you the exact steps you need
to take to put yourself in this position.

This can turn you into a money printer. I promise.

Not long ago, I was a lost frat bro with no direction in life.

Making $5k per month sounded like a pipedream.

I figured the successful people online were either scammers or
they were smarter than me.

But I started taking action, I built my skill set, and now I'm
here in my Miami penthouse with my dream car.

And I can tell you with 100% certainty, I am no smarter than you.
I've simply made a series of good decisions that have resulted in
progress.

And you, b, made a good decision by signing up for the free
class.

subject: Why I almost quit (and how that led to millions)
body:
b,

Since you just signed up for the AI Operating class, I want to
tell you how I discovered this business model.

It wasn't some grand plan or genius insight.

I was basically forced into it because I was about to have a
mental breakdown.

Three years ago, I was running a traditional SMMA working with
basketball trainers.

Making decent money ($15k/month) but it was an absolute
nightmare.

I had 15 clients paying $1k each, which sounds fine until you
realize that managing that many clients is like having over a
dozen 9-5 jobs.

Constant churn, always one bad month away from disaster, working
12+ hours a day just to keep the lights on.

I remember sitting in my apartment in Mexico thinking there has
to be a better way to do this without wanting to throw my laptop
out the window every day.

That's when I had the lightbulb moment that changed everything:

Instead of working with broke local businesses, why not partner
with the people making millions online

The course sellers, the gurus, the personal brands who are
absolutely crushing it but drowning in operations because they're
trying to do everything themselves.

These people were making $100k-$500k+ per month but were one
system failure away from losing their minds.

They needed someone to handle the funnels, copy, sales team
management, email marketing, and all the backend systems that
actually make money.

So I pivoted.

Instead of 15 clients at $1k each, I got ONE client and
negotiated a 15% revenue share.

When he did $100k that month, I made $15k.

Same money, one client, way less headache, and I could actually
sleep at night.

That was the birth of what I now call "AI Operating" (though AI
wasn't even a thing yet, so I was doing everything manually like
a caveman).

Now with AI, you can do what used to take me weeks in just hours.

It's honestly unfair how much easier this has become.

On the webinar, I'll show you exactly how this works and how
students are using AI to land these partnerships faster than I
ever could have imagined.

See you there,

Ben

P.S. If you haven't joined the private Telegram chat to get
exclusive updates prior to the event, you can do so by clicking
here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/n4u0kgn5wzhqu8x5er3f6h6pq0kggalh72vgw/6qheh8hldx4d0vho/aHR0cHM6Ly90Lm1lLytXd1kwc3JvUFU4Rm1ZbVZo
)​

​

​

​

​

subject: b, meet Jace
body:
Let me tell you a story that’ll probably make you question your
life choices.

Meet Jace.

​
He used to run an SMMA working with real estate agents.

Found some success, then it all came crashing down when he had to
refund a bunch of clients.

But he didn’t quit – that’d be a rather depressing story and I
definitely wouldn’t be writing about him right now.

Instead, he pivoted.

Why work with obnoxious, entitled realtors when you can work with
personal brands and make more money with less headache?

Realizing this, Jace decided to dip his toe into the AI Operating
world.

Not long after, he got two clients and was making around
$10k/month, but it was inconsistent and he wanted to scale.

That’s when he joined Artisan Lab.

From there, it took him six months to get to $50k/month. And just
one month later, he made over $90k.

But here’s where it gets absolutely insane…

Last month, Jace made $204k. From ONE client.

​
Now this isn’t like dropshipping or Amazon FBA where you take
home 10% of that.

This is a high-margin, cash flow business where you’re keeping
60-80% of what you bring in.

He now has a few clients, is getting insane results for them, and
has built a team around himself to scale.

Jace got here by mastering a few key things:

1. Finding the right clients (info-product businesses with
existing traffic)

2. Structuring profitable rev share deals

3. Building a predictable system that scales

And obviously – working really fucking hard.

He went from making roughly $120k per year to over a MILLION
DOLLARS per year in 7 months.

This is what I mean when I say AI Operating is replacing
traditional agencies.

Why stack $2k retainers when you can get 30-40% of a
million-dollar launch?

On the webinar, I’ll break down exactly how Jace (and dozens of
other students) made this transition from grinding for scraps to
landing these massive revenue share deals.

July 23rd, 7pm EST.

Don’t miss it,

Ben

P.S. Now I can’t promise you the same results as Jace because
frankly, his results are insane and he’s a maniac (in a good
way).

But if you put in the effort and follow the same principles, it’d
be reasonable to assume you can achieve a fraction of his
success.

And even a fraction would completely transform most people’s
lives.

​

​

​

​

subject: Exclusive invitation for b
body:
On October 16th, 2022 I got a $5,000 payment that changed my
life.

Not because of the money, but what happened after.

I had this client who was paying me $2k-$3k/mo for emails and
funnel copy.

After working together for a few months, I started to consider
how else I could help the business grow.

That’s when I stumbled upon this book called One To Many.

It’s written by a guy named Jason Fladlien – many refer to him as
the “Webinar Goat” (like Bonnie Blue but for virtual events).

Here’s what I learned:

Why sell to only one person at a time, when you can run a live
event and sell to many people?

Good point, Jason.

So I followed his framework, added in my own sauce and sold my
client on running a webinar.

I spent a few days putting everything together.

We promoted it through organic content for a week.

And we ended up with around 2,000 registrants by the time of the
webby.

It's Thursday night, 7pm EST.

Close to a thousand people show up.

The training goes well.

But then, we get to the end.

This is the part where we say…

“Hey, hope you enjoyed all the free game we just gave you. If you
want more coaching, here’s an offer.”

We pitch… and nobody buys.

I’m thinking, “did Jason Fladlien lie to me? Does this shit not
actually work?”

And then I see a few messages in the chat.

“It won’t let me buy.”

“It says purchase invalid.”

I test a payment myself. It doesn’t work.

After sending a threat to Russel Brunson and his family, I
replace our Clickfunnels link with a direct checkout Stripe link.

The money starts coming in.

$5k…$10k…$20k…$40k.

It just spawned out of thin air.

That’s when I knew I stumbled into something special.

We started running weekly webinars.

I pulled the strings on the backend, and my client put on a show
each week.

Although I only had a 10% rev share, I made $12,900 from that one
client in December 2022.

That’s when it clicked.

Why would I try to get a bunch of clients, when I can focus on
scaling with a few?

Since then, I’ve built webinar funnels that generated up to $600k

subject: Exclusive invitation for {{ subscriber.first_name | default: "you" }}
body:
On October 16th, 2022 I got a $5,000 payment that changed my life.

 Not because of the money, but what happened after.

 I had this client who was paying me $2k-$3k/mo for emails and funnel copy.

 After working together for a few months, I started to consider how else I could help the business grow.

 That’s when I stumbled upon this book called One To Many. 

 It’s written by a guy named Jason Fladlien – many refer to him as the “Webinar Goat” (like Bonnie Blue but for virtual events).

 Here’s what I learned:

 Why sell to only one person at a time, when you can run a live event and sell to many people?

 Good point, Jason.

 So I followed his framework, added in my own sauce and sold my client on running a webinar.

 I spent a few days putting everything together.

 We promoted it through organic content for a week.

 And we ended up with around 2,000 registrants by the time of the webby.

 It's Thursday night, 7pm EST.

 Close to a thousand people show up.

 The training goes well.

 But then, we get to the end.

 This is the part where we say…

 “Hey, hope you enjoyed all the free game we just gave you. If you want more coaching, here’s an offer.”

 We pitch… and nobody buys.

 I’m thinking, “did Jason Fladlien lie to me? Does this shit not actually work?”

 And then I see a few messages in the chat.

 “It won’t let me buy.”

 “It says purchase invalid.”

 I test a payment myself. It doesn’t work.

 After sending a threat to Russel Brunson and his family, I replace our Clickfunnels link with a direct checkout Stripe link.

 The money starts coming in.

 $5k…$10k…$20k…$40k.

 It just spawned out of thin air.

 That’s when I knew I stumbled into something special.

 We started running weekly webinars.

 I pulled the strings on the backend, and my client put on a show each week.

 Although I only had a 10% rev share, I made $12,900 from that one client in December 2022.

 That’s when it clicked.

 Why would I try to get a bunch of clients, when I can focus on scaling with a few?

 Since then, I’ve built webinar funnels that generated up to $600k in a week and got me paid handsomely from my rev share.

 Not because I’m special…

 But because I found a system that works.

 This Wednesday (July 23) at 7pm EST, I’ll be showing you that system…

 On a free live webinar :)

 ​ How To Make $20,000+/Month From ONE Client Using AI Operating. ​

 If you want to escape retainers and start earning rev share by printing money for personal brands…

 Sign up here: https://go.benbader.com/register ​

 Ben

 ​

subject: The biggest mistake I see (don't do this)
body:
b,

I see this mistake constantly, and it makes me want to shake
people through the computer screen.

Someone wants to start making money online, so they think: "I
need to build an audience first."

Wrong.

That's like saying you need to become a celebrity before you can
work in Hollywood.

Building an audience takes years, most people fail spectacularly,
and even if you succeed...

You're competing with thousands of other "experts" who are all
saying the same recycled garbage.

Here's what smart people do instead (and by smart people, I mean
people who want to make money this decade):

They find someone who ALREADY has the audience and become their
right-hand operator.

Think about it logically for two seconds.

They spent years building the audience, they have the personal
brand and credibility...

They have this as an asset, but they're drowning in operations
because they're trying to do everything themselves like some kind
of business superhero.

You come in and say:

"Focus on content and being the face. I'll handle everything
else. Give me 20% of whatever we make together."

It's a no-brainer for them.

They get their life back and can focus on what they're actually
good at.

You get paid like a business partner without having to be on
camera or build an audience from scratch.

This is called "attention hijacking" and it's the core of AI
Operating.

Instead of spending 3-5 years trying to become the next guru (and
probably failing), you partner with existing gurus and make guru
money without being the face.

Way smarter, way faster, way more profitable, and you don't have
to deal with internet trolls commenting on your posts.

I'll show you exactly how to do this on the webinar.

See you on July 23rd at 7pm EST,

Ben

​

subject: Dr. GPT diagnosed me with a serious condition...
body:
Today is one of those days.

I’ve been looking at this screen for 20 minutes.

I typed a few words five minutes ago, but deleted them.

Since I don’t have anything to talk about yet, I’ll remind you to
sign up for my free live webinar (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0hoq7ekkhmhzpvrq44clhndgov/7qh7h8h9m2qzglsz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
) if you haven’t already.

Now back to our regularly scheduled programming…

I’m four days Zyn free.

I kept seeing people online talk about how much better their life
has gotten since they quit.

So I considered it a sign from the Universe…

Or maybe it’s just the Chinese social media algorithm fooling me
into being less powerful.

But I figured what the hell, I’ll try it out.

I’ve been a semi-regular user of these little nicotine pouches
for about two years.

I’d typically take 3-5 a day, which is light compared to most
Zyners.

So I assumed quitting would be easy.

I was wrong.

Over the last few days, I’ve been irritable, sluggish, and
weirdly indifferent to everything.

At first, I thought it was just a temporary lull.

But then I asked my doctor (Chat GPT) about common nicotine
withdrawal symptoms.

And Dr. GPT told me I’m experiencing them.

So here I am, struggling through this email, zynless.

I’ve got no punchline for you today.

The only reason I’m continuing this little experiment is because
of data.

Allegedly, symptoms peak in the first 3-5 days.

Then, after a month or so, your dopamine starts to recalibrate
and you return to “normal” – but better.

I wanna see if that’s true.

I also want to see if I can still write a decent email when I’m
brain-fogged and mildly homicidal.

Anyway, I’ll leave you with this:

Most people quit hard things right before it starts to get
easier.

Sometimes you just need a little faith in the data.

See you on the webinar. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0hoq7ekkhmhzpvrq44clhndgov/7qh7h8h9m2qzglsz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
)​

Zynlessly yours,

Ben

​

​
​

​

​

​

subject: You got cheated on
body:
“What’s the best business model to start that’ll get me to
$10k/mo in 90 days?”

I spent six months Googling that question every day.

Because of that, it took me about two years longer than it
should’ve.

Instead of locking in to build one thing, my eyes always wandered
to the badder bitch.

Social media is like the playboy mansion for business models, so
there were plenty.

This is a common mishap. Nearly everyone goes through a phase
where they’re in a situationship with eight different businesses.

Somehow you convince yourself that they’re all mid or not “wifey
material.”

So you refuse to commit to any one of them and proclaim every
business is a whore!

The other day, I met an Uber driver with possibly the worst case
of shiny object syndrome I’d ever seen.

First he told me about his dropshipping business where he sold
Donald Trump t-shirts.

Then his “tinder for injury lawyers.”

Then his contracting business.

Then his AI only fans agency.

Then he showed me a demo account where he allegedly turned $1k
into $10m.

Oh, and then he asked me for $100k so he could do it with real
money.

I politely declined.

The thing is, this guy actually seemed pretty intelligent.

He showed me the websites he built for each business and they
were clean.

His ideas were thorough and it’s clear he was doing his research…

Too much research.

You can convince yourself any business is better than what you’re
doing.

They all look sexy from afar.

But one day, you’ll wake up next to it and see it without makeup.

And only then will you realize it’s been using Facetune and AI
filters.

You’ll find the shortcut once you stop looking for it.

You commit. You ignore the temptation. And you build with speed
and enough patience.

Just don’t wife a hoe, pick the right model.

That’s exactly why you signed up for this AI Operating webinar.

You made the right choice. This is the model that’s actually
working right now.

But now you have to show up and commit to learning it.

July 23rd at 8pm EST...

You'll join me here:
https://event.webinarjam.com/go/live/3/6rv7mh7fgs2s6 (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/68u8vxpw9qsouk560rpbohpxdqnkkh9h79pno/48hvhehmnxwrmnfx/aHR0cHM6Ly9ldmVudC53ZWJpbmFyamFtLmNvbS9nby9saXZlLzMvNnJ2N21oN2ZnczJzNg==
)​

Don’t be the Uber driver with 8 different businesses and no
results.

See you in three days,

Ben

​

subject: Stop picturing your dream life
body:
Happy Monday, let’s make some money this week.

We’re only 2 days away from this (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hle3ll6urh87xl699cmh7qno0/e0hph7h72dlz9ga8/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
) (and it should help you do the above).

See you there.

Anyway, we’re gonna try an exercise today.

Yes, you and I are gonna exercise in this email.

Let’s begin:

Everyone tells you to picture your dream life.

Imagine…

You wake up in Bali.

You’re surrounded by nature.

The random chick you brought home last night didn’t steal your
Rolex.

And you’re working a few hours a day from your laptop.

What a life.

This type of visualization is sexy.

And it works – to an extent.

But sometimes, you need the opposite motivation.

Instead of chasing pleasure, let's run away from pain.

Imagine it doesn’t work out.

You never actually put your all into it.

You blame the gurus, your Mom, and big pharma.

You try to convince yourself that the “normal” life isn’t that
bad.

And to be fair, it’s not.

A Corolla will still get you from point A to point B.

You’ll pretend to be in love with the girl you felt pressured to
marry because you were getting older.

And every day will be predictable.

Clock in, clock out. Get a beer after work.

Roll your eyes when you see young people on social media driving
supercars.

Tell yourself, “They aren’t happy! They’re victims of materialism
and capitalism.”

Maybe you’re right, maybe you’re coping. Doesn’t really matter.

At the end of the day, this isn’t a bad life.

But if you’re wired like me, you know it would drive you insane.

The question “what if” would always linger.

You’ll avoid looking at yourself in the mirror because you don’t
want to face it.

You knew you wanted more, but you got really good at pretending
you didn’t.

And even if on the outside it doesn’t look that bad…

You’ll be miserable knowing you settled.

Is that the life you want?

I doubt it.

I know that wasn’t as fun as visualizing a supercar and
supermodel.

But sometimes you need a harder push.

If you want to give yourself a shot at the other life (the one
you actually want)...

I’ll see you Wednesday at 7pm EST. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hle3ll6urh87xl699cmh7qno0/e0hph7h72dlz9ga8/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
)​

Ben

​
​

​

​

​

​

https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/gku0o3gldmh5hle3ll6urh87xl699cmh7qno0

subject: The valley of despair
body:
b,

48 hours until the AI Operating masterclass (July 23rd at 7pm
EST).

And I’m thinking about something that might help you right now…

You may have heard of the emotional cycle of change before.

Almost five years ago, I sat in my college dorm room watching a
Jason Capital video.

As he articulated this concept, it matched up perfectly with my
journey over the previous year.

Everything I tried, I failed.

Well… I’d quit and start something new before I could really
fail.

But as I learned about the five stages of change, I finally felt
understood.

I thought I was broken…

It felt like this whole online business thing worked for everyone
but me.

And only then did I learn that what I experienced was normal.

* Uninformed optimism - “This new business is gonna print and
I’ll be in a red LaFerrari with a baddie in the passenger seat in
no time.”
* Informed pessimism - “Uhhhh why is no one replying to my
outreach messages? I thought this was gonna be easy.”
* Valley of despair - “Maybe I’m not cut out for this… Or maybe I
just need to try a different business model. Yes, that’s it! I’m
gonna be an AI Fighter Jet pilot.”
* Informed optimism - “Nah, I’m gonna stick this out. I know
it’ll be difficult but I can do it.”
* Success and fulfillment - “Hello, MTV welcome to my Penthouse.”

Here’s why I’m telling you this 48 hours before our webinar…

One of my Artisan Lab members, Brady, made $250,000 from one
client in one month.

Yes, you read that right.

After we did his interview, he told me that he almost quit a year
ago.

He was grinding, but making no money and fell deep into the
valley of despair.

Around that time, I made a YouTube video about the emotional
cycle of change.

He said that video convinced him to keep pushing…

Fast forward just one year, and he’s hitting six figure months.

By signing up for this AI Operating webinar, you’ve already moved
into stage 4 - informed optimism.

You’ve decided to learn the model that’s actually working instead
of jumping to another shiny object.

Don’t let yourself slip back into the valley of despair now.

Show up in 48 hours and get the system that can change
everything.

July 23rd at 7pm EST -
https://event.webinarjam.com/go/live/3/6rv7mh7fgs2s6 (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/4zupx8r403s7u5pqk8ouxh64drl77a5hmzg69/kkhmh6hn3orz58sl/aHR0cHM6Ly9ldmVudC53ZWJpbmFyamFtLmNvbS9nby9saXZlLzMvNnJ2N21oN2ZnczJzNg==
)​

See you there,

Ben

​

subject: The "high ticket sales" lie
body:
I've got one more story for you before tomorrows webinar...

One of my best friends is this 21 year old kid named Phillip.

I originally met him because he stalked me, sent me a dollar on
Venmo, and I sent him $1,000 back.

He was a stranger at the time.

Fast forward a couple years and he lives a dozen floors below me
in Miami.

For the past year or so, he’s been closing and managing the sales
team for a former client of mine.

He’s made great money doing it and has helped the business scale.

But he ran into an issue…

Over half of his income came from him personally closing deals.

Meaning if he wanted to continue making the same amount of money,
he had to be on zoom for the majority of each day.

Nearly anyone would get exhausted after spending the better half
of the past year on calls.

So, he decided to take a step back.

His goal? Get off sales calls and transition into something with
more leverage.

That meant he’d take a pay cut.

And if he wanted to even cover living expenses for the next month
he’d have to go get clients.

But as Plato said, “Eh, fuck it.”

Or maybe it was “Necessity is the mother of invention.”

That’s when I taught him the AI Operating model.

Instead of being stuck on calls all day, he could partner with
personal brands, handle their entire backend using AI, and get
revenue shares.

Phillip’s AI Operating business was born and here’s what happened
next:

He hit $100k in a month with just 3 clients.

​
Six months ago, he was making $30k/month but working 12+ hours a
day, basically living on Zoom calls like a prisoner.

Now he makes almost 3x more working half the time and actually
has a life outside of his laptop.

Aaand the only difference is...

He learned the AI Operating model I’m teaching on tomorrow’s
webinar.

He stopped trading time for money and started getting rev shares
instead.

This is the power of what I’ll show you tomorrow.

You’re not selling your time, you’re selling your systems.

You build it once, it runs forever, and you get paid like you own
part of the business.

)​
⏰ 90 minutes + Q&A

Don’t miss it,

Ben

P.S. If you’re stuck in sales like Phillip was, tomorrow’s
webinar will show you the way out.

subject: This won’t change your life
body:
I just swatted a mosquito.

Little buddy was buzzing around in front of my computer.

A split second later, he got evaporated by my hand and never saw
it coming.

Sorry bro.

Speaking of heroic acts, the AI Operating Masterclass is tonight
at 7pm EST.

​Here’s your last chance to register. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h294vxluqhpek8933hrhm042p/9qhzhnhdl72r2za9/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
)​

I woke up in a good mood today, so I’m also giving away an
hour-long outreach workshop to everyone who attends (for free).

Anyway, tonight's webinar won’t change your life.

90% of you will do absolutely nothing with the information I give
you.

After the class, you’ll think to yourself…

“Wow this is really cool! I’m gonna follow the proven roadmap Ben
just laid out for me.”

Maybe you’ll try it for a week.

The emotional high will wear off.

And you’ll start thinking “I should start an AI OF Agency
instead!”

The cycle continues.

I don’t mean to be a doomer here but that’s just how it goes.

But for you, b it could be different.

You could be one of the few people who make tonight the domino
that knocks over the following 20.

I’ve seen it happen live.

As I’ve told you the story about Philip (the kid who Venmo’d me a
dollar and got $1k back), a part I left out is this…

A few weeks after that happened, I told him to join a webinar one
of my clients was hosting.

It was on high ticket sales.

At the end, when my client pitched his offer, Phillip facetimed
me in a panic.

He couldn’t decide whether or not he wanted to do it.

I listened to him contemplate and gave him some words of
encouragement.

But ultimately, it was up to him.

He decided to pull the trigger.

And you know how the rest of that story (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h294vxluqhpek8933hrhm042p/3ohphkh3nwdgdzir/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vSlB3b3lR
) goes.

So if you’re not already registered, I’ll leave the link here one
more time for ya:

​Sign up here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h294vxluqhpek8933hrhm042p/9qhzhnhdl72r2za9/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
)​

Excited to see you tonight.

Ben

​

subject: I almost canceled the webinar
body:
I have a confession…

I almost canceled yesterday's webinar.

On Tuesday (the day before), I mentally constructed an excuse I’d
potentially send out on Wednesday.

I’d either say I had food poisoning, or “COVID” and reschedule
it.

Food poisoning is my go-to if I ever need to get out of a big
commitment.

You can’t really argue with it because it’s so horrible and
gross.

“Babe, why did you miss our wedding!”

“Sorry bitch I had food poisoning.”

“Oh, my bad honey, I hope you feel better.”

You see?

It’s truly undefeated.

Anyway, I obviously didn’t cancel it and I’m glad I didn’t.

I contemplated doing so because the day before, I was going
through it.

I think I slept on my neck wrong. It tensed up and I had a
tension headache all day.

Plus I was stressed because I’d been procrastinating my webinar
presentation.

Tuesday was supposed to be the day I’d finally get it done.

But looking at the computer screen hurt my eyes.

So instead of doing anything productive, I laid on the floor for
the majority of the day.

When webby day rolled around, I had 10% of my slides ready.

Plus I still had to set up all the automations, reminders, etc.

Fuck me.

But I powered through it.

I got up at 5am, put on David Goggins playlist and got everything
done by 9am.

Just kidding, lol.

I woke up around 8, and leisurely got ready.

Still I procrastinated the slides, and started with the backend
tasks that needed to be set up.

Around 1pm (6 hours before I went live) I opened my Google
Presentation.

The good news was I had 27 slides already completed.

The bad news was that I ended up with 284 slides.

But I started cooking.

I recently saw a video of Hunter Biden explaining what it’s like
to be on crack – and now I fully understand it.

Although I wasn’t on crack (to be clear), I was hearing colors
and seeing sounds.

The words for each slide came to me effortlessly.

By 6:30pm EST (30 minutes before) I’d finished 90%.

The pitch was the only thing I didn’t finish because I wanted to
quickly review the training.

So I said “fuck it” and just winged the pitch.

And today, I’m really glad I didn’t cancel it.

I had a great time, people seemed to love it, and hopefully we’ll
get many new Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqh64gq8zivhq2dg8rrfohrzeql/9qhzhnhd2kz3g7t9/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) members and change a lot of lives.

If you were there, thanks for coming.

If you weren’t, I’ll run it back at some point down the line
because I’m now addicted to crack.

Either way, you can get rich with me here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqh64gq8zivhq2dg8rrfohrzeql/9qhzhnhd2kz3g7t9/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Later,

Ben

P.S. If you registered and weren't able to attend, I have a
present for you.

A bunch of Europeans DM’d me and said they were busy smoking
cigarettes and bumping house music since it was 1am in Ibiza.

Look out for an email from me shortly titled “Since you flaked.”

​
​

​

​

​

​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqh64gq8zivhq2dg8rrfohrzeql
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqh64gq8zivhq2dg8rrfohrzeql
) | 2125 Biscayne Blvd, Ste 204, Miami, FL 33137

 If you were there, thanks for coming.

 If you weren’t, I’ll run it back at some point down the line because I’m now addicted to crack.

 Either way, you can get rich with me here. ​

 Later,

 Ben

 P.S. If you registered and weren't able to attend, I have a present for you.

 A bunch of Europeans DM’d me and said they were busy smoking cigarettes and bumping house music since it was 1am in Ibiza.

 Look out for an email from me shortly titled “Since you flaked.”

subject: I got punched in the face (again)
body:
In yesterday's email, we talked about procrastination.

I told you how I waited until the last minute to make slides for
Wednesday's webinar.

But what I didn’t tell you about were the three months of
procrastination before that.

In April, I decided I’d start running webinars.

I told myself I’ll get it set up “sometime in the near future.”

Those five words signify something that’ll never happen.

There’s some 63 year old out there still waiting to start his
SMMA after seeing a Tai Lopez ad ten years ago.

“Sometime in the near future,” he continues to say.

Whenever I catch myself continually delaying an action, I
eventually reach a breaking point.

I figuratively punch myself in the face for being an idiot.

And then I start moving.

Exactly two weeks ago today, I reached that point.

I was on my morning walk to get coffee and I opened a newsletter
email from a mentor of mine, Taylor Allan.

He wrote about “biting off more than you can chew” and forcing
yourself to figure it out.

You’ll quickly realize you’re capable of more than you thought.

And at the end of the email, he gave some examples.

One of which, was:

“Organize a launch before you’ve built the product — with a date,
a sales page, and people expecting delivery — and you will find a
way to build it in time.”

That clicked.

When I got home from the coffee shop, I picked the date for the
webinar.

Two days later I had the sign up page, backend set up, and promo
videos ready.

I started promoting it a week out.

And finally…

I forced myself to build the presentation (at the very last
minute).

So I guess this is my attempt to do for you, what Taylor’s email
did for me.

Here are a few ideas for you:

- Start doing outreach and book a sales call before you know how
to fulfill.

- Make a reservation for two at the nicest restaurant in your
city tonight and find a 10 to go with you.

- Buy a plane ticket and book a trip somewhere you’ve been
wanting to go.

- Apply for Artisan Lab, (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu8dq3lkes7hn57rm6h6h9mqg344cnh4p03v/m2h7h5h3ngwrqxam/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) and you’ll feel the pressure to 10x your investment :)

Hope this motivates you to get moving.

If not, there’s always next year.

Have a good weekend,

Ben

​

​

​

​

​
​

subject: (1) Ben messaged you
body:
{{ subscriber.first_name }}, what’s wrong? You barely touched your webinar discount + bonuses. ​

 It’s been three days now…

 This is usually the part where I start pulling on your heart strings.

 I’ve written so many emails like this for my clients that it’s second nature now.

 First I would reward you for taking the initial action (coming to the webinar).

 Then I would bridge to the problem…

 “95% of people will do nothing with the information I showed you the other night.” 

 And I’d dig that pain a bit so you feel it…

 Here’s a direct quote I write in all post webinar sequences for my clients:

 “Your life will become a perpetual cycle of "almost." 

 You'll almost start a business. 

 You'll almost approach the pretty girl. 

 You'll almost become the person you know you can be. 

 But you won't. 

 You'll be stuck watching videos about how to make money, how to improve your relationships, and how to stop your lingering anxiety... 

 Because knowledge means NOTHING without the appropriate action.” 

 Did that make you feel any pressure?

 If so, go here and apply to join me inside Artisan Lab. ​

 If not, keep reading.

 You’re a skeptic.

 Maybe you want to try it on your own.

 Maybe you still don’t believe me – despite the fact that I showed you countless examples of people running it the fuck up.

 Or maybe you’re just funnel hacking and stealing my copy.

 Either way, I’ll skip the emotional build up and just give you the facts:

 9 members of Artisan Lab have hit $100k months.

 Over two dozen have reached $20k/mo+.

 The online education industry is growing at over 10% per year and it’s projected to reach $280B by 2029.

 You can sit on the sideline and complain.

 Or you can get in the game and capitalize.

 That’s a choice only you can make.

 So if you want my help…

 Plus a $1k discount, a free 1-1 with me, and guest lessons from some of the biggest names in the info-product space…

 ​ Go here now. ​

 Talk soon,

 Ben

 P.S. If you're like me and you hate calls -- or you have questions you want answered before booking, just reply to this email and lmk.

 I'll personally hit you back (as long as you don't ask me for a 90% discount).
​

 ​

subject: (Tutorial) How to buy a Ferrari 488 Pista
body:
Good morning.

Yesterday I decided I want a Ferrari 488 Pista.

I’d been trying to convince myself to want a McLaren 720s, but
they just look plasticy to me.

The only problem is, Pistas are around $600k.

That’s about double what I’d be comfortable spending right now.

So… I have to make more money.

After this material awakening, I began thinking about how to do
that.

There are three ways to grow any high ticket service or coaching
business:

1. Increase traffic

2. Increase conversions

3. Increase LTV

At first, traffic is the most important – without it, you don’t
have a business.

But conversions and LTV start to matter more once traffic is
flowing.

I recently helped a client launch from scratch.

He started posting short form content a few months ago and
quickly gained traction.

We threw together a lead magnet, captured emails and nurtured
them through the list.

About 60 days ago, we started selling.

Prospects go through a short VSL, fill out an application, and
book with our sales team.

We’re making some money, but our conversion rate sucks.

The leads are low intent, low trust, and just don’t seem to care
enough about what we’re selling.

This is a good problem to have because it’s fairly easy to solve.

Maybe the way we position the offer isn’t resonating.

Maybe we’re selling to the wrong type of people.

Maybe we simply need to bombard prospects with way more proof.

Fixing this is just a matter of tests and tweaks. Here’s a few
I’m exploring:

– Adjusting the pitch

– Adding more proof to the funnel

– Increasing touch points pre-call

– Swapping to a webinar

– Revising our DM setting flow

My job as a marketer/operator is to fuck with all of the above
until numbers improve.

Once they do, we can allocate more attention and focus to the
other two buckets.

To get more traffic, run ads and/or make more content.

To increase LTV, sell more expensive shit.

It’s quite simple.

If you see me post in a 488 Pista in the next few months, you’ll
know I found the solution.

If you don’t, I’m getting there.

​Go here (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlkm687s8h8d3e022clh26gvn/8ghqhoho5pl9lzck/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) if you want my help in building and/or scaling your info
agency.

Talk tomorrow,

Ben

​

​

​

​

​
​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlkm687s8h8d3e022clh26gvn
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlkm687s8h8d3e022clh26gvn
) | 2125 Biscayne Blvd, Ste 204, Miami, FL 33137

subject: I stole this $100M man's business...
body:
Everyone is a liar.

I was browsing through YouTube yesterday and saw three different
videos all titled a variation of:

“How I made $X Million selling digital products.”

Interesting…

I could’ve sworn you’d been saying you got rich from dropshipping
for the past three years!

But who am I to judge?

This shift actually benefits me and my Artisan Lab members
immensely.

Let’s think about the domino effect this is creating…

Domino #1:

Big personal brands like Alex Hormozi, Iman Gadzhi, and William
Brown make content about building a coaching business.

Domino #2:

More people want to build coaching businesses.

Domino #3:

Everyone copies the industry leaders, now everyone and their
mother is a coach.

And finally…

Domino #4:

There are too many coaches and not enough operators.

Backend services are needed more than ever and there are plenty
of good clients to go around.

I guess Domino #5 is Ferrari having to make more cars because me
and everyone else who capitalizes on this buys up the inventory.

(Legally I cannot promise you a Ferrari or even a Civic for that
matter).

But to be clear – we're already on Domino #4.

And it’s only gonna get better.

What do you think all of the successful coaches will do if/when
their current offer dries up?

“Here’s how I made $10m selling digital products over the past
two years!”

The cycle continues.

It’s like being an NBA agent.

As the league grows and players get paid more, so do agents.

Rich Paul (Lebron's agent and founder of Klutch) is worth over
$100m.

He doesn’t need to drop 30 every night, he just helps the guys
that do.

They have the spotlight, the attention, and the leverage…

He builds the infrastructure behind the scenes – negotiates the
deals, monetizes the attention, and takes a cut.

Sounds familiar.

This is how you win without needing to be the face.

Unless you’re 6’9, 250lbs with a 40 inch vertical…

​Domino #5 (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/0vukr0nl6oh9h9mvqolclhvmerk55fnhxm59l/58hvh7hg9zk3r6t6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) is waiting for you,

Ben

​

​

​

​

​
​

subject: How to break out of slump (Certified Hood Classic)
body:
Today's email is a CHC (Certified Hood Classic) I originally sent
in March earlier this year.

It was a subscriber favorite -- So if you're in a bit of a slump
right now, it might be the catalyst that gets you out of it.

Enjoy:

​

A fly was just buzzing around my laptop.

I swung twice and missed both times.

This is a rare occurrence.

If there's a worldwide fly swatting accuracy leaderboard
anywhere, I’d be near the top.

It’s a sunny morning in Miami, although it rained all day
yesterday so the ground is still wet.

I have an iced espresso next to me and I’m ready to work.

The past couple weeks have been a bit unfocused.

I got out of my normal routine from traveling and am now getting
back into the swing of things.

You know that feeling when you want to be productive but you’re
being a lazy, unmotivated piece of shit?

Me too.

Slumps like this are inevitable and they happen to everyone.

Even the greatest athletes on the planet go through periods where
they can’t make a shot or get on base.

Let’s consider how they get through this…

A struggling athlete has to become aware of components that are
typically subconscious.

Perhaps they started rushing their follow-through or rotating too
much on their swing.

To correct themselves, they have to be more intentional and
disciplined than usual.

If they can typically get away with lacing up their shoes right
before practice, that’s not gonna fly for now.

They have to put more time in, identify the error they’re making
and consciously decide to fix it.

Eventually things go back to normal and it becomes subconscious
or easy again.

Productivity works the same way.

When you’re in a slump, the bitch voice in your head is the
loudest.

To shut it out, you’ll likely have to be more disciplined than
usual.

Get up earlier.

Stop yourself from scrolling on social media.

Write down a detailed schedule to follow each day.

Put your phone on DND and stick to the plan.

Next thing you know, you’ll knock off the rust and feel good
about working again.

This doesn’t take long unless you let it.

A member of Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/0vukr0nl6oh9h9megk0hlhvmerk55fnhxm59l/dpheh0he77dn7dcm/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) recently came to me with this exact problem and I told him the
following:

“Momentum and habits outweigh motivation. Small wins will create
bigger ones. You're one productive morning away from a productive
day, and one productive day away from a productive week. Just
have to get the ball rolling with the small things.”

Soon enough you’ll get back in rhythm.

The ball will hit your hands and you’ll effortlessly rise up and
let it fly.

Slump over, Lambo coming soon. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/0vukr0nl6oh9h9megk0hlhvmerk55fnhxm59l/dpheh0he77dn7dcm/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​

​

​

​

subject: Zero value in here
body:
Good morning b.

As I write this, I’m simultaneously watching 22 sales call
recordings at once.

Well, an AI agent is doing that for me.

He just gave me a comprehensive report.

It took about 5 minutes.

The agent began by going through the funnel.

It read the copy on the VSL page and went through my qualifying
questions.

Then it analyzed the transcripts from all 22 recordings.

Every lead is categorized by the outcome of the call and common
objections are listed clearly.

Here’s the conclusion it gave me:

“Your low close rate is primarily due to lead quality issues, not
sales performance. The current VSL messaging attracts unqualified
prospects who cannot afford your service. By implementing better
qualification processes and targeting higher-quality leads, you
should see immediate improvements in close rates and revenue.”

Thank you Agent 0, you just saved me 22 hours of my life and gave
me this cool graph:

​
You might be thinking “Wow Ben, this is incredible. You’re a
wizard with AI!”

Not really.

I just found a tool that made the above process incredibly
simple.

“Oh, what’s the tool called??” you say, with drool coming from
your mouth.

It’s called [redacted].

Hahahaha.

You haven’t paid me a dollar and you think I’d just tell you?

“But Ben, you should give free value to your audience!”

Fuck off.

I found this tool because it was mentioned by someone in a
mastermind I’m in.

It costs $24,000/year.

I’m gonna normalize gatekeeping.

Hormozi convinced everyone to “give it all away for free.”

That’s a lie.

Do you really think that roided man is telling you everything he
knows about business?

All of the (likely) grey-black hat tactics that he’s actually
using?

No.

He gives you a sliver.

You only get the real sauce when you pay.

And even if someone gives you good info for free, it’s worth less
because you don’t value it.

I know this is convenient for me to say…

But if you have some money and you’re not spending it to buy
information and access…

You’re retarded.

Stop being retarded and buy this now you monkey. (

Bye,

Ben

subject: I need to apologize
body:
In yesterday's email I insulted you.

Today, I want to apologize.

I shouldn’t have said “stop being retarded and buy this now you
monkey.”

Instead, I should’ve called you a buffoon.

Because only a buffoon wouldn’t spend money to expedite their
journey.

And yesterday, I realized I’ve been doing just that.

For the last month, my upper back’s been constantly tight.

Most days it’s manageable until I move wrong or piss it off.

Then it spazzes.

If you’ve had back spasms, you know how much this sucks.

Imagine Lizzo sitting on your back.

Then multiply her by four and give her a knife.

Shit hurts.

I went to a physical therapist a month ago.

He gave me a bunch of stretches and exercises to do.

I’ve done them maybe twice.

I figured I’d just take a break from physical activity, get a
massage, and my back would fix itself.

That’s where I went wrong.

Real problems don’t fix themselves.

You’re not gonna wake up one day and magically be healed from
poverty.

You have to actively pursue the solution.

When I realized my hypocrisy around back pain, I got fed up with
myself and started acting.

I booked another session with the PT.

Then I went on Amazon and ordered the most expensive massage
table I could find.

I’d been telling myself that I didn’t have space to do the
exercises.

So I’m gonna remove that scapegoat and put the table next to my
bed.

Here’s the deeper lesson:

I’m creating a catalyst for change.

I didn’t need a $500 massage table.

I don’t need to spend $300 to have the PT come to my house when
there’s one across the street for $50.

But I know myself.

And I know I won’t do shit unless I…

1. Spend a little bit of money

2. Am constantly reminded (the table is a visual cue)

3. Make it convenient and enjoyable

Getting rich works the same way.

In college I’d write goals and affirmations on sticky notes and
place them around my room.

Every time I walked into my bathroom I’d see “you are who you
think you are.”

Every time I sat at my desk I’d see “Ben made $10,000 this
month.”

I spent almost all the money I had on a coaching program.

I created a ritual where I’d light a candle, put on music, and
make myself this yogurt bowl when I sat down to work at night.

I forced myself to do it. And I made it as enjoyable as possible.

I’m writing to you from a penthouse in Miami because of this.

I have liquid 7 figures because of this.

The car I’ve wanted since I was 10 years old is in the garage
because of this.

I’m not bragging.

But I’m imploring you that success is no accident.

Wake up.

Your problems will never fix themselves.

You’re too comfortable at your current standards.

You tell yourself you want to change but you do nothing about it.

When are you gonna put your foot down and act, (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0hoqgegzfmhzn26244ilhndgov/3ohphkh3d7pr67br/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) you buffoon!

Don’t wait until it’s too late.

Love you,

Ben

​
​
​

​

​

​

subject: The most terrifying thing I've ever done...
body:
It’s only scary the first time you do it.

That applies to most things in life.

The first time you jumped off a diving board, it was
nerve-wrecking.

The first time you got in the driver's seat of a car, you were
terrified.

The first girl that let you… never mind.

You get the point.

The other day I spent $15k to renew a mastermind I’m in.

I paid the invoice as if I were paying for a coffee and forgot
about it 5 minutes after.

There were absolutely zero nerves involved.

But if I rewind a few years, I vividly remember the fear I had
when making an investment in myself.

I was on a sales call for this SMMA coaching program.

The closer’s name was Kyle.

Going into it, I was prepared to spend about $2k.

Everything sounded good, we got to the pitch and he said the
price…

“Five thousand dollars.”

Fuck me.

I could instantly feel the internal pressure.

I began physically squirming in the gaming chair at my desk in my
college dorm room.

After a long pause and some incoherent sounds of nervousness
coming from my mouth, I said…

“Uhhhh… I know you probably get this objection all the time but
uhhh…

Can I like take a day or two and think about it?”

Kyle smiled knowing he was about to aikido the fuck out of my
stupid little objection.

He replied by asking me what I liked about the offer.

I began selling myself.

“Well this sounds really good because of the support and I need
to learn this…” blah blah.

Once I finished, he gave me a basketball analogy because I’d told
him earlier that I grew up a hooper.

I was cooked.

The analogy ended with him asking me “debit or credit?”

I pulled out my card and spent $5,000.

The next few days were a mix of “this is awesome, I’m finally
taking action to change my life,” and “what did I just do, I’m an
idiot.”

I wish I could tell you it was smooth sailing to $10k/mo after
that…

But I got distracted (again), started chasing another business
model, and wasted a month.

Eventually I locked in and hit $10k/month six months later.

After 4 years and six figures invested in coaching, now I’m here.

This is such a perfect time for me to segue into why you should
invest in Artisan Lab. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/68u8vxpw9qs8h5pmdm7sohpl020kkh9h79pno/48hvhehm2gvo8xhx/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

But I’m gonna ruin it.

If you’re scared, don’t do it.

Listen to that fear.

Let it control your life.

Don’t approach the pretty girl.

Don’t post content on social media.

Don’t send outreach messages.

Live a life of quiet misery because you don’t have the balls to
bet on yourself.

Or do the opposite (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/68u8vxpw9qs8h5pmdm7sohpl020kkh9h79pno/48hvhehm2gvo8xhx/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) and see where it takes you. It’s all up to you.

Happy Monday,

Ben

​

​

​

​

​
​

) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/68u8vxpw9qs8h5pmdm7sohpl020kkh9h79pno
) | 2125 Biscayne Blvd, Ste 204, Miami, FL 33137

subject: The DNA of a winner
body:
Most people are losers.

I’m not trying to be mean…well, maybe I am.

But this is a simple fact.

They don’t know how roundabouts work.

They stand in the middle of crowded doorways.

And they don’t have TSA pre-check. (That one is a bit of a
stretch, but seriously if you live in the US and travel at all,
why the fuck would you not have pre-check?)

If you’re reading this, I’m gonna assume you’re not a loser.

You likely wouldn’t enjoy my emails if you were.

I once let a loser into Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92ung4ow87hnh6g53dpb9hzpdrd33iwh9e0z6/p8heh9h47800g5bq/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) by accident, as you may remember.

He immediately sensed he was out of his jurisdiction and ejected
himself back to Normieville.

The simple, winner DNA that he didn’t have is this:

Winners just do things.

They hear that same voice that the losers have.

It says…

“I don’t know where to start!”

“How will I get a client if I don’t have any case studies?”

“Maybe I’m gay in over my head.”

They choose to not listen to these thoughts.

They use their best judgment to move in somewhat of a positive
direction.

And they allow the Universe to naturally redirect them if there’s
a better route.

That’s it.

“The real utility of thinking is knowing what thoughts you
shouldn’t listen to.” - Brute

Stop talking yourself out of it.

Contemplation isn’t progress.

You don’t need to “think about it” or talk to your wife (cuck).

You need to decide, commit, and act.

Only then will you escape Normieville.

Just like these winners have...

Elijah just hit his second consecutive $20k month (he made $2k
the month before he joined AL 6 months ago):

​
James helped a client make $121k... In an hour and a half. I
actually gave him this client a few months ago and now he'll make
5 figures from his rev share:

​
Oh shit. I almost forgot about Yahya. He made his client the
equivalent of a 2024 Porsche GT3RS... in a few days. He will make
more money from his rev share than the average American does in
one year:

​
Sorry, I didn't mean to start bragging so much here but I forgot
how hard the people of Artisan Lab are winning.

I can't promise you results like the people above.

But I can promise you that if you do nothing, you will stay where
you are now.

And if you don't like where you are now, I'd advise against doing
nothing.

So maybe... do something. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92ung4ow87hnh6g53dpb9hzpdrd33iwh9e0z6/p8heh9h47800g5bq/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi

subject: The DNA of a winner
body:
Most people are losers.

 I’m not trying to be mean…well, maybe I am.

 But this is a simple fact.

 They don’t know how roundabouts work.

 They stand in the middle of crowded doorways.

 And they don’t have TSA pre-check. (That one is a bit of a stretch, but seriously if you live in the US and travel at all, why the fuck would you not have pre-check?) 

 If you’re reading this, I’m gonna assume you’re not a loser.

 You likely wouldn’t enjoy my emails if you were.

 I once let a loser into Artisan Lab by accident, as you may remember.

 He immediately sensed he was out of his jurisdiction and ejected himself back to Normieville.

 The simple, winner DNA that he didn’t have is this:

 Winners just do things.

 They hear that same voice that the losers have.

 It says…

 “I don’t know where to start!”

 “How will I get a client if I don’t have any case studies?”

 “Maybe I’m gay in over my head.”

 They choose to not listen to these thoughts.

 They use their best judgment to move in somewhat of a positive direction.

 And they allow the Universe to naturally redirect them if there’s a better route.

 That’s it.

 “The real utility of thinking is knowing what thoughts you shouldn’t listen to.” - Brute

 Stop talking yourself out of it.

 Contemplation isn’t progress.

 You don’t need to “think about it” or talk to your wife (cuck).

 You need to decide, commit, and act.

 Only then will you escape Normieville.

 Just like these winners have...

 Elijah just hit his second consecutive $20k month (he made $2k the month before he joined AL 6 months ago):

 ​ James helped a client make $121k... In an hour and a half. I actually gave him this client a few months ago and now he'll make 5 figures from his rev share:

 ​ Oh shit. I almost forgot about Yahya. He made his client the equivalent of a 2024 Porsche GT3RS... in a few days. He will make more money from his rev share than the average American does in one year:

 ​ Sorry, I didn't mean to start bragging so much here but I forgot how hard the people of Artisan Lab are winning.

 I can't promise you results like the people above.

 But I can promise you that if you do nothing, you will stay where you are now.

 And if you don't like where you are now, I'd advise against doing nothing.

 So maybe... do something. ​

 The winning team is waiting,

 Ben

 ​

 ​

 ​

subject: I got a 9-5 j*b
body:
I’m in a hurry.

I woke up to the alarm sound “chimes” blaring next to me.

I closed my eyes for an extra 15 seconds before rolling out of
bed.

I’d regret that 15 second nap later, but I didn’t know that yet.

I showered, threw on my only non-wrinkled button down, and hopped
on my scooter.

It was 8:47am.

That meant I had 13 minutes to get to the office.

Which meant if I was late again, I probably wouldn’t get the
promotion I’d been hoping for.

I weaved through traffic on my scooter.

Some kid in a Porsche yelled “wagie cuck” out the window at me.

Asshole.

I looked down to check my Apple watch.

At this pace, I’d get to the office at 8:58am.

But as I approached the bridge to get downtown, I heard the sound
of horror.

There was a bell.

This bell indicated the bridge was about to go up.

If I didn’t get there in time, I’d surely be late.

I went as fast as my scooter could go.

My water bottle fell from the side pocket of my backpack and I
didn’t even try to stop to pick it up.

But five seconds before I got to the gate, it closed.

Shit.

If only I didn’t waste 15 seconds before getting up earlier.

Alright, back to reality – luckily that was a fictitious story.

It’s what I imagine an average morning in my life would look like
had I stayed on the path.

And to me, that sounds like a horror film.

I hate scooters.

I hate the alarm clock sound “chimes.”

I hate Apple watches.

And most of all, I hate rushing.

That’s hypocritical of me because I still feel like I’m always
rushing but at least now it’s on my own clock.

The life above is exactly what I wanted to avoid.

I successfully did so, and can tell you with full certainty…

Even though it isn’t a perfect utopia, absent of problems – it’s
way better than having to say “sorry I’m late boss.”

(Plus you get to be the asshole in a Porsche calling someone else
a wagie cuck.)

It’s cooler on this side.

​Join me here (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8uvdq4g0psqh64062davhq4wowrriohrzeql/l2hehmhlkqxen3c6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)– or remember to iron a new button down for tomorrow.

See ya after work,

Ben

​
​

​

​

​

​

subject: b <> Baker Mayfield
body:
Today we’re talking about Baker Mayfield.

If you know nothing about American football, you probably think
that’s a shitty restaurant chain you’d find in a fly over state.

Let me catch you up:

Baker Mayfield is an NFL quarterback.

He was drafted first overall to the Cleveland Browns in 2018.

In his third year with the team, he led them to their first
playoff win in nearly 20 years.

But the following season was a disappointment.

He played through an injury, the team fell apart, and they missed
the playoffs.

Then, Cleveland decided to make a bold move.

They traded a total of six draft picks (including three first
rounders) for… get this…

A man with 24 counts of sexual assault against him.

That man also plays quarterback, meaning they’d given up on
Baker.

Plus they gave Epstein Jr. the largest – fully guaranteed –
contract in NFL history…

5 years, $230 million.

Baker requested a trade and they sent him to another
dysfunctional franchise, Carolina.

He spent a year there, got benched and eventually cut from the
team.

After a brief stint as a backup for the Rams, it looked like he
might be out of the league soon.

And then…

He found a better opportunity.

He signed with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, led them to the
playoffs, and was awarded Most Improved Player.

Statistically speaking, he was the 4th best QB in the league last
year.

“Ben, why have you written 250 words glazing Baker Mayfield?”

Great question, b.

Similar to business, Baker just needed the right “vehicle”.

Despite having the talent and being an incredibly hard worker, he
bounced from one shitty situation to the next…

Until he found the right home for him.

Similarly, I was once overworked, overqualified and underpaid.

I was grinding away at my SMMA and just couldn’t scale.

Then one day I figured… What if I just apply my skill set in a
way that’ll give me more leverage?

So I made the pivot to partnering with info-product sellers.

Four months later, I hit my first $50k month.

Six months after that, I hit $100k/mo with just seven clients.

Turns out, I wasn’t the problem. My business model was.

The Info Agency model became my loving home.

More leverage, fewer clients, and rev shares.

Plus no risk of getting replaced by a freak named Deshuan.

)​

Ben

journey.

Yahya was running a retention agency, making $2-5k/mo when he

subject: Spilled coffee on my laptop
body:
They changed the lids at the coffee shop today.

I like the new ones better.

Until now, there was a small hole for the straw with no cover.

They’d put a tiny piece of tape over it so it wouldn’t spill.

That tape sucked.

I’d always try to peel it off with my fingers and could never get
it.

So I’d end up taking the whole lid off just to push it off from
the inside.

Then one day they gave me an extra coffee.

I gave it to my friend Mason, who’s apparently a seasoned veteran
in coffee lids.

The tape was off in two seconds.

He pushed down the front part of the plastic to create separation
and easily took it off.

Watching him do that changed my life.

I stole his strategy and have been using it since.

I’d been fighting with the lid for months.

Not because there wasn’t a better way, but because I never
stopped to ask if my way was stupid.

Turns out it was.

What a beautiful reminder to continually audit your beliefs.

Just because something kinda works doesn’t mean it’s the best
way.

And the longer you keep using a bad method, the more it screws
you over.

So take a second and ask yourself…

Is your strategy actually good, or are you only doing it because
it’s not horrible?

Does your business really have a ceiling, or is that a story
you’ve been telling yourself?

Are you working on the right things, or should you reassess what
actions result in the highest ROI?

Even if you don’t change anything, asking questions is better
than living on autopilot.

Luckily I won’t have to deal with that stupid lid anymore.

They upgraded to the ones that have the foldable plastic flap you
can just push backwards.

Anyway, here’s a recent video of mine (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlkzd79h8h86oko22blh26gvn/n2hohvhvoq4lmvt6/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vYWpWYnhS
) that you might need to hear today.

Have a good weekend,

Ben

​

​

​

​
​
​

subject: I'm getting married <3
body:
No one is happy and everyone’s getting divorced.

I know that’s an uplifting thing to hear on this beautiful Monday
morning.

But when you look at the numbers, it’s true.

The divorce rate in the US has climbed from around 25% in the
1960s to almost 50% today.

Compare that to arranged marriages where only about 4% end in
divorce.

Now I’m not saying we should bring back arranged marriages.

(I’d jump off a bridge if one day my parents brought me some
chopped shit and said I gotta put a ring on it.)

Obviously not all of these marriages are actually happy and
there’s added cultural pressure to stay together.

But statistically, forcing two people together beats giving them
a choice.

So today, I’m arranging your marriage.

I’ve been watching you and to put it simply, you’re being a
whore.

You’ve jumped from one thing to the next – SMMA, sales, AI agency
and so on.

Every time you're about to fully commit, a new bad bitch seduces
you.

She whispers, “this is the best way to make money in 2025, baby.”

That’s your weakness.

You need to slap her (**HYPOTHETICALLY**).

Then say, “No, you harlot! I’m committed to {insert business
model} and you’re not corrupt my virgin eyes.

It doesn't matter what business model you insert there, but
you’ve gotta commit to her.

Otherwise you’ll end up contributing to a different statistic…

85% of people in the US make less than $100k per year.

If you want to avoid that – I just made this video (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/r8u0o3z624hoh309lnec2hden4n66h7hwpom6/e0hph7h7n3oq7ka8/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vSWtBQndK
) about why most people never actually commit.

And if you want my guidance…

By the power vested in me, I now pronounce you, b, and me,
Artisan Lab, (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/r8u0o3z624hoh309lnec2hden4n66h7hwpom6/7qh7h8h9425w9obz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) husband and wife.

You may kiss the…

Never mind.

Let’s make some money this week,

Ben

subject: From 0 to $75k/mo in 2 months
body:
A few years ago, I was incredibly ill.

I couldn’t focus.

My mind was constantly chaotic.

And I was poor.

I had a common illness.

You’ve probably suffered from it as well. You might even have it
right now.

It’s called…

Shiny object syndrome.

I regularly talk about avoiding this.

Yesterday I told you that you need to get an arranged marriage in
order to do so.

But there are some instances where a pivot isn’t all bad.

Sometimes the wrong model is holding you back.

​A member of Artisan Lab just proved this (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/k0udqe8rwzs6h5ldrq0blhokrdr77s8hgk6z5/3ohphkh3deggomfr/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vZ1Jka2dy
) – he ditched his old agency, made $0 for a bit, then pulled
$75k from one client in one month.

About a year and half into my journey, I did the same.

I’d gotten to around $15k/mo with my SMMA.

I had 15+ clients.

It was the success I wanted.

But it fucking sucked.

I’d been stuck in the $10k-$15k/mo range for a while.

My clients would constantly churn, so most of my days were spent
doing outreach to replace them.

I didn’t enjoy running the business.

Plus my idiot friends were making more money with less effort…

Because they were in better vehicles.

The money and lifestyle I was looking for would be found in
scaling info-products.

I knew that.

But there was still this inkling of doubt.

Am I getting shiny object syndrome again or is the vehicle
actually the bottleneck?

My SMMA was my baby.

It took me out the trenches (my air conditioned college apartment
that my parents paid for).

It made me my first $100k.

And now I’m just gonna leave it on the side of the road?

Yes, I will.

I pivoted to info and made my first million.

Well, if only it were that simple…

I contemplated the decision for months and stayed stuck.

Then finally, I got a few info clients, realized it was way
better, and dropped my local business clients.

And looking back it’s clear that the vehicle was the problem.

But at the time, that was hard to discern.

Yahya just went through a similar transition.

Just two months in, he made the equivalent of a souped-up
Hellcat…from one client.

​Here’s a full interview (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/k0udqe8rwzs6h5ldrq0blhokrdr77s8hgk6z5/3ohphkh3deggomfr/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vZ1Jka2dy
) – plus how he made his client $622k in 3 days.

See you over there,

Ben

​

​

​

​

​
​

 The money and lifestyle I was looking for would be found in scaling info-products.

 I knew that.

 But there was still this inkling of doubt.

 Am I getting shiny object syndrome again or is the vehicle actually the bottleneck?

 My SMMA was my baby.

 It took me out the trenches (my air conditioned college apartment that my parents paid for).

 It made me my first $100k.

 And now I’m just gonna leave it on the side of the road?

 Yes, I will.

 I pivoted to info and made my first million.

 Well, if only it were that simple…

 I contemplated the decision for months and stayed stuck.

 Then finally, I got a few info clients, realized it was way better, and dropped my local business clients.

 And looking back it’s clear that the vehicle was the problem.

 But at the time, that was hard to discern.

 Yahya just went through a similar transition.

 Just two months in, he made the equivalent of a souped-up Hellcat…from one client.

 ​ Here’s a full interview – plus how he made his client $622k in 3 days.

 See you over there,

 Ben

 ​

 ​

 ​

 ​

 ​

subject: Artisan Lab member is dating Margot Robbie
body:
I’m gonna be rude today.

The average person will be quite offended by the following few
hundred words.

Hopefully you’re not the average person.

If you are, I’d recommend leaving now.

Alright?

Alright.

Now that the normies are gone and it’s just you and me…

You’re not an idiot, are you?

Like, you’re not gonna get a… j*b, right?

A job…

In 2025.

When AI is about to disrupt the landscape of humanity.

When unemployment is at an all time high.

When inflation has the US dollar rapidly losing its value…

You think the safe and noble thing to do… is get a job?

I sound like 2022 Andrew Tate, but seriously:

If you were lucky enough to be born in a first world country…

You have the ability to communicate.

You have running water and wifi.

You can click buttons on your phone or laptop to make a livable
wage from the comfort of your own home…

And you decide, “ehh nah that online money shit sounds like a
scam, I’d rather clock in.”

That’s supposed to be the safe route?

To me, putting the weight of your life in the hands of others is
an irresponsible decision.

Yesterday, I had a 1-1 with an Artisan Lab member who recently
graduated college.

Right now, he’s in the “trenches.”

He moved back home with his parents and just lost a $5k/mo
retainer client.

That was about 70% of his income.

“I’m at rock bottom,” he said.

I smiled and congratulated him.

Rock bottom meant free food, laundry service, and no rent.

Plus all the time in the world to rebuild.

I told him if he commits now, the next 3–6 months will be the
most transformative of his life.

He’ll hit five figure months and move out of his parents crib.

Then continue to scale and start living the life he’s probably
imagining right now.

Traveling, buying his dream car, dating Margot Robbie, etc.

Ok, maybe not the last one.

But the worst case scenario?

He’s already seen it.

Stay at his parents place until he finds a decent job – which he
actually was already offered from another client.

He’d take the job…

And live the life he would’ve lived anyway, had he never tried to
take his own route.

Do you see the picture I’m painting here?

You either win and get everything you’ve dreamt of.

Or you return to how your life was before.

subject: How to get your first $10k/month client ASAP
body:
A $9,900 payment changed how I looked at business forever…

It’s May 1st, 2022.

I’m supposed to move to Miami in a couple months.

But I have a problem.

I made $5,168 in April.

That could barely buy me a coffee in Miami – and definitely not a
table at LIV.

What’s even worse is that I thought I was starting to turn the
corner with my SMMA.

I made $17k the month before.

Then a bunch of my clients left and I didn't do enough outreach
to replace them.

So here I am, coffee-less, needing to figure something out.

I’m gonna go all in on info.

I begin dropping my remaining SMMA clients and only pitching
online coaches

And guess what?

That shit worked!

In July (four months later) I made $16,290 with just five
clients.

Just two months after that, I moved to Miami and hit $25k/mo with
only seven clients.

But I hadn’t even discovered the coolest part yet…

December 1st, 2022 I got this payment:

​
$9,900. From one rev share.

That client also paid me a $3k monthly retainer so I made $12,900
from him alone.

It was bittersweet.

I was happy I’d finally found the method…

But I was also mad at myself for being an absolute idiot for the
previous year.

Why was I only charging small monthly retainers?

And why was I working with local businesses?

Hindsight’s 20/20 I guess.

That was my “AHA!” moment.

Nine months later I hit $100k/mo and walked into Champion Porsche
to buy my dream car.

One client – and one rev share – changed my life.

Here’s my effort to help you do the same:

This Wednesday, (August 20th) at 7pm EST I’m going live.

I’ll give you everything you need to sign your first $10k/mo
client in the next 90 days. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h2zdgd8uqhpv02033hrhm042p/p8heh9h47pndkgtq/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
)​

Once you do that, everything gets easier.

You can continue to scale.

Clients start coming to you.

And you finally feel confident, knowing you’re in control.

I’ve watched five(!) new Artisan Lab members hit their first
$10k-$75k months from single clients over the past 30 days alone.

​So sign up here (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/p9urk7dqlxh9h2zdgd8uqhpv02033hrhm042p/p8heh9h47pndkgtq/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vcmVnaXN0ZXI=
) and you’ll get the same blueprint they used.

Ben

P.S. I just recorded two new interviews that you should check out
after you register:

​James went from 0-$14k/mo in 4 months (one client). (

)​

​Cetin hit $20k/mo in 3 months (also one client). (

P.P.S. If you came to the last webinar and you’re wondering if

The main topic will be acquisition – landing that first big

Obviously some parts of the training will be similar, but I’ll be
