subject: From zero to $10k/mo in 67 days
body:
“You can easily go from zero to $10k/mo in 90 days!”

Bullshit.

For a complete beginner, there’s about a 90% chance it takes you
6+ months –- no matter what business model you choose.

The 0-$10k/mo phase isn’t about finding the “right vehicle.”

It’s about upgrading from neanderthal to modern human.

Before $10k/mo you’re effectively a toddler.

To become a grown adult, you need new habits, new skills, and new
thoughts.

That’s a lot of change to cram into 90 days.

Sorry to burst your bubble.

However, there are some outliers.

Every now and then, someone will come into Artisan Lab and just
“get it” right away.

The best way I can describe their mentality is this:

They accept the fact that they feel like they’re in over their
head but they refuse to let that stop them from taking action.

Obviously when you start something new there’s a lot you don’t
know.

Instead of trying to learn everything at once, get a baseline
understanding as fast as possible…

Then jump in the deep end.

When you do that, you might just stumble your way into money a
lot quicker than you thought.

Just like Shaeis did:

​
He joined Artisan Lab exactly 67(!) days ago. Yes, six seven.

Since then, he hit his first $10k month.

He had zero previous experience.

I wish I could take full credit for his success but I can’t.

Sure I gave him a roadmap…

5 weekly coaching calls.

Countless hours of course content.

1-1 support, a community full of winners, and everything he could
possibly need to hit $10k/mo as fast as possible.

But he was the one who executed.

I can’t take credit for that.

The 90-day $10k promise is highly unlikely.

But Shaeis proved it can happen.

He didn’t wait until he felt ready.

He got in the game, took consistent action, and figured it out.

That’s the difference.

If you want a shot at being one of those rare outliers, you can
join us here. (
https://click.kit-mail1.com/gku0o3gldmh5hlm8v6nhrh8dmk999imh7qno0/g3hnh5hm3vp2o3tr/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Talk soon,

Ben

​
​

​
​
​

​

subject: The single trait that makes money inevitable
body:
I have a friend who’s a little autistic.

I don’t mean this in a negative or derogatory way.

But it’s this “rainman-like” advantage that’s made him rich.

Yesterday, we were sitting at lunch.

He had his back to the street as a car with a loud exhaust went
by.

Without turning or seeing the car, he said “SVJ.”

It was indeed a Lamborghini SVJ.

Two minutes later, he blurted out “Porsche 911 Turbo” as one went
by – again without turning around.

He can do this for hours.

It’s like when Steph Curry shoots and turns around as the ball
goes through the net.

Pure conviction.

Not coincidentally, he’s made a lot of money with a car rental
business.

The same thing goes for crypto.

He’ll go on 20 minute spiels about some random niche crypto shit
that I don’t understand.

But he knows it like the back of his hand.

Also not coincidentally, he’s made a lot of money in crypto.

“Every time I follow my curiosity, I end up stumbling upon an
opportunity.” – I just made this up but it sounds like something
Warren Buffet would say.

That line pretty much sums him up.

He goes deep into whatever fascinates him and the money is almost
a side effect.

Nearly every successful person I’ve ever met is incredibly
curious.

That’s the cheat code.

When you’re obsessed, you naturally put in the hours, notice the
details, and see opportunities that others don’t.

Over the past six months, I’ve watched an Artisan Lab member go
down this journey of obsession.

His name is Khesraw.

He lives in Afghanistan – not exactly the place you’d imagine you
can build a business online.

But his curiosity for copywriting and funnels pulled him down the
rabbit hole.

Last month he made $27k in profit from just one client. (
https://click.kit-mail1.com/5qu8dq3lkes7hng4nplh6h9kq8344anh4p03v/7qh7h8h99kdln6cz/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vbHdBTnBv
)​

The client is in the fitness niche, one of the hardest industries
to scale.

Yet since joining Artisan Lab, he’s applied what he’s learned to
push their business past $200k/month… and he gets paid on a rev

subject: The single trait that makes money inevitable
body:
I have a friend who’s a little autistic.

 I don’t mean this in a negative or derogatory way.

 But it’s this “rainman-like” advantage that’s made him rich.

 Yesterday, we were sitting at lunch.

 He had his back to the street as a car with a loud exhaust went by.

 Without turning or seeing the car, he said “SVJ.”

 It was indeed a Lamborghini SVJ.

 Two minutes later, he blurted out “Porsche 911 Turbo” as one went by – again without turning around.

 He can do this for hours.

 It’s like when Steph Curry shoots and turns around as the ball goes through the net.

 Pure conviction.

 Not coincidentally, he’s made a lot of money with a car rental business.

 The same thing goes for crypto.

 He’ll go on 20 minute spiels about some random niche crypto shit that I don’t understand.

 But he knows it like the back of his hand.

 Also not coincidentally, he’s made a lot of money in crypto.

 “Every time I follow my curiosity, I end up stumbling upon an opportunity.” – I just made this up but it sounds like something Warren Buffet would say.

 That line pretty much sums him up.

 He goes deep into whatever fascinates him and the money is almost a side effect.

 Nearly every successful person I’ve ever met is incredibly curious.

 That’s the cheat code.

 When you’re obsessed, you naturally put in the hours, notice the details, and see opportunities that others don’t.

 Over the past six months, I’ve watched an Artisan Lab member go down this journey of obsession.

 His name is Khesraw.

 He lives in Afghanistan – not exactly the place you’d imagine you can build a business online.

 But his curiosity for copywriting and funnels pulled him down the rabbit hole.

 Last month he made $27k in profit from just one client. ​

 The client is in the fitness niche, one of the hardest industries to scale.

 Yet since joining Artisan Lab, he’s applied what he’s learned to push their business past $200k/month… and he gets paid on a rev share.

 $27k.

 One client.

 From Afghanistan.

 If you want to feel bad about yourself (and learn a thing or two), watch his interview here. ​

 Ben

 ​
​

 ​

 ​
​

subject: If you don't know where to start, do this (CHC)
body:
Certified Hood Classic for you today -- Originally sent Dec 6,
2024

Enjoy:

“I don’t know where to start.”

Sound familiar?

I was combing through Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhvevxxktghv2xemlls9hkmlpo/8ghqhohoog2p9qak/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) applications this morning and found a theme.

There’s a question that asks applicants to share any roadblocks
they’re facing.

Around 90% of the answers are long-winded variations of “I don’t
know where to start.”

Whether it’s picking a business model, starting outreach, or
creating content…

Everyone finds a scapegoat as to why they aren’t taking action.

Perhaps a better way to describe this dilemma is “I want to be
told where to start.”

You feel stuck because you have an abundance of options and
you're not doing anything about it.

Any business model can work.

Any style of content can garner attention.

Any outreach method can get you a client.

But instead of trying something and seeing if it works, you
convince yourself that you need more information.

You’re left in a perpetual cycle of looking for more information
rather than actively creating data that steers you in the right
direction.

One thing I know for sure is that everything that’s ever been
created was done so from scratch.

Someone, like you, didn’t know where to start.

They tried something and it probably didn’t work the first time.

So they tried a different method, now with more data.

They do this over and over until they’ve crossed off many of the
“wrong” answers.

In doing so, they came closer to the answer…

And then it clicks.

Action creates clarity.

The route to success is found after knifing through tens,
hundreds, or even thousands of routes that don’t directly lead
you to where you want to go.

But they continuously reroute you until you arrive at your
destination.

And the once “directionless” version of you ceases to exist.

I can’t tell you with full certainty what will work for you.

Neither can anyone else.

We’re all different people with various natural advantages and
inclinations.

That’s life.

The ones who are rewarded are those who act despite the fact that
there is no universal rulebook.

You just gotta start moving and trust that you’ll find the
answers while you’re running the race.

There’s no way around this truth.

​Trust yourself, and you’ll be rewarded. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/v8ur65e8vghrhvevxxktghv2xemlls9hkmlpo/8ghqhohoog2p9qak/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)​

Ben

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

subject: The only guarantee I’ll ever make
body:
“In this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death
and taxes.” - Benjamin Franklin

Nothing… really?

Mr. Franklin, you're telling me that the 18 year old billionaire
can’t actually guarantee I’ll be driving a Lambo in three months?

What a scam.

Guarantees on coaching programs are like marrying a girl you met
at the club.

They sound pretty and look good.

But one day you’ll realize that you overlooked the stipulations
and this thing’s got problems.

The majority of money-back guarantees in the info-product world
are fake.

They’ll say, “Hit $10k/mo in 90 days or you don’t pay!”

What they don’t say is the laundry list of conditions.

You have to complete 72 modules, post 43 times, and sacrifice
your firstborn.

99% of people won’t qualify – and that’s the point.

To be fair, some risk-reversals are legit.

But I’ve stayed away from guarantees on Artisan Lab because they
attract the wrong kind of people.

I can guarantee that if you show up consistently and do the work,
it’s likely you’ll get results.

I can also guarantee if you do nothing, you will remain where you
are now.

That’s about it.

However…

There is one archetype that I can almost guarantee success.

Nearly every time this certain type of person buys from me, it’s
like they hit a 10 leg parlay.

Phillip hit $100k/mo in 4 months.

Dean hit $27k/mo in 3 months.

Modjadji and Javi hit $30k in 6 months.

The commonality is that all of these guys came from a sales
background.

Let me show you what that looks like in real life.

Yesterday, I interviewed our newest name on the list of
successful closers turn operators – Kareem.

He joined AL June 13th, making about $7-$10k/mo as a closer –
spending 8 hours a day on the phone.

His goal was simple: get off sales calls and make more money.

After two weeks in the program, he began outreach using the
strategies we teach inside.

And exactly 42 days after he joined, he got his first client:

​
In just two months, he 5x’d that business…

And made over $30k from his rev share.

Without taking sales calls all day.

​
​Watch the full interview with Kareem here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/n4u0kgn5wzhvhx6gwqes6h62qxkggclh72vgw/7qh7h8h99o6d20az/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rdHcuaW4vbEhQWGpn
)​

Death. Taxes. And closers becoming successful operators.

Ben

P.S. The price of Artisan Lab is increasing in about a week.

I’ll share more details soon, but if you want to lock in the
lowest rate, now’s the time to move. (

)​

subject: They're robbing me blind
body:
I might be the worst sports bettor of all time.

Without exaggeration I’m around a 10% hit rate over the last two
weeks.

This means I’m losing 90% of the time – which I guess is
impressive in its own right.

But last night, I took a safe bet.

The Eagles were favored by 7.5 points on the road against the
Giants.

That’s a big spread, meaning they were heavy favorites.

Rightfully so…

It’s the defending Superbowl champions, playing against a rookie
quarterback.

Philly is 4-1. New York is 1-4.

The New York Giants haven't won a Thursday night football game in
TEN years…

Until last night.

Not only did they win…

But they won by 17 points.

Seven. Teen.

And once again, I lost money.

Sports betting and business are similar in some ways.

You risk your dollars to hopefully get more dollars in return.

If you can predictably turn just $1 into $2 at scale, you’ll soon
be rich.

My goal with the people who invest into Artisan Lab is to do
exactly that.

They give me their hard-earned money and I help them turn it into
much more.

Apparently it’s working a little too well…

I got this message from Lorenzo the other day:

​
He paid me and then told me I undercharged him.

And that was before a recent addition:

subject: I was amost a normie
body:
The more I sit still, the faster I die.

I’ve had one panic attack in my life.

Let me rewind about five years and I’ll tell ya about it:

I’m a pledge in a fraternity.

My entrepreneurial desires have been buried under frat parties,
vodka, and bong rips.

Turns out that shit works wonders – especially if you’re trying
to convince yourself the normal path isn’t all bad.

I’m having a blast… as long as I don’t think too much.

Because when I start thinking, that’s when I start questioning…

“What happened to your dreams, Ben?

Where’s the version of you who didn’t want to settle–”

“Bader, we have a party on Saturday, make sure you’re inviting
girls.”

My fraternity brother said, snapping me out of my moment of
introspection.

Then I took a bong rip.

Although I was smoking regularly, this one felt different.

I was about to learn that weed and suppressed dreams are a bad
combo.

The best way I can describe what happened over the next couple
hours is this:

I felt trapped in my own body.

Every negative thought I disregarded over the previous few months
hit me at once.

My mind and body were screaming at me…

“YOU’RE GOING IN THE WRONG DIRECTION YOU IDIOT!”

I curled up into a ball in my dorm room and slept it off.

When I woke up, I wish I could tell you I got to work.

But that would be a lie.

This was one of many warning signals I got during this era.

It’s like I was living in an internal civil war.

My dreams were fighting against the lies I told myself in an
attempt to bury them:

“You don’t know where to start.

You don’t know what route to pick.

You don’t know what you don’t know…”

Stagnation was killing me.

But finally, I woke up.

I started following my curiosity.

One rabbit hole led me down the next.

And even though I felt like I was in over my head, I kept moving.

Next thing you know, I’m on zoom call pitching someone on a
service I learned two days prior.

That was a stepping stone. And it allowed me to get where I am
now.

Had I never overcome those thoughts that attempted to paralyze
me, I wouldn’t be here.

So if you’re sitting there overthinking, wondering if it’s “the
right time” – it’s not.

It never will be.

And that’s the point.

You move first, clarity comes after.

Here’s your excuse to start moving today…

The price of Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0ho8mx3rfmhznv7q44ilhndgov/l2hehmhllrwnlqt6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) is going up this Friday at 11:59pm EST.

If you want to get access to the same system others are using to
hit multi-5 figure months (see the P.S)...

Join here before the price goes up. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/d0u9zn358qs0ho8mx3rfmhznv7q44ilhndgov/l2hehmhllrwnlqt6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)

Ben

P.S. Some recent big wins over the past few days…

subject: I was amost a normie
body:
The more I sit still, the faster I die.

 I’ve had one panic attack in my life.

 Let me rewind about five years and I’ll tell ya about it:

 I’m a pledge in a fraternity.

 My entrepreneurial desires have been buried under frat parties, vodka, and bong rips.

 Turns out that shit works wonders – especially if you’re trying to convince yourself the normal path isn’t all bad.

 I’m having a blast… as long as I don’t think too much.

 Because when I start thinking, that’s when I start questioning…

 “What happened to your dreams, Ben?

 Where’s the version of you who didn’t want to settle–”

 “Bader, we have a party on Saturday, make sure you’re inviting girls.”

 My fraternity brother said, snapping me out of my moment of introspection.

 Then I took a bong rip.

 Although I was smoking regularly, this one felt different.

 I was about to learn that weed and suppressed dreams are a bad combo.

 The best way I can describe what happened over the next couple hours is this:

 I felt trapped in my own body.

 Every negative thought I disregarded over the previous few months hit me at once.

 My mind and body were screaming at me…

 “YOU’RE GOING IN THE WRONG DIRECTION YOU IDIOT!”

 I curled up into a ball in my dorm room and slept it off.

 When I woke up, I wish I could tell you I got to work.

 But that would be a lie.

 This was one of many warning signals I got during this era.

 It’s like I was living in an internal civil war.

 My dreams were fighting against the lies I told myself in an attempt to bury them:

 “You don’t know where to start. 

 You don’t know what route to pick. 

 You don’t know what you don’t know…” 

 Stagnation was killing me.

 But finally, I woke up.

 I started following my curiosity.

 One rabbit hole led me down the next.

 And even though I felt like I was in over my head, I kept moving.

 Next thing you know, I’m on zoom call pitching someone on a service I learned two days prior.

 That was a stepping stone. And it allowed me to get where I am now.

 Had I never overcome those thoughts that attempted to paralyze me, I wouldn’t be here.

 So if you’re sitting there overthinking, wondering if it’s “the right time” – it’s not.

 It never will be.

 And that’s the point.

 You move first, clarity comes after.

 Here’s your excuse to start moving today…

 The price of Artisan Lab is going up this Friday at 11:59pm EST.

 If you want to get access to the same system others are using to hit multi-5 figure months (see the P.S)...

 Join here before the price goes up. 

 Ben

 P.S. Some recent big wins over the past few days…

 ​

 ​

 ​

 ​

 ​

 ​

subject: Is Artisan Lab beginner friendly?
body:
Is Artisan Lab beginner friendly?

Someone replied to yesterday's email with that question.

Here’s my answer:

Beginner friendly – yes.

Idiot friendly – no.

Shaeis has been our fastest complete beginner (without any
previous agency or sales experience) to hit $10k/month.

It took him 67 days.

He came into AL and just got it.

He networked his way to a few clients within a month.

He said yes to things he had no idea how to do.

And had enough confidence to know he’d figure it out.

Most people aren’t like him.

If you’re brand new, it’ll likely take you a month to get a basic
understanding.

Then another month to actually feel confident in your skillset.

And then you’ll probably spend 2-3 months trying to sabotage
yourself.

You’ll half-ass your outreach, lack discipline, and think about
starting a different business instead…

But if you don’t quit after months 4-6, a turning point is near.

By then you'll have confidence in your skillset and know it’s
just a matter of consistency.

You’ll commit to showing up every day…

And soon enough the dominoes will start falling.

That’s typically how it goes for beginners -- with any business
model.

The first 4–6 months are about building the foundation and
reprogramming your mind not to quit or get distracted.

But I promise you, the longer road is just as rewarding.

Tomy joined AL back in July of 2024 with zero experience.

Ten months later he hit $10k/mo.

​
Today, he’s making his clients $62k on a single webinar,
traveling the world and creating content.

It took Ergun just six months to go from complete beginner to his
first $10k month:

​
The point is, yes -- Artisan Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/e5uxd6r2vzs7hlqnroes8h863g022blh26gvn/n2hohvhvvee4pdu6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) is beginner friendly.

But you have to bring effort, humility, and a willingness to
learn.

Plus you can't be an idiot who quits after sending one outreach
message.

If you can do that, we can teach you everything else.

The price goes up in a few days... if you're waiting, now’s the
time.

Apply here. (

Ben

subject: The hardest decision I made in business
body:
In 2022, I went through a bad breakup.

I had to look this girl in the eye and say…

“I’m too good for you now.”

She was my ride or die.

She watched me drop out of college, move across the country, and
truly become an adult.

But I had to kick her to the curb.

This “girl” was my marketing agency for local businesses.

We had a lot of firsts together.

First client.

First $10k month.

First $100k saved.

But in 2022, I realized we no longer aligned.

I’d outgrown her.

Still, I stayed longer than I should’ve.

And because of that, I hit an income ceiling for nearly a year.

Eventually I realized I was being an idiot and started replacing
my local clients with info product clients.

Here’s what happened to my income:

April 2022 - I made $5,100 with 7 clients.

July 2022 - I made $16,000 with 6 clients.

And by December, I made $31,000 with 5 clients.

I should’ve left that bitch earlier.

Nine months later I hit $100k/mo and bought my dream car in
November 2023.

Since then, I’ve watched many of my friends discover the same
gold rush.

Phillip “broke up” with his sales job to partner with info
businesses.

He hit $100k/mo in less than a year.

Sean (now a coach inside Artisan Lab) quit his SMMA to partner
with info businesses.

He’s worked with Charlie Morgan, Joel Kaplan, and just closed a
$1M/month client on webinars.

Sanjay went from running eCom brands and trading sports cards to
partnering with info businesses.

This weekend, he got a trophy at Jeremy Haynes’ mastermind for
scaling his client to $1M/month through ads and is taking home
over $100k/month in profit.

On Friday, Sanjay’s paid ads course is going live in Artisan Lab.
(

subject: The fastest $30k I ever made
body:
“How fast can I make money?”

That’s such a silly question that everyone always asks – myself
included.

But today, I’ll entertain it…

The fastest money I ever made put $30k in my pocket in 3 weeks.

It’s May, 2023.

I’m sitting in my 1 bedroom apartment with Sanjay, gambling on
horses.

Each of the past three months I’ve made just shy of $50k.

In between losing our bets, Sanjay shows me an Instagram story.

A luxury jewelry dealer with a massive following is launching a
coaching program.

I kid you not, this guy put his Venmo on his story to start
selling it.

No sales page, no application funnel, and no social proof…

Just his Venmo handle.

Clearly he has zero idea how to monetize his six figure audience.

Perfect.

Sanjay and I do some digging.

A minute later we find his phone number (it was literally on his
jewelry business website).

We call. His assistant answers.

I can’t remember exactly what we said but it was something along
the lines of:

“Hey we’re not actually interested in buying jewelry from you but
we saw you’re starting coaching. We run marketing and operations
for info-product businesses.”

Somewhat surprisingly, it went well.

The assistant told us they were looking for someone to help.

A few hours later we got on zoom with the assistant and the main
personal brand guy.

We pitched him on building out the whole launch.

Sales page, webinar, backend tech and set up.

$15k plus 10% of cash collected.

He says yes – but we only get paid (including the set up fee)
once everything's built out.

Let’s do it. If we get scammed at least it’ll make a good story.

We sprint to build everything.

Two weeks later it’s launch day.

We make $50k from one post and a couple emails.

Another $100k over the next few days.

And just like that, a $30,300 wire was sent to my bank account.

22 days from the time we cold called him to the time we got paid.

That’s fast money.

Will that happen for you?

Probably not. At least not right away.

But the only reason it could happen for me was because I’d found
the right vehicle – the same one that allowed:

Yahya to make $75k in a single month from his first client.

Khesraw to go from $500/mo with 10 clients to $30k/mo from one
(while living in Afghanistan).

Kareem, who hit $36k/mo in three months.

You can join the winning team here… (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/n4u0kgn5wzhvhx63pvqf6h62qxkggclh72vgw/3ohphkh330zq0dhr/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)

Or wait until the price increases tomorrow night at 11:59pm.

Up to you :)

Ben

​
​

​

​
​
​
​

subject: Ran out of time
body:
I just started a timer.

It’s been one of those phases where I inefficiently time travel.

Every day is flying by.

I write an email, get coffee and my day is over.

So timing myself here is an effort to fix that.

Awareness plus action seem to be the remedy for most problems.

Become aware of the problem and what creates it.

Take action in an effort to solve it.

Simple.

But this isn’t just limited to productivity issues.

This little recipe will fix your whole life.

If you don’t like the direction you’re going in – become aware.

Not just that you don’t like it, but what will happen if you
don’t change?

What habits aren’t serving you?

What beliefs are limiting you?

What daily actions can you take to move in a positive direction?

Once you get this stuff down, congrats.

You’re already further along than most people.

Now you just have to execute.

And that’s the hard part.

When I’m trying to be more productive or instill a new routine, I
follow one corny ass principle:

Make it easy. Make it fun.

That sounds like a slogan for a condom brand.

Discipline only takes you so far, but systems can carry you for
miles.

It’s kind of like being an NFL quarterback.

Even if you’re a great player – if you're not in the right scheme
talent only goes so far.

But an average player in the right scheme…

He can win a Superbowl – like Jalen Hurts and the Eagles last
year.

Build systems so you don’t heavily rely on how you feel

That’s where the awareness in step one really matters.

It’s not about journaling or overanalyzing your childhood trauma.

It’s just figuring out what’s not working, then building systems
that make the right thing easier to do.

Audit > adjust > execute.

And just like that, I’ve spent 27 minutes cosplaying as James
Clear here so I gotta go.

But before I do:

Artisan Lab’s (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/qdurvx4oenh7h4odworclh89p0rkkb4h4xo86/08hwh9h22e22qrhl/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
) price goes up tonight at 11:59pm EST.

If you book a call before then, you’ll still be locked in at the
current rate.

If you don’t, I will send the mafia after you.

Clocks ticking ;) (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/qdurvx4oenh7h4odworclh89p0rkkb4h4xo86/08hwh9h22e22qrhl/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)

Ben

P.S. If you’d rather skip the application and call process, go
here instead to get pricing. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/qdurvx4oenh7h4odworclh89p0rkkb4h4xo86/08hwh9h22e22qrhl/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi

subject: This isn't for you
body:
I’m gonna write this one for me.

Content gurus tell you not to do this.

They say, “make content for the audience! If you don’t tell them
what’s in it for them, they won’t listen.”

There’s truth to that statement.

But like anything in life, if you don’t enjoy the process you’ll
lose to someone who does.

I’ve always wanted to avoid making content I don’t like.

I cringe at the creators who fall into this trap.

Every video becomes a string of sentences arranged to get people
to buy their shit.

They use those corny AI-looking thumbnails and start to sound
like everyone else.

That’s because they’re only making content for the audience.

The best creators find the balance between making what their
audience wants – and what they want.

And ironically, that’s what resonates the most.

This lesson that applies to everything else in life:

If you’re only doing something for the end result – sales, views,
or validation – you’ll eventually burn out.

But when you do it because you want to, because you love the
craft…

That’s where you find magic.

You build for the sake of building.

It’s how you quiet the voice in your head that’s screaming at you
to express yourself.

When you try to please everyone, you lose yourself.

And when you finally stop trying, you start to sound like you.

So sure, this one’s for me.

But if you’ve ever caught yourself over-optimizing for what
others want instead of following your own curiosity…

Maybe it’s for you too.

Happy Monday,

Ben

P.S. The price of Artisan Lab (

We also just added 3+ hours of new paid ads training from Sanjay,
so if you’re inside already… you got a good deal.

If not, this is still a steal. (

)

subject: Become a construction worker
body:
I got cinnamon and honey in my coffee today.

What an elite combo that I’ve been sleeping on for far too long.

Anyway I have something to complain about.

Everywhere I go in Miami, all I hear is:

“Bzzzzzzz clank clank bzzzzzzzzzz.”

Then it stops for a sec.

And then “BZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ!”

That was my impression of a drill.

The construction is absurd.

There’s a new building going up on every block.

They’re all named after a random luxury brand with “residences”
on the end.

Dolce Gabbana Residences.

Mercedes-Benz Residences.

Cipriani.

E11EVEN.

Imagine visiting your friend and he’s like:

“Yeah bro I live in the Chrome Hearts Residences.”

To which you respond, “Ok sick I’m right by the Gucci Tower, see
you in 5!”

That’s basically what’s happening.

From my balcony, I have a birds-eye view of one of these
projects.

When I moved in about six months ago, it was maybe 15 stories.

Now it’s gotta be close to 30.

Every day these guys show up with hard hats and drills.

They do the same tedious work, floor by floor, day after day.

It looks insanely repetitive – but they’re building stories fast.

Business is quite similar.

You show up and do a few redundant, boring tasks.

If you can resist the urge to get distracted or start working on
a different project…

Eventually your tower will be complete.

This is a lot harder than it sounds because your mind is
typically not your friend.

You’ll get bored halfway up, convince yourself another project
will be faster, and start over from scratch.

Don’t do that.

90% of the time, the problem is not the business model – it’s
you.

YOU don’t have the discipline to be consistent when novelty
fades.

If you were actually a construction worker, you’d get deported.

Sorry that was insensitive.

But act like a good construction worker.

Drills. Hammer. Nails. Cat call women on the street.

Tower complete.

I’ll help you build your Residences here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/n4u0kgn5wzhvhx6em45a6h62qxkggclh72vgw/kkhmh6hnn0xow3il/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)

Ben

​
​
​

​

​

​

​

https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/n4u0kgn5wzhvhx6em45a6h62qxkggclh72vgw

subject: Proof you’re closer than you think
body:
I cold plunged yesterday.

It was my first time in a while.

Once upon a time, cold plunging was my entire personality – for
about two weeks.

I’d scoff at people who’d never endured the piercing feeling of
submerging their body in 45-degree water.

“What a normie, skinny fat, soy-boy loser,” I thought.

But for the past couple years, I’ve rarely done it.

Until yesterday.

And ironically this time, I was the normie, skinny fat, soy-boy
loser.

I was at this spa with a cold plunge right next to a hot tub.

I figured I’d start off with a few minutes in the cold, then move
to the heat.

Four seconds later I was running out of the water.

I imagine this is how they felt on the Titanic – except my
experience was worse.

Time for a new strategy.

I got in the hot tub for a few minutes, then went back to the
cold.

This time, it worked. I lasted about 5x longer.

The only problem was 4 multiplied by 5 is still only 20 seconds.

This pissed me off.

I used to sit in that damn tub for 10-15 minutes without
flinching.

So for the next half hour, I went back and forth between the two.

I could only last about a minute in the cold.

Each time, I thought I’d be fine once the first 30-second shock
wore off

Each time, I was wrong.

Alright, one more attempt…

I submerged into the frigid water telling myself:

“You’ve done this before.”

“The pain will subside, just breathe.”

“If you get out you’re gay.”

That last one really got me.

A minute in, I’m fine.

Two minutes in, still chillin.

Three minutes in, it feels like a hot tub.

I stayed in that bitch ass water for the next five minutes.

Now, I know you’re thinking, “wowwww Ben you’re so fucking sick
dude!”

Thank you, b.

Here’s the real reason I’ve told you this silly little story:

I only accomplished the goal because I knew I could.

I’d done it before – meaning I had previous data indicating it
was possible.

That’s why I was so stubborn.

I didn’t want to fail at something that I knew I could do.

So my question for you is:

If you knew that you couldn’t fail, would you ever quit?

Probably not, right?

Your success is guaranteed.

It might take three months.

It might take a year.

It might take five years.

But if you just keep getting back in that cold ass water…

Eventually it’ll feel normal.

People just like you have done it – it’s your turn. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/27ukzem834hoh84llggt3hgq5n744hghqekg3/x0hph6hee550z3t5/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)

Ben

​

​

​

​

​
​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/27ukzem834hoh84llggt3hgq5n744hghqekg3
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/27ukzem834hoh84llggt3hgq5n744hghqekg3
) | 2125 Biscayne Blvd, Ste 204, Miami, FL 33137

subject: This part sucks
body:
“I’ve got nothing for you, just keep doing what you’re doing.”

I said this to an Artisan Lab member on a 1:1 call yesterday.

We’ll call him Joe.

Joe already has a handful of clients and closed three new deals
this month alone.

He’s sending 10+ quality pitches per day and it’s clearly
working.

Despite this, he’s not making that much money…

Yet.

None of his clients are whales.

He’ll close a deal, get a $2-5k setup fee…

And then start undoing all the shit they were doing before.

It can take time to tear a business down and rebuild it the right
way.

Because of this, Joe isn’t making much from his rev shares.

What an annoying spot to be in.

Every time you get a client, it feels like you’re blue-balling
yourself.

You think, “this is the one! We’re gonna make millions together.”

Then you realize, “ohhhh, there are a lot of problems we’ll have
to fix first.”

But here’s the good news:

Joe is doing everything right.

He’s closing solid clients who are able to pay him setup fees.

(which is important because it means he’s not working with broke
retards).

He’s inches away from a big win – as long as he doesn’t get
distracted.

Here’s what I told him:

1. Maximize everything you can with your current clients.

Go above and beyond to get the best results possible.

Your goal right now is to find the winners you can scale with
long term.

2. Keep doing what you’re doing on outreach.

Don’t stop getting new clients until you have clear winners.

3. Be aggressive – but patient.

By that I mean understand you’re the epitome of that three feet
from gold meme.

You’re swinging the hammer over and over.

You know the gold has to be back there somewhere.

But you don’t know which swing will be the breaking point.

The only thing you can control is how aggressive you swing.

So if you’re in a similar spot to Joe...

You’re working hard, doing the right things, but getting a bit
discouraged…

You’re probably a lot closer than you think.

You don't need to change what’s working -- you need to double
down until the dam breaks.

Here’s what happens then:

​
Just keep going.

And if you want my personal help making the image above your
reality – go here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum20qvx9u6hp9o3q8b5h2p3xzllcnhv48px/dpheh0heep982pim/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iZW5iYWRlci5jb20vdGhlLWFydGlzYW4tbGFi
)

Ben

​

subject: This part sucks
body:
“I’ve got nothing for you, just keep doing what you’re doing.”

 I said this to an Artisan Lab member on a 1:1 call yesterday.

 We’ll call him Joe.

 Joe already has a handful of clients and closed three new deals this month alone.

 He’s sending 10+ quality pitches per day and it’s clearly working.

 Despite this, he’s not making that much money…

 Yet.

 None of his clients are whales.

 He’ll close a deal, get a $2-5k setup fee…

 And then start undoing all the shit they were doing before.

 It can take time to tear a business down and rebuild it the right way.

 Because of this, Joe isn’t making much from his rev shares.

 What an annoying spot to be in.

 Every time you get a client, it feels like you’re blue-balling yourself.

 You think, “this is the one! We’re gonna make millions together.”

 Then you realize, “ohhhh, there are a lot of problems we’ll have to fix first.”

 But here’s the good news:

 Joe is doing everything right.

 He’s closing solid clients who are able to pay him setup fees.

 (which is important because it means he’s not working with broke retards). 

 He’s inches away from a big win – as long as he doesn’t get distracted.

 Here’s what I told him:

 1. Maximize everything you can with your current clients.

 Go above and beyond to get the best results possible.

 Your goal right now is to find the winners you can scale with long term.

 2. Keep doing what you’re doing on outreach.

 Don’t stop getting new clients until you have clear winners.

 3. Be aggressive – but patient.

 By that I mean understand you’re the epitome of that three feet from gold meme.

 You’re swinging the hammer over and over.

 You know the gold has to be back there somewhere.

 But you don’t know which swing will be the breaking point.

 The only thing you can control is how aggressive you swing.

 So if you’re in a similar spot to Joe...

 You’re working hard, doing the right things, but getting a bit discouraged…

 You’re probably a lot closer than you think.

 You don't need to change what’s working -- you need to double down until the dam breaks.

 Here’s what happens then:

 ​ Just keep going.

 And if you want my personal help making the image above your reality – go here. 

 Ben

 ​

 ​

 ​

 ​
​

 ​
